I have compared these against the Jabra Elites as well as Bose Soundsport Frees and these win hands down. I also have a large collection of over ear headphones, and the sound quality from these are easily on par, if not better. Here is a subjective list of pros/cons: Pros: sound quality, noise isolation, noise cancellation, passthrough quality, touch controls, battery/quick-charging Cons: stock tips/fit, microphone quality, lack of multipoint (NFC workaround) Sound Quality : First off, the sound quality is amazing on these, but you need to play around with the equalizer. I had the most success by setting the equalizer to "mellow" and then adjusting from there. The reason for this is because the treble and highs on these are fairly harsh out of the box. Music with loud vocals or high hats, etc. are EAR PIERCING without modification. Toning down the high ends significantly gives are more flat sound. The funny thing is that I found the opposite to be true for the WH-1000XM3s (headphone version of these earbuds). Another benefit is due to their isolation/noise canceling properties, you barely have to turn the volume above 50% to drown out ambient noise. This lends itself to much cleaner sounds and lower distortion. Noise Isolation/Cancellation: For the Sonys, I found the noise isolation to be significantly better than any other headphones that I have tried. They offer both silicone and soft foam tips out of the box, both of which successfully isolate outside noise. However, they didn't offer the best fit, but I will touch on that later. As far as noise canceling goes, these are comparable, but not as foolproof as the over the ear version. Things like loud talking, water faucets, crickets chirping, are not drowned out as easily as other sounds. Things like fans, hums, etc. will disappear almost completely. What they lack in NC, they make up for in noise isolation. A dash of increased volume helps drown out any other noises. Passthrough Quality: Compared to the Jabra Elites, the passthrough quality is far superior. By default, the left earbud controls ambient/noise cancelling controls, and a long press and hold on the left earbud allows passthrough of outside sounds. The sound quality is very natural, with almost no hiss or hum. The Jabras on the other hand sound like an old tape deck with lots of hiss in the background and had a much sharper tone. Battery/Quick-Charging: Any reasonable person will have no issue with battery on these. I have worn them for multiple hours at a time and the battery has not even dipped below 70%. Toss them in the case for a quick charge and you are back on the go. Touch Controls: I am a huge fan of touch controls as they don't involve you pushing the earbuds any further into your ears, which I don't find that comfortable to begin with, coming from the comfort of Bose "stayhear" tips. The left earbud cycles through ambient/noise cancelling modes and also allows for passthrough. The right earbud handles play, pause, skip/previous track. For phone calls, it's two double taps to answer, and two double taps to end. To enter pairing mode for a second device, press the touch sensors on both the left and right units for about 7 seconds. You can swap the controls among the earbuds as well as change it to google assistant or no effect. The only thing missing here is volume control. I get around this on my Apple Watch so it's not a huge deal breaker for me. Fit: I have never been that big of a fan of earbuds, but had success in the past with Bose due to their "stayhear" wing tips. Unfortunately, you can't put similar tips on these as they would no longer fit in the charging case. That being said, the Bose tips don't offer much noise isolation. I have small ear canals and even with the smallest tips, these would eventually fall out after light jostling, chewing, walking, etc. To get around this, I bought some Comply tips that also fit the Sony WF-1000x (Comply TrueGrip Pro Memory Foam Earphone Tips for Jabra Elite Sport, Master & Dynamic MW07, RHA TrueConnect, Sony WF-1000x, Sony WF-SP700N - Secure Fit Tips with SweatGuard) and now these are fantastic! They have a great fit and won't fall out. I can barely hear myself typing at my computer with the volume hovering around 50-60%. Microphone Quality: For calls, the incoming audio is great, but I have had many people tell me that I sound robotic or static-y. I've had others tell me that I sound fine. It seems to vary based on the environment, but I am still testing. On the plus side, call sound comes out of both earbuds to give you stereo sound, something that the Bose Soundsport Frees do not offer. Lack of Multipoint (NFC workaround): Coming from Bose, the lack of multipoint was my biggest gripe. If you don't know what multipoint is, it allows you to not only pair to multiple devices, but to also connect to multiple devices (usually two) at the same time. You can play music from one source, say your phone, and then you can start playing music from another source, maybe your laptop, and the transition is seamless. You don't have to disconnect/connect to switch audio sources. This is not true for the Sonys. On the bright side you do have a couple of options. If you have an Android phone, you can hot swap by tapping the NFC logo on the earbud case. From Sony (on Android) "If you touch an NFC-compatible smartphone to the charging case while the headset is connected to another Bluetooth device, you can switch the connection to the smartphone (One-touch connection switching). However, the connection cannot be switched when talking on a headset connected to a Bluetooth compatible mobile phone. When an NFC-compatible smartphone is connected to the headset, if the smartphone is touched by another NFC-compatible Bluetooth device (headset or speaker), the smartphone is disconnected from the headset and connected to the Bluetooth device." If you have an iPhone, you can setup a shortcut that will easily get you to your bluetooth menu when you tap the case and then you are just one tap away. The shortcut is as follows: When NFC tag detected > URL - prefs:root=Bluetooth > Safari - Open URL. Using these approaches in tandem with the earbuds being hot swappable means that you do not have to disconnect/reconnect each time, as long as you have previously been paired with that device. You also get audio alerts saying "bluetooth disconnected, bluetooth connected" although it would be nice if it told you which device was being disconnected/connected on the audio prompt. Please rate this review as HELPFUL if you found any of the information of use! !

First, the positives: Excellent sound quality. I bought these to replace a pair of Jabra Elite 65t earbuds. There's a noticeable step up in sound quality, and I would not consider myself an audiophile. Noise cancellation is amazing, especially considering that these are earbuds. Now, the negatives: Insufferably bad connectivity issues if trying to use with two devices. If you plan to only ever use these with one device, then you might be fine. But I like to use my bluetooth earbuds and headphones with my phone and laptop, and for a device that costs this much, it should work way better. My Jabras and Bose bluetooth headphones both have no trouble maintaining a connection to BOTH devices simultaneously. Both sets (especially the Jabras) cost less than these Sony earbuds. The Sony earbuds can't be connected to two devices simultaneously. But even worse, they can't maintain a connection to the my computer if my phone is around (which obviously is always). I connect to the earbuds with my computer only to have it forcibly disconnect a few seconds later and reconnect to my phone. Sometimes, one earbud will stay connected to the computer while the other connects to the phone. The only workaround is completely unpair my phone and repair later, but I shouldn't have to do that. Maybe this will be fixed in a future firmware update, or maybe they'll even add support for being connected to more than one device at once, but right now it's very frustrating to use with more than one device. Otherwise, the fit for these is a little less secure that other bluetooth earbuds I've owned, but only in that I feel them wiggle a bit if I turn my head suddenly. I haven't had them fall out.

It’s not worth the money. Everything sounds good. But when u make phone calls with the earbuds the mic quality is horrible. Everyone kept telling me I sound like an alien or that I sound far away and they can’t hear me

column8: unstable ios app, no way to back up, won't stay connected, can't update firmware
column9: The Sony app for IOS is crazy; it constantly loses connection. You have to force quit and try again. The English text in the app is painfully stilted. A native English speaker should have written the text. There is a totally undocumented "DSEE HX" switch in the app. Other settings have an "I" information button, but not this one. But, the biggest issue is that these are almost useless for podcasts or audiobooks because there is no finger motion to "go back". you can stop & start playback or skip forward . But, there is no finger motion to skip back. There is no manual that I can find that lists all of the finger strokes/motions. There's a fine line between touching the earbud long enough to stop/start but not too long which launches Siri. There are optional voice prompts, but if you touch the earbud too often to change ambient/ambient sound control off/noise canceling modes, the voice confirmation stops, and all you get it a beep when changing audio modes.
Horrible headphones to workout in. They kept falling out during my workouts. The sound is horrible for the price they are selling at.

column8: Disappointing. Firmware update did not fix call quality.
column9: I took my time and watched a lot of YouTube reviews on this product before buying and after the 1.3.0 firmware update. Did a fair amount of reading too. I used the WH-1000mx2 on a daily and wanted something more compact with great call quality for on the go. The WH-1000mx2 have terrible call quality, hence my wait and research. All the reviews I came across say that the call quality is good, but for me it’s completely worthless. Trash call quality all around -choppy voice, zero mic pick up, and simply frustrating. Sound quality is good, but not better than my previous over the ear headphones. I figured at this price point, I’d have a better quality product that lives up to its hype. Will likely return.

The sound quality of these in ear noising canceling earbuds is amazing. I was skeptical to try an in ear headset as I had previously only found over the ear headset to be truly noise cancelling. What I like it the adaptive technology these Sony earbuds offer. They adjust to your surroundings allowing you to continue to wear them without concerns about the environment around you. The best part is they are small, but powerful. Pros: Great sound performance Noise cancelling is close to that of over the ear headsets with the bulk Comfortable to wear for long periods of time Great battery life Cons: not water resistant.

column8: Excellent with a couple glaring problems
column9: They only needed to address two things to make these imo the best buds. Some kind of ipv rating. No idea if they can handle a splash of water without it. The microphone quality isnt that great compared to other brands. At least it is quite poor compared to the jarbra 65t and soon the 75t.

I have tried many other but these are the one . I use these at work a lot on construction site safely do to the ambient sound . This feature is great do to the auto on feature in the app settings but it can be turned off if you don't like it. The sound from the treble to mid to bass is great complete sound all around. Very long battery life use all day best ever
First time buying wireless earbuds. Really impressed with these. Great sound quality and noise-cancelling.

column8: DO NOT BUY. IMPOSSIBLE TO CONNECT.
column9: DO NOT BUY. IMPOSSIBLE TO CONNECT. REQUIRES SEPARATE APP FOR HEADPHONES. Just completely unreliable. Have to take Apple EarPods along, which always connect. I have no idea why Sony made this so difficult to connect, but if you switch devices, you have a 20 minute, frustrating nightmare. I have gone back to Apple, which has inferior sound and no noise cancelling, but any sound is better than no sound.

column8: So wanted these to be the best... But was disappointed and dissatisfied
column9: Great for music and planes; not great for making calls. People keep complaining of a 'robotic voice' got so bad I had to stop using them for calls. I'm disappointed on that feature so I'm considering them an expensive set of wireless buds at this point. Another bad thing is that if you get them wet via normal perspiration (not from exercise) the rubber starts decomposing and a very pungent smell is emitted. I like the noise cancellation it's great (will never buy a non noise cancellation device again) good enough for planes and subways (you are not moving thus not giving Bluetooth a chance to disconnect, I'm worried of inner pockets in the winter) The fact it's a USB C interface is wonderful and the case holds about 3 charges . As for Bluetooth; it's great on my pixel 3; dissatisfied on my iPhone 11 pro; so unreliable they are relegated to my iPad pro and pixel; not realiable we when I need to make a call or have a consistent audio connection. I hope someone comes up with something better for the iPhone. All in all the cons beat out the pros on this device so I'm not planning on buying the next generation. Really wanted these be the ultimate best; but still more work is needed on iPhone specially, and a better grade of rubber. I can't believe I'm carrying both my old Jabra elites as a backup for when these go down... But the other ones at least are connection realiable

These are friggin legit, they too legit to quit. It’s like a surround sound concert in your head, like your head expanded and the space between your ears is a concert hall. Crisp like an apple, clear as a new window and bass for days. Oh yeah, the noise canceling is off the charts. Quit worrying about it and just click that add to cart button.

column8: Sony got everything right except call quality.
column9: I really like the deep rich sounds it has. Great noise cancelling feature and the ambient control was perfect. The fit was a challenge. I need smaller tips. But that's not the reason why I returned it. Sadly no matter what I did, I couldn't get the mic to work properly. The party on the other end of the call kept complaining about my muffled voice. They heard everything else except my voice. Maybe it needed a software update who knows. Not good for first time impressions.
These kept falling out of my ear. Connections were very erratic on my Samsung 10 phone. I kept losing connection with voice saying "pairing" in my ear. and they are huge! Very Disappointed!

column8: Not worth the initial sales hype.
column9: My Bose sport headphones block out as much sound and stay in place much better. I also can't say the sound quality is any better. It also might be the design, but they won't even stay in place on a simple walk. I will probably just store these in my travel bag as an extra set for long flights. I would never recommend these.

It's such an amazing thing: these earbuds are so lightweight and small that they almost seem magical. Yet here's the thing: there's something wrong with their connectivity or firmware. They are absolutely incapable of keeping a connection. They'll lose the link even if you set them to prefer stable connection, and they'll do it during pretty much any activity you imagine: stand up too quickly with the phone in your pocket. Walk through narrow hallways. I wish these could have been better :-/

I was really excited to get these. I am extremely happy I did. Becoming a nice little box up the case is awesome it’s black and like a rose gold really unique the headphones slip right into it and they’re pretty tight so they’re not just going to pull out the set up was pretty easy you can just download the app from the App Store it’s even got a guide to help you. Soon as I got them out of the box I put them to charge I put my timer sure enough 90 minutes they were fully charged. I have a new iPhone 11 Max turned on the Bluetooth and they connected right away didn’t have any issues with that. These are noise canceling and they’re awesome great sound didn’t have any issues while working out they didn’t fall out they fit nice and tight and ear comfy. The sound is awesome I’m truly happy with these. The battery life is pretty awesome too. Used him for over six hours before I had to recharge them really surprised. The overall quality sound noise canceling Bluetooth wireless these are awesome. I highly recommend..

Prior to these, I've used the Galaxy Buds, Airpods, and Jabra Elite 65T Active. These have the best sound quality out of the lot by far. Very deep bass, especially if you crank up the ClearBass settings in the Headphone app. I found the foam tips to be essential in getting a good seal. Noise cancellation works, but isn't nearly as good as the over-ear WH-1000XM3. Not surprising though considering that the WF-1000XM3 are in-ears. For its size though, there isn't really any other competition.

column8: Great sound, not at all good for gym or jogging
column9: These are the best headphones on the market for sound quality alone. The noise canceling is impressive for an ear bud and the the lows, mids and highs are well balanced. These headphones fall apart if you plan to do any activity beyond walking. I ordered these and the Powerbeats Pro and there is no comparison when it comes to comfort and functionality for the gym. The wf-1000mx3 fell out of my ears multiple times during a treadmill run, and when they weren’t falling out they felt like they were about to despite testing all earbud sizes, which was extremely distracting. Also the noise canceling creates an internal thumping sensation/sound when you run. The Powerbeats Pro clip over your ears and there is no chance of them falling off. They also have great sound although maybe not up to par with the Sony’s. Also the wf-1000mx3 have no sweat protection rating. Do not get these for the gym! Only for casual use.
Terrible headphones. I was very disappointed in the noise canceling and just the overall quality.

column8: If you have the budget, Best decision
column9: Although these run high in price they are easily the best purchase for wireless earbuds, battery life is unreal, and the sound quality is unmatched, soft but stong lows and clear but not ear piercing highs, smooth sound if your listening to music or adjust the EQ Via the app or media player to your liking but it does what you want perfectly

column8: Great sound quality and NC for a pair of earbuds
column9: Comes w/ all the bells and whistles! Sound quality much better compared to a pwr beats pro for instance as I got both. Can't compare to its bigger brother WH but for earbuds it's solid.

As others have noted these have some serious issues with Bluetooth. I'm using them now with my Pixel smartphone (this is an original gen 1 Pixel). This works but as noted, the pairing and connectivity seems a little less than 100% reliable. My original intent was to use these with both the Smartphone and a Windows laptop. As others have noted, switching back and forth isn't as quick as it could be because of manual connect/disconnect. However I'd say this isn't a complete deal breaker. What is a deal breaker is that the speaker function of the headphones currently doesn't work with Windows 10. I suspect Sony may be working on a fix as they had a firmware update out that they pulled back on Sept 24. Hopefully this gets sorted out as they are more or less not worth taking with me right now.

column8: Good for music...Bad for phone calls
column9: I pre-ordered these and received them as soon as they were released. The online reviews that I read made no mention of such terrible phone call voice quality. My end sounds OK but whoever Im speaking with hears me as a robot. More recent reviews prove this issue as ongoing.

column8: Sounds Quality Doesn't Matter If They Don't Fit...
column9: They DO NOT fit inside your ear. The way these are designed is terrible. There is no way to get the buds to stay firmly in the ear. They will constantly fall out if you tilt your head sideways or forward. This alone makes all other qualities of these ear buds pointless. The noise cancelling doesn't matter when it literally doesn't stay in your ear. And the different ear tips do next to nothing with regard to fit. Terribly overpriced for the lack of quality, all the YouTube influencers terribly wrong about these. I gave them to 7 of my coworkers and NONE of them were able to get a good fit. I highly recommend you stay away and get something that fits better.

These are wonderful, and noise canceling is excellent, as is sound quality. However, I was extremely disappointed in getting only 3.5 hours of battery life on my last flight (music and NC). This isn't enough. Yes, I can charge, but the battery capacity should be much higher. It's a real shame because these are otherwise excellent. Going back to my over the ear headphones (Sony). Also wonderful and a proper battery life. They just take up too much space in my bag.
It had no noise canceling properties
Poor noise cancelation. Mediocre sound quality.

I read a lot of reviews for different wireless ear buds after buying an inexpensive pair and being very frustrated by connectivity issues. I just got these and have been using them for a few hours and my initial impressions couldn’t be better. I will update the review as necessary but I want to say a few things about things I’ve seen in other reviews. 1. No headphone will block 100% of ambient noise. If that’s the most important thing to you align your expectation to reality. 2. I have had no issues with connectivity so far. I think people who have failed to mention what device they are using and if they have the most up to date version of the OS. 3. You do NOT need the Sony app to use the headphones. You need it if you want to tweak the features the headphones offer. 4. So far the app works fine on my iPhone 11 Pro Max running iOS 13.2. Maybe there are issues with older versions or Android devices. I haven’t tried these with my Samsung tablet yet. I really, really like the comfort and sound quality of these headphones. Looking forward to an upcoming trip to see how well they work on a plane and will update when I come back.
Wow!! !

column8: All hype, no substance. Returned mine after one trip
column9: After reading reviews I ordered them back in July. I received them early August when they were released. They lasted about an hour before the left earbud died and would not recharge. I returned them to Amazon and waited for six weeks for them to come back in stock. I tried them out again and committed to using them for a trip to Europe. After using them for 30 minutes on the plane I regretted my decision. I played with the app on my phone for an hour to try to get them to work. Bottom line, the noise cancelling is a joke and they have no low end. Changing the equaliser bar of 400 is a waste of time. I don't think these can reproduce a frequency below 1500. And the noise cancelling is inferior to anything I have compared it with. I have been using noise cancelling headphones for over twenty years, these are a step back from anything else I compared them with including the bose quietcomfort 20s and the 35s. I really wanted these to work. But they only lasted about 4 hours before they died. I fly across the Atlantic and the US on a regular basis, I need six or more hours, four hours is not enough. And the other thing I was looking forward to was being able to use them to answer a call, they work only if there is absolutely no background noise. My powerbeats pro are much better then these, So, short battery life, terrible frequency range, useless for phone calls unless you are in the morgue. Don't bother with them, they are useless. Final note, I have an phone 11, and the bluetooth connection would drop every 10 minutes or, the left one would go dead for 30 seconds, then come back, then the right one would drop. This would happen on a regular basis with the phone being within 3 feet of the earbuds.

column8: The aptX HD Bluetooth profile is not supported.
column9: If you expect to use these with high-end players, most supporting aptX HD, you will be disappointed. For phones and tablets, maybe. Returned.

column8: One Great Set of Ear Buds
column9: So I have always had a different Brand of EarBuds. A Brand that I could not only recharge the buds but it had a USB in the charging pod Soni was be able to charge my phone. The ear buds were way smaller to the point of almost unnoticeable so when I purchased these Sony Ear Buds I was skeptical to how bulky they are. With the different size ear inserts that come with them for different size ear canals you can barely tell you have them in your ear. They are comfortable and the size of them are not bulky at all. The noise cancelling is amazing. I used these to mow my lawn to test out what level of noise cancelling they have. I actually could only tell my mower was running by the vibration in the handle. Pretty good if you ask me! As far as making phone calls, I have some mixed reviews. Some people have said I am hard to hear when I use them but some have no problem hearing me at all. So I don't know if it's a setting issue in the app on my end or if it's an issue with the person on the other end. So Bluetooth connection is great. I usually put my phone in my pocket listening to my preferred music streaming app and with my old buds I would always loose connection. Well not with these things. They are flawless. I have been 30 feet away from my phone and still no connection loss. I definitely would buy these again and I would definitely recommend to anyone. They are "One Great Set of Ear Buds"

column8: Good Effort at Noise Cancelling Buds
column9: Sony has long been a trusted name when it comes to audio, so I was excited to try out these wireless earbuds. For years, I've used my trusty Bose QC20s, so I have excited to test out this Sony model to see if their noise cancelling can perform at a comparable level. First, the noise cancellation abilities are pretty good. Not "great," but "pretty good." My QC20s appear to rely less on a physical seal and more on active noise cancelling than the Sony pair, and they appear to perform slightly better in that department, but they are still decent. I mowed the lawn with them, and it drowned out the noise pretty well. I also enjoy that each earbud can be customized for controls (unlike other earbuds where both must be the same). Finally, the audio performance is top-touch, and they deliver some of the best soundstage that I have seen in this space. However, there are a couple of drawbacks. First (and most importantly), the fit of the earbuds is not ideal for me. Even trying multiple tips did not really improve this, and they become uncomfortable to wear after some time for me. I'll admit that I usually have trouble with earbuds, so only a minority of them fit me "well," but still, that is a consideration. Also, they are large. They don't really fit "flush" to the ear like other brands, and they look kind of silly as they resemble more of a Bluetooth headset look than flush earbuds. Still, it's obvious that Sony was trying to beat Bose to market on wireless, noise-cancelling earbuds, and they were largely successful in their effort.

column8: Not working with Apple iOS 13.1 update and Sony is slow to respond
column9: Purchased 2 weeks ago. Week one was solid...good fit, esp. with all the tip options, love the ability to customize EQ and ANC via the app, excellent noise cancelling on flights and in busy office. Sound quality is a tad bit "overproduced" compared to by previous Klipsch buds and over-the-ear cans, but livable given the customization and ANC. The second week has been a nightmare thx to the iOS 13.1 update. Dropping, no connection, and a bitrate conversion issue that makes music sound horrendous, esp. at high-frequency response. Sony is aware and when I reset my connection and reinstalled the app to try and alleviate, you even get a pleasant warning message saying they "are aware of the issues" with no ETA on firmware update, etc. Total crock, esp. at this price point. Sony - get your game together and address quickly. Esp. when your packaging label for these bad boys reads "Made for iPhone & iPad". Really? Hmmmm. I'd stay away from this product until this mess gets straightened out, unless you want $230 semi-functional ear buds.

I am totally amazed by the clarity of the sound. The sound quality of these in ear noising canceling earbuds is amazing. I was very skeptical coming in and I was sorely wrong. The lifetime of the buds is by far the best you're going to find. The battery life last so long and they fit perfect in my ears. They are easy to charge and just keep going and going. The plus is that when I am using them , it cancels out the noise around me and let's me just be with the music. I highly recommend these to everyone from audio book lovers to athletes.

column8: They sound great, when they hold a proper connection
column9: I want to preface this review with the very possibility that the issues I'm experiencing are likely only affecting iPhone users. There are many threads on reddit about BT connectivity issues specifically with the WF-1000XM3s, but AFAICT all with iPhone devices. The sound, when it works, is very good. However, when paired with my iPhone (which is 90% of the time), the audio will often sound muffled for about 5 seconds or so, and then return back to normal. This happens multiple times per track, and it happens no matter where I am (taking public transit, walking, sitting at home, sitting at my workplace office, it's all the same). Before Sony replies to this review by saying to set the Sound Quality Mode to "Priority on Stable Connection", yes, I've done that already. I believe the connection is weak and the bitrate is constantly switching between a lower quality mode and the highest quality mode, in hopes that the connection itself doesn't break. I think this might be something the iPhone controls, but I don't seem to experience this with my other earphones, leading me to think the iPhone end of the BT connection is fine, but the Sony end of connection is not. This has been happening to me on both iOS 12.4 (a stable, pre-iOS 13 version of iOS), and on iOS 13.1.2. I'll give it one more chance on iOS 13.1.3 (just released) before I throw in the towel. Note, I don't seem to experience this in-and-out-of-muffling with my MacBook. However, I bought these primarily for my daily commute, so this doesn't help me all that much. The active noise cancellation does not work very well with wind noise. On both the "Noise Cancelling" and the "Wind Noise Reduction" modes, I can hear a lot of wind noise. Other sounds do seem to be suppressed with ANC, but the amount of audible wind noise is almost a deal breaker. If the above-mentioned quality dropping issue wasn't present, I *may* still consider keeping these. Battery life is good. Even better is the charging case. They charge exceptionally quickly! But again, doesn't matter all that much if I have 100% battery life worth of muffled music. I'll update this review in a few hours after I try out iOS 13.1.3. But, I'm not keeping my hopes up, considering there was zero difference between iOS 12.4 and 13.1.2.

column8: Left ear bud would not turn on, charge, connect or reset on the first day. New set works great.
column9: This will be a two part review as the first pair I received was defective. Brand new, sealed and charged by my as described in the directions. The left ear bud would not turn on, charge, connect or reset according to the directions. I looked up all the videos on what the issue could be having them less than one day and returned them to Amazon. Obviously, I'm not happy. The will be the second review when I get the replacement: TBD... UPDATE: 2 days later. Amazon immediately sent a replacement. The new set of Sony WF-1000XM3 charged, and both ear buds worked as described. They paired with my iPhone X (fully updated IOS software) with no issue. They then showed up in the Sony Headphone App. The App shows the charge each ear bud has and lets you set all the controls. Its spars and constantly sends notifications for no reason, but a welcomed option to use or tweak the sound. The sound musically is super clean. Base is solid and I've had no drop outs or issues. The sound level is a little on the low end for me, but I have always blared music in my headphones, so its probably find for almost everyone else. Ear buds fit in ear (read the directions on how to insert them, yes there is a correct way) and do not slip or pop out. I have done 3 mile runs with these and had zero issue of sweat or the buds even moving in my ear. They stay in place. That said, I've had in the ear headphones for years, so I'm used to the feeling. So far they're a great set. I'll give these a month of use and follow back up with another update.

column8: ANC and Sound Quality is Okay
column9: Your not going to get true ANC unless they are over the ear. With this being said, I hesitated to purchase these but I did anyway to try them out. I have the WHXM3's for daily use and the Sennheiser MTW's for active use (gym, etc.). I wanted to give these a shot to see if the ANC was equal to its big brother and if the sound quality was better than the Sennheisers. The ANC is not equal to its big brother the WHXM3's and it shouldn't be. Your never going to get the seal like over the ear headphones although it is decent. However with the Sennheiser MTW's + Comply Foam tips, I felt the NC was a lot better than the WFXM3's. I could hear just a little less with the Sennys + Comply tips. I then put on the Comply tips on the WFXM3's and that honestly didn't help either. As for the sound quality between the WFXM3's and the Sennys, I definitely enjoy the Senny's better especially paired with the Comply tips. The tight seal of the Comply tips just enhances the bass better with the Senny's. The sound stage of the Senny's sound wider. Neither the Sennys or the WFXM3's are going to match the NC of the WHXM3's but they aren't supposed to. Another plus with the Sennys, they are splash proof and rated to be used at the gym while the Sony's are not. Taking the Sony's back tomorrow.

So I'll start off by saying that hands down these are the best truly wireless earbuds I have owned. Now for the price they absolutely should be, but in my opinion the noise cancelation makes them more than worth it. Sound: Quality wise there is not another pair of buds on the market that come close to this. The lows are low and don't get "muddy", highs are crisp and voices are clear even in complex songs. The huge selection of ear tips lets you find a perfect fit which helps to isolate these more and improve sound further. Fit: I've owned a lot of wireless earbuds and none of them fit like these do. Others seem to get loose when I wear them, but thanks to the shape and ear tip choices they fit more snuggly and naturally. They are supremely comfortable to wear and do not feel like they will slip out. Build: They're fine construction wise. For the price I wish there was aluminum on the outer part of the buds, but to be fair that could have impacted wear by adding extra weight. The biggest thing is no water/sweat resistance. I haven't had any problem at the gym, but it's a concern. Software: So there are some amazing feature here for wireless earbuds. First of course is Sony including the same noise canceling chip from their flagship OTE headphones. You don't get quite the same isolation, but it's mind blowing how good it is on something so small. The touch controls are sensitive as well. None of this would matter without a great app and interface to use all of these features. The Sony app is phenomenal. The EQ settings and different settings for noise canceling (staying, walking, running, transit) make it useful for any situation. Bugs/issues So I've only encountered a few. The biggest by far is that sometimes the earbuds just don't recognize they've been taken out of their charging case when only one is removed. This is problematic since I use this for hands free calls in the car. I'm sure it's a simple software fix so I'm not overly worried. My second issue is that you can not adjust volume with the touch controls and they only can perform one function. Finally the case stains so easily. I have the silver ones and just from being in my pocket (I work indoors at a cellphone store) it's gotten dirty because of the soft touch plastic used. Conclusion: These are phenomenal headphones. They have some issues that I am confident will be remedied with software, but if you want the best this is it.

Sony's WF-1000XM3 truly are "Industry Leading" as they claim. No other wireless headphones sound nor look as good as these. The gesture support and controls are phenomenal and incredibly accurate. The noise cancelling is great, better than some of my over-ear headsets. I love that they snap into their charging case magnetically so that you know they're connected all the way. Compared to Apple's AirPods, these look AMAZING. No weird stick things falling our of your ear. The color even makes them look professional, so no one knows if you're listening to music or sitting in on a business call. I recommend these to anyone who can afford them.
No need reviews.. Sony quality
Works ok if you're sitting still but if you move or walk anywhere then one earbud or the other constantly cuts out

column8: Sad to have to give these a negative review
column9: 1. Sound quality when they work, I would rate as above average to good. 2. Numerous short drops/skips on various paired devices tested. 3. Lack of volume control. 4. Noise cancellation is FAIR. 5. When paired with my Samsung Galaxy 8+, and other devices to a lesser degree, I need to set volume to MAXIMUM level to even hear anything. I have excellent hearing, and do not have this problem with other ear buds, or headphones. Verdict: I had high hopes for these, and honestly wanted to like them. Unfortunately they DO NOT deliver as I had hoped. While this is my personal experience, I'm happy to see that they have met with success with others. I suspect that this may relate to variables related to each individual set produced or less likely what they pair with (unlikely in my case as I tried with multiple devices.
Pretty Cool

Super good at connecting to my phone, also great at fighting nearby interference and re-finding my phone. Solid battery life. A bit hard to get total fit, I may need 3rd party inserts or something. Great job by Sony, worth the price if you live in the city.

Does not Bluetooth pair without taking the earphones out of the box repeatedly. Towards the end it wasn't working at all. That is probably a fault that could get fixed IF the Sony website didn't make it impossible to find where you can return the goods. Be very clear. You can't give these back via Amazon if you buy them on Amazon as I did. Amazon will direct you to the Sony website and that makes you go around in circles. It's a total joke.

These earphones are super-comfortable in my ears, and have an excellent sound quality. Installing the Sony Connect app was painless and enabled me to customize the adaptive sound control; enable headphones to pause when I take out a headphone (Super convenient!) The initial process to connect the headset to my phone was easy, though when I wanted to pair them to my laptop a few weeks later, I had a bit of trouble. The directions are not self-explanatory; and the directions in the help section online simply told me to, “ Pair them” but without the technical instructions. I dug deeper in the help guide, and under “Pairing Cannot Be Done” found the following: “When you pair a second or subsequent device, put the headset in both ears, then hold your fingers to the touch sensors on both the left and right units for about 7 seconds to enter pairing mode.” Voila! Success. Though I would find the recharging case to be too large for pockets, I find it very convenient to carry and find in my purse. The recharging case is remarkable, by the way. When I know I’m going into a meeting, I put them in the case, and I’ve almost never run out of battery. The sound quality is excellent, and the noise-cancelling is top-notch, and a feature you don’t often find on truly wireless headsets. I have enjoyed both music (perfect for both classical and rock; and my ebooks and podcasts are crystal clear.) I do find that sometimes the activity detector will get confused, and it will spontaneously change to ambient or pass-through mode. But I think it is still a very useful feature, to have the headphones automatically change its levels when it deems necessary. The choice of eartips is nice, but almost overwhelming.. though I’d rather have the variety than not have them fit! Do try a few to find your most comfortable situation. Overall, I am super-happy with these headphones, and anticipate them working for me for years!

column8: Was to good to be true. Never trust tech youtubers.
column9: 1: bluetooth issues on my galaxy note 10 plus 5g 2: valume is too low 3: noise cancelling is okay but not great 4: battery only last about 3 hours on a regular use 5: sound quality is good but not the best The only thing i like is the design, fitment and app settings. Ended up sending mine back for a refund.

Design: The battery case is satisfactory. LEDs indicate charging status and the materials that construct the case are pleasant to handle. However, it can be difficult to fit the earbuds case in smaller pockets due to the size. Setup: The earbuds have you download the app for setup and configuration. The setup process was quick; only requiring a few taps. Comfort: The earbuds come with a variety of tip options including silicone & silicone/foam hybrids across several sizes; I find the hybrid option to be best. The weight of the earbuds is not an issue unless I wear them for many hours consecutively, and even then discomfort is minimal. Features: The active noise cancellation (ANC) performs well for earbuds, especially while traveling. The iOS app allows you to configure the ANC based off the situation you are using them for (Adaptive Sound Control) however I ended up turning this off as I found it to auto-adjust at inappropriate times. The app sometimes states earbuds are not paired, despite my phone being connected with sound outputting to the earbuds. Otherwise, the app has a wide range of features and is easy to navigate. The earbuds have touch controls which I found frustrating. While the ability to have touch controls is useful, the earbuds are small which makes inadvertent touches common, so I disabled this feature. Battery life: I didn’t test them long enough to see the total play time, but I found that after several hours they remained more than 50% charged. When I was ready to take a break, I would pop them back into the case and they would actively recharge until I was ready to use them again. Sound quality: These do a great job of making music sound crisp & clear. My only complaint is that for bass-heavy music, the bass levels are not as loud as I’d like even with the EQ adjusted. However, every other instance sounds great. Phone calls also sounded clear however I have been told that I was not being heard well by the other party occasionally. Final thoughts: The WF-1000XM3s are a great set of earbuds have many features I want in an audio product. The sound quality is great, the app has a variety of features & the battery life is phenomenal. My only complaints are: app glitches (fixed with future updates? ), a lack of any water resistance (not great for working out), the finicky touch controls, and the mic sometimes causes others to not hear me well. Overall a very good set of earbuds that I expect to get better with future software updates.

Sony nail it! The noise cancellation is amazing and reach much more than my expectation. Sound quality is decent and with the marvelous NC, you don't need to raise the volume high to avoid any unwanted surrounding sound. The best NC earbuds in transport, subway, bus.... you name it. The battery life is very long. Size is acceptable and the earbuds are firm in wearing. If you really focus on NC, you cant miss this product.

column8: The reference for wireless noise cancelling
column9: My reference for comparing headphones include Sennheiser HD650 overear headphones, Bose Quietcomfort 20 wired earbuds, Apple BeatsX in-ear bluetooth. Pros: - Excellent audio quality. Not artificial/electronic sounding like the Bose. - Pairs quickly when removing from case, and pauses music when removing one of the earbuds - Battery lasts a long time - Phenomenal noise cancelling ability, possibly better than the Bose earbuds - Ambient listen mode, especially adjustability depending on situation (hear surroundings when walking vs. in office where you might want to only partially tune out coworkers vs. commuting on public transit in complete isolation) - Many ear tips to choose from for each ear, from foam to silicone. Relatively comfortable for an in-ear style headphone. - USB charging, so can charge from phone if really in a pinch. Cons: - No volume control on earbuds like my prior bluetooth headphones - Accidentally touching controls when removing or adjusting earbuds - Charging case rather large for pocket - Packaging is rather cluttered appearing, but typical of Sony's marketing team trying to advertise every single feature - Comfort still loses to Airpods or Bose eartips Who should get this: - GREAT for those who require the best noise cancellation and sound quality in a truly wireless earbud - NOT for people intense working out since its not sweatproof (ie Beats or Jaybirds) - NOT for people who want to feel like you're not wearing anything (ie Bose or Airpods)

So far I'm pretty impressed with the 1000XM3 earbuds by Sony. I didn't expect the noise canceling to be as good as it is. I have had many different brands that claimed to be noise canceling but I could still hear background noises. I have ADHD really bad and in order to focus I have to get rid of all outside noise. I do have a small issue keeping them in my ears even with the smallest earbud pads. I like that all of the controls are done by touch, except if I'm doing an adjustment of the earbud in my ear I may accidentally skip a song, pause or something. The only thing I don't care for is the size of the case. It's bulking and doesn't fit in my pants pocket real well. Other than that I really like the earbuds and will continue to use them.
Only bad thing is mic is located far from the user mouth. Mic can be considered non functional except in a quite-indoor situation.

Sony knows hardware and sound. This sounds perfect, you will not regret this as headphones. The problem is software. Setup was very difficult.The interface is very confusing. The app just cannot update the headphones with iOS 13.1, as themselves announced. But the sound, it's so good.

column8: The Best (Only) True Wireless, Noise Cancelling Earbuds
column9: I was hesitant initially to purchase these, since they did not offer Windows 10 support. I was trying to replace my aging Bose QC20s with active noise cancelling. Finally, with update 1.3, these ear buds have gained windows 10 support. While there are some current issues with the rollout for this update, any new earbuds should have the 1.3 update as mine did. Pairing with my surface pro is easy, and you just need to press both ear bud buttons for 7 seconds to enter pairing mode. I bought a cheap USB Bluetooth adapter for my desktop, and they work flawlessly there too. Signal is strong, sound quality is incredible, and I can walk a good 15-20 feet away without any break in the signal from either laptop or desktop. Connectivity with my phone is also very good, though at times there are split second breaks between one or both earbuds. This is usually when there is a lot of nearby interference, but this is a rare issue and doesn't really bother me much. Hot swapping between phone and windows computer could be a little more seamless, but holding down the buttons for 7 seconds and then reconnecting the desired device isn't a huge deal when you consider all these buds have to offer. Sound quality is phenomenal, easily as good as my QC20s (the reference point). Noise cancelling is actually better than my QC20s, which I never thought I'd see since they were incredible already. The fit is comfortable, and I don't really get ear fatigue after several hours. They stay snug even with head movements. One thing I will say is that you have to make sure the seal is good. Initially they didn't seem very good at noise cancelling, but twisting them back and forth, up and down, side to side while pushing them in further made the seal perfect. Highly recommend these.

I've been in the market for a pair of truly wireless earbuds for a while now, so I immediately jumped at the opportunity to try these new earbuds from Sony. Sony is a long time industry leader audio industry so I had high expectations for these, and they did not disappoint. The earbuds come in a nice premium package which includes the earbuds, charging case, USB-C cable, and a variety of ear tips. They feel comfortable and secure in the ear canal and I haven't once been worried about them falling out. The battery case is a little on the large size, but can still be pocketed. The earbuds satisfyingly snap into the case and are held in securely with strong magnets. The case is NFC enabled, so pairing them to my device was as simple as touching the case to my phone. These earbuds to an excellent job with noise cancellation so I feel immersed in my music even in noisy areas. The Sony Headphones app has a setting to dynamically adjust the amount of noise canceling applied based on the type of environment you are in. If it detects you are in a quiet environment it scales back the noise canceling to allow more ambient sound through. If you prefer to adjust it manually, or just leave the noise canceling on at all times that is an option as well. The equalizer settings in the app can be tweaked and adjusted freely to your liking, and you can have a much or as little bass as you want. They also support quick access to the Google Assistant on Android phones, which was a pleasant surprise for me since I use the assistant regularly. The battery life on these is amazing. They will last for around 6 hours on a full charge, and if you should get low on power the storage case will charge them for up to another 18 hours. These should easily last you all day without having to worry about needing an outlet. I would definitely recommend these truly wireless earbuds to anyone who's looking for a quality earbud with long battery life and the freedom of life without wires, but please be aware that they are not water resistant if that is a factor for you.

The WF-1000XM3 earbuds are very comfortable to wear and has excellent noise cancelling quality. All the functions are touch controlled and very easy to operate. I use it daily during my commute to office and the earbuds stays perfectly in my ears. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality truly wireless earbuds.

I was so exited to get these I really wanted to love them every youtuber and publication sang it's prasises. But they were terrible. They were so uncomfortable they never felt secure and they would rub up against my cartilage and really irritate it. There Chucky huge and heavy. But fine that's all subjective but even the actual use of them is poor. When you turn off the noise cancelling to save battery when your in a quiet place they make a loud humming noise that NONE of my other earbuds make. It's like there forcing you to use ANC or making a noise when it's not on to make it seem like noise cancelling is doing something. Because I didn't even feel like the ANC did much. Really sucks cause I was so exited for these cause of the reviews from publications.
Very nice earbuds!! !

These earbuds are one of the better if not the best sets I've owned. The packaging is very nice, and the case had a premium feel. The size of the case is slightly larger than most but not overly. Battery life is amazing and reserved top up you get from your case is sufficient to get me through a few days of listening with moderate use ( 20-30 min here and there to and fro to work). Sound quality is amazing, but you kind of expect that from Sony. Noise cancelling is awesome and I like that it has a auto detect feature. The only earbuds I currently use and I have them paired with 2 devices right now.

Spectacular sound from Sony, I have used these buds for a few weeks and the battery life is fantastic I listen about 2 hours a day to music or ebooks and they haven't let me down with even volume no matter the charge level. The carry case is a little bigger than I would have hoped to carry in a pocket but its not a deal breaker as I said previous, excellent battery life so no need to carry the case. The touch features are smooth on both ear buds. I really love the Quick attention mode and wearing detection, as I can converse without the hassle of interrupting the speaker by touching the ear buds to stop music, this feature worked flawlessly. The biggest plus is the noise cancelling technology ...others "say" they cancel noise but in reality they do a spotty job, NOT these Sony earbuds they worked perfectly every time including in a call center I visited (really needed it too). A perfect Ten, great job Sony.

column8: Ambient sound is great and works better than competitors.
column9: I've had the chance to review the Sony wireless noise canceling earbuds for the past 2 weeks here is my honest review on this item. 1st of all the thing that you notice about these earbuds is the case it's huge and shaped just like Sony's styling should be wary priesteen very elegant however it has a bulk to it now I try to find out why so much bulk so I was wondering does it have wireless charging on the case gathers no does it have any extra features the answers know how about the battery know it's comparable to other battery cases however the lighting effect that the front case gives is out of some kind of scifi movie looks beautiful I think the beauty of the case justifies and lets me go past how about how big it is. now on To the earbuds/earpods (I like the latter) the Sony WF 1000 XM3 is a mouthful to say but Sony has got something here with its ambient sound That the Competition just doesn't Have correctly in the bag as of yet. Again Sony is one of the originators of putting sound in our ears so I think it justifies the fact that Sony should be very good at trying to give us the best features when it comes to hearing anything that Comes from their devices and it goes to show with these sony earpods. The app once downloaded to the device on your phone it has many features that you can play around with to perfect that sound Sony does a very good job of giving you choices through the app and the app works seamlessly and it's very easy to connect the ear pods with the app. I received about 3 hours with the ambient sound on which worked flawlessly with no issues had no issues flipped true the options and see no lag I felt like they have this ambient sound mode the best so far with all the ear pods I've tried so far Charging it was a breeze also USB C is what the charging case uses I wish it had wireless charging it would have been a great feature then these ear pods would have been my choice, sadly they don't have wireless charging so I have to worry about carrying on around a wire with me everywhere I go. The case does say state 18 hours of recharge I was unable to test out the full 18 hours but I did charge twice and it gave my ear pods another 10 hours before I had to recharge the case and there are parts over all it's a great fit and finish it's what you would expect in sound quality for Sony and it's what other Designers of earpods should strive if they want to make something with this quality of sound.

column8: wanted to like them, but sigh, had to return...
column9: Incredible sound quality and very good nose cancellation, but Bluetooth connection just wasn't reliable enough and the mic want good enough (callers complained). Sorry!!! I was really excited but had to return these.

column8: Very cool. I Don’t use my Bose anymore
column9: Just got these and I’m really impressed. I’ve had 2 pairs of Bose QC-30s (my previous favorite) and I’ve been waiting for something noise cancelling that doesn’t have a neck band and isn’t enormous. Maybe in 5 years we’ll look back on these and think they were enormous, but for now - they’re pretty small! ANC works good, ambient sound mode is weird! Not sure when I’d use it, but it’s a cool feature. Nice looking charging case too. They feel high-end.

column8: The charging case is a good size dispute what reviewers say. Great charging case
column9: I use this to watch shows on the train. The best I can say about the noise cancellation is that it somewhat noticeable. I’m still working out the fit. There are positions I can achieve by holding them that improve the sound greatly, but I have not been able to maintain that position without holding the buds in place. Still trying out other tips.
Sound is great, the noise cancelling is outstanding also. I like the bass. U can adjust more or less bass. I like this earbuds!

I was so excited when I received my Sony WF-1000XM3 Noise Canceling Earbuds. I'd been researching over the ear noise canceling headphones, but was hesitant due to their size. I was hoping these would be my unicorn. They sound amazing, but I unfortunately can't use them. Although they come with ear tips in a variety of sizes, I couldn't find the right fit. I thought I'd fitted them correctly, but was mistaken. I know I put them in my ears properly. I even double checked by watching an instructional video. I'm remodeling my bath, so I figured that this was a great opportunity to try them out. I popped them in my ears and got to work. At first everything was fine. Then I swung the sledgehammer. The left earbud flew out. I tried many times, with a variety of ear tip configurations, but I was not able to get them to fit securely. I then decided to try them without doing any physical activity. The sound and noise canceling are excellent. While listening to my music I received a phone call. I asked the caller if the sound quality was tinny and she said it sounded just fine. I like everything about these earbuds. Except the fit. They sound awesome, the phone call quality was good, the noise canceling feature worked well. The charging case fits in my purse nicely. I wanted to love these so badly. I tried on my husband's new earbuds that he purchased from a major brand that also manufactures phones. They fit wonderfully. But the sound was terrible. I think the sound of the Sony earbuds spoiled me! If they fit you, I recommend these earbuds. I haven't given up yet. I plan to try more ear tips until I find something that works.

These are ok. There is a learning curve on these though. That is one of the problems with these. I don’t want to fiddle around with ear buds. I want to put them in, turn them on, and boom - noise cancellation and great sound. You can’t do that with these. You need an app, you need to adjust from that app and turn stuff on, turn other stuff off,... If you don’t set them up for you they will do things that you don’t want them to do like turn off or dump noise cancellation. Battery life is off. On a flight from Houston to Hartford one bud dumped down to 20% while the other was at 50% the charging case is nice though.

Awesome headphones. I upgraded to these from my Bragi Dash headphones. The sound quality is graeat, I can set my phone down and walk across the house without the Bluetooth signal breaking up. Adaptive noise cancelling works well. I really like that either earbud can be used on its own, that was a problem I had with my bragi dash headphones.

These are the best earbuds that I have ever used, and a nice upgrade from the Bose QuietComfort 20 buds that I have used for years. Good base quality too! Works beautifully with the Sony Headphones Connect app for the iPhone.

Wanted to love these so bad but some serious issues with connecting to windows 10 pc's even after the firmware update. Too much stutter and audio gaps. Fit was good, and quality when using with an iphone was great but for the price it should sound good on ALL of my devices.

column8: Probably the Best Earbuds you can Buy right now
column9: These earbuds exceeded my expectations in design, function, and extra features. I knew coming from Sony they would undoubtedly have great sound, but I was skeptical as to just how good the Active Noise Cancelling could be. I knew they had customizable touch control, but I didn’t know just how useful that would be and have been blown away by the Google Assistant integration. First, lets talk sound. These Sony Earbuds are everything you’d expect in higher end earbuds and more. The Sound quality is excellent right out of the box. Whether listening to audiobooks or music or watching a movie, you get the high quality sound you would expect from Sony. But they didn’t stop there – Sony gives you an app that allows you to fine tune the sound to your own personal taste including a 5 Point Equalizer with several presets and several custom memory slots as well as a separate Clear Bass optimizer. I was super excited about these earbuds because I’m not a huge fan of over ear headphones – I wore them on flights because I wanted the ANC, but the thought of accomplishing the same thing with just earbuds was a great proposition. And Sony did not disappoint. These little buds do an amazing job of cancelling out ambient noise. If the Bose over-the-ear cancel out about 95% of the sound, I would say these earbuds cancel out about 85% of the sound, which is an amazing accomplishment for something so tiny. And again, Sony doesn’t just give you and on/off switch for ANC – they built in a lot of functionality so that you can have full ANC or you can adjust it to allow more or less ambient noise to pass through depending on your situation. There is also a tap and hold function that will turn it off as long as your pressing on the left earbud so you can talk to someone (it also pauses whatever your listening to or watching) and then once you let go your media starts playing again and ANC turns back on – brilliant! Also, you can set it so that removing an earbud from your ear automatically pauses your media as well. Having Google Assistant build into these buds is great! You can give any voice command you want Google to handle which of course is anything from making a call or sending a text to opening an app or skipping tracks. Sony really though through everything with these earbuds. They didn’t just put out some of the best sounding earbuds with the most amazing active noise cancellation you could imagine in such a small package – they though through all the little things to give you every feature you could possibly want in wireless earbuds. Way to go Sony!

I was really excited to try these ear buds. I have the Sony over the ear version. I hoped that they were able to fix the connection issues with the ear buds. I believe I have had more issues with the earbuds than I do with the over the ear headphones. I am using apple platforms. The connection seems to differ each time I use them. There are times I put them in & they connect right away. Others I have to manually go to the Bluetooth menu & select the device. I have only been able to get them to work with a phone call one time. So far I have been really disappointed in the performance.

column8: Simple setup, reliable, long battery life, top notch sound quality
column9: I am aware that not every person's bluetooth experiences will be the same, and whenever 'truly wireless' earbuds come into play, sometimes headaches are involved. So far? That is not the case with my pair of Sony WF-1000XM3. Pairing over NFC (and then re-pairing 'manually' just to do it) were both a breeze and worked the first time. The Android app that manages the settings does seem necessary, but that is quite OK with me. I haven't tried pairing these earbuds with anything other than my Sony Xperia 1 phone. The touch controls seem to work so far, at least as long as my own hair is not in the way of the touch surface, and I follow the suggestion from the manual that I grip the sides of the earbud with thumb & middle finger, before tapping with my index finger. (It is simpler to do than it is to write it out!) I briefly tried the different ear tips, and maybe someday I will try the foam ones again, but the rubber tips seem to let me put them in my ears more quickly & comfortably, especially on days when I have to take them out multiple times. As for the weight, I admit I was skeptical, but after wearing them around town, don't worry, they're not going to fall out, and they don't seem heavy or fatigue my ears. And while I didn't jog around with them in, I did tramp all over the place, hopping up flights of stairs, rushing to get in subway cars, that sort of thing. In fact, their small size is almost a little bit of a negative (I suppose?) -- multiple people have tried to talk to me not realizing I am wearing something that specifically is blocking me from hearing their speech; they can't see them, and I can't hear them! Although perhaps that's the point of these, so long as you have noise-canceling enabled, instead of the ambient sound control turned up. Which, by the way, is pretty good. Not hearing-aid levels of sound transmission, but not bad at all! It'll do! The battery life is supposed to be six hours with NC on, and eight without. I have yet to test that; I haven't had them playing music or audiobooks or what have you for that long without taking them out and putting them in the case. I do appreciate the case for keeping (magnetic!) track of them as much as for a charge top-up. Not really hardly any complaints about these at alll, except when I first unboxed them, I had to look for the NFC point on the headset -- it is on neither earbud, it is on the charging case. Specifically, seems to be on the front right above the charging indicator light, under the front lip of the lid. The little white logo is not visible unless you open the lid first. I didn't see it at first. So there you go! Unabashed five stars! I intend to use these every day until they just totally fail to take a charge. I hope that won't be for a few years!

column8: Glitchy with Windows 10. Microphone voice call quality is poor.
column9: Update to this review: Sony released version 2.0.2 of the firmware for the WF-1000XM3 earbuds a few days ago. This allows me to pair the headphones with Windows 10, but they still have problems: Glitchy Audio on Windows 10: When listening to music on the WF-1000XM3 earbuds, I hear intermittent glitches in the audio. These glitches are similar in sound to the skips in a record. These glitches come at random times, but are occurring at a frequncy of aproxximately every 30 seconds to a minute, though sometimes more frequently than that. I'm sure that the problem isn't the computer, because when I switch to listening through my other earbuds (a pair of Jabra Elite 65t units), the music is glitch-free regardless of which playback source I'm using. I'm also sure that the problem isn't wireless connectivity, because I'm sitting within three feet of the computer. When paired to my iPhone, there are fewer issues (less frequent glitches) but there are still some glitches occasionally. Unable to pair successfully to two devices at once: When I pair the WF-1000XM3 earbuds to both Windows 10 and to my iPhone at the same time, I'm not able to use them correctly. They do not connect seamlessly with both devices. My expectation is that I can listen to audio on the computer, and then if a phone call comes on the iPhone, then it it should switch automatically to the call on the iPhone. This does not work. I can either connect actively to one device or the other. Whereas the Jabra Elite 65t's do both at the same time, problem-free. Microphone quality is still very poor: Same as in my prior review (below) - When making a call to another person through, for example, Skype, the sound of my voice into the microphones is poor. Failure to respond to touch commands: These WF-1000XM3 use touch-sensitive pads which do things like initiate pairing, stop/start playback, and activate noise canceling. When I try to press the pads to do these things, it does not always work. It's weird because they respond with a beep noise when I touch them, but then the command is not issued. So I know the headphones registered that I pressed them, because I hear the beep, but they just don't do the thing they were supposed to do. Example: Press right earbud to pause playback. Expected: Beep sound followed by the playback pausing. Actual: Beep sound, but playback doesn't pause. Another example: Press and hold both earbuds for 7 seconds to initiate pairing. Expected Beep sound followed by a voice prompt "Bluetooth Pairing". Actual: Beep sound but no voice prompt saying "Bluetooth Pairing" and no pairing was initiated. Summary: Good points still exist for these headphones, covered in my older review below, but do not buy these headphones if you intend to connect them to a Windows computer, or if you intend to use them for voice calls. -------------------------------------------------------------- Original review before firmware version 1.3.7: Problem 1: These WF-1000XM3 earbuds are in dire need of a firmware update, because they have connectivity problems with Windows 10 computers. Initially when I got these, I was able to connect to the computer with both voice communications (Skype meetings and such) as well as connecting with high quality stereo music. However now, it no longer works with the stereo music, and now it only connects with low-quality mono voice call quality. Stereo music does not work at all on the computer (though it still works on my iPhone). Problem 2: Sony has abandoned firmware updates for these. At the time of this writing, the WF-1000XM3 earbuds are at firmware version 1.2.3, and Sony made a firmware update to 1.3.0 which was supposed to solve the Windows 10 stereo audio connectivity problem. However you cannot get this update! When you attempt to make a firmware update by following the instructions on the Sony web site, nothing happens, it does not initiate the update. If you look closely at the Sony web site screen there is a message in small print: "We apologize for the inconvenience, but this software update has been temporarily suspended. We are working on the issue and will release a new update as soon as possible. (09-24-2019)". That message has been there on the web site since over a month ago. I'm still waiting, and I predict I'll be waiting forever. Problem 3: The microphone quality of any voice calls you make with the WF-1000XM3 is very poor. When I join a Skype meeting using my computer, the sound of my voice is too quiet, with very low quality, and frequently drops out below the noise floor. Basically, I'm unintelligible unless I shout. Also I cannot control the gain on the earbuds' microphone to turn it up so that my voice is louder to prevent dropouts. I don't know if this is fixed in firmware updates, since I cannot get firmware updates (as described above). By comparison, I also own a pair of Jabra Elite 65T wireless earbuds, and their voice call quality is fantastic (though those don't have active noise cancellation). Good points: The active noise cancellation is nice. Despite the other problems, I can still use these earbuds in my noisy open-office area to reduce the environmental sounds and listen to music, as long as I pair them to something that isn't Windows 10. The stereo music sound quality is good (when it can connect and it works). I found the music to be full and rich when it works. Note: I am pretty sure that these only support the older Bluetooth music protocols, I don't think they support the APTX music protocol, so don't expect them to have low latency at the same time as high quality. The way that these earbuds slip into their charging case is nice, they have little magnets which snick them into position and it feels really good. I tested the battery life, and these do last the advertised 5 hours with noise cancellation turned on (a bit longer, actually, when new). They also quick-charge from the charging case nicely, going from zero to 70% charged in a surprisingly short time. So if you want to use them for an entire day at work, or on a long airplane flight, you should do OK if you pop them back into their charging case any time that you get up from your seat. Conclusion: Don't buy these WF-1000XM3 earbuds if you intend to use them to make voice calls or Skype meetings, since your voice going out to the other people will be terrible. If you want these earbuds for other reasons, such as the noise cancellation, then check to see if Sony has fixed their firmware update problems first.

column8: Escape the world with Sony's Wireless Earbuds
column9: I have really enjoyed using the Sony WF-1000XM3. The feature that sets these headphones apart is the Headphones Connect app. The app gives you the power to customize your audio experience to your liking. First, it provides a nice interface to all the features of headphones. Customization includes: button action assignment per headphone, ambient noise level control, noise cancelling, selection and modification of several equalizer presets, and two custom presets. I spent a lot of time on a custom preset to get the sound I liked and was able to pump up the bass for deep rich sound. The headphone's audio quality is excellent with a great dynamic range. Paired with the noise canceling, you can really escape into your own little world with your music. The ambient noise control even changes dynamically based on whether you are sitting, walking, running, or in transit. These features all work very well together to again create such a rich and deep aural experience. Pairing the headphones to your device is as easy as taking the headphones out of the charging case and finding the headphones on your device's Bluetooth list. I love the fact that the headphones pause automatically when you remove them from your ears. Another plus for the headphones is the multiple ear tips included with the package. This allows you to change the fitting for your ear to insure a snug fit which in turn provides an enhanced noise canceling experience. This insures you have the best fit and the best experience possible. I have been very impressed with these headphones and will enjoy them for years to come. A few nitpicks here: Headphones are not waterproof. I'm not sure how they'd hold up if you are into a heavy exercise session and you generate a lot of sweat. Second, there is no volume control on the headphones themselves. Yes , not a real big deal but it would be nice if it was provided without changing the volume on the device. And finally, the tap commands on the headphones are not always accurate, especially when changing songs. Sometimes it thinks I tapped more or less times than I actually did, causing undesired results. Overall, the experience is great and I'd recommend these headphones to someone who needs wireless headphones and wants a great audio experience customized to their liking. You can check out my full review here: youtu.be/rRyOUhidP4A #SonyAudioInsider

column8: Great once you get the right fit!
column9: These headphones are great, once you’ve figured them out. There is a bit of trial and error with trying to figure out which ear piece fits best with your ears. It isn’t always the same size that works for both ears. However, once you figure out the sizing they are well worth the effort. I took my Sony Earbubs out for a quick 4 mile run to test them out and they didn’t budge an inch. I like that I could set them to block out the wind, but I could still hear cars coming before I could see them. Next I tried them out at my desk to see how the true Noise Cancelling feature worked. This is where the trial and error with the ear pieces really came into play. I thought that I had the right fit with my right ear, but I could still hear my officemate on his phone. After trying a couple of other sizes I found the ear piece that was just right and WOW! I couldn’t even hear myself typing on my computer. They blocked out everything so completely that it wasn’t till my officemate stood next to me and tapped me on the shoulder that I even knew that he had been trying to talk to me for several minutes. All in all I highly recommend these earbubs for everything from desk work to running and plan to continue putting them through their paces. I took off one star because of the trial and error and the picture directions that seem like they are trying to make it really easy to understand but really words would’ve been better!

I've used these headphones every day since I received them. I wear them when I'm on my daily walks, at my desk at work (one, they operate independently) and at home whether relaxing or doing chores. Here are my observations so far: Pros: - Excellent sound for this price range. - Above average features - in app EQ, Adaptive Sound Control, Noise cancelling - Excellent Comfort - for me the most comfortable in ear headphones I own with several sizes and types of tips included - Aesthetics - this is highly subjective but to me these look both unique and attractive. They seem very high quality. I love the "silver" color, which to be honest looks more like "champagne" to me. - Excellent battery life Cons: - Everyone lists this it seems but it's kind of a big deal. No volume control on the headphones makes these less convenient to use than competitive choices. - Though the sound is very good, not having aptx HD or Sony's own LDAC seems a miss in an otherwise excellent product. - Though a minor quibble I wish when you override the adaptive sound control by tapping your left earbud that it would hold that until the next time you connect. Unfortunately if you change activity (sitting down after walking) it reverts back to the adaptive control and reverses whatever you selected. I thought about turning adaptive control off but I do like how it functions otherwise. The sound quality of these is the best of any earbuds I own and I own a few well-known brands. The sound is highly adjustable. If you don't like the way they sound I urge you to make adjustments to the EQ and Clear Bass. Once adjusted the highs are crisp without being harsh, the bass is strong without being overpowering and you can hear each individual instrument and the nuances in the singer's voice. These headphones rival many more expensive over-ear headphones while being more portable and more comfortable. The noise cancelling is also very close to as good (not quite) as over-ear headphones that have this feature. I have used the noise canceling outside and in an airplane and it's very good, easily eliminating 70% of ambient sound. Given how portable and light these are, that's incredible!
