I absolutely recommend these to anyone looking for great sound, above average comfort (for in-ear headphones), and noise cancellation in this form factor. At this price point you will be hard-pressed to find better. They're not perfect, but they are as close as I've come. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review

column8: Amazing sound with very good noise canceling in an amazing package
column9: These are my new go to ear buds.... They sound amazing and best of all you can use your earbuds individually! This is great when you want to just listen to something in bed but dont want to wear both! Just remember to not enable your assistant if you want to use the earbuds separately.

I've owned many truly wireless earbuds in the past few years and was really looking forward to these when it was announced because of the noise cancelling feature and the indicated battery life. I've been using these earbuds for 2 months and they definitely live up to their hype on sound quality and noise cancelling. I travel frequently and used the wh-1000xm3 but found them to be too bulky when I'm trying to sleep. The wf-1000xm3 solved that. It offers almost the same noise cancelling quality as the wh in a smaller package that's less obstructive. The biggest selling point to me was the advertised 6hr of battery life when noise cancelling is turned on. Unless they are counting that you use 1 earbud that switch to the other one when the first earbud runs out of battery, these earbuds do not come close to the advertised 6hrs. I could only get 3hrs out of them which is terrible. Around 2 hrs in, you will get a prompt that the battery is running low. The earbuds then turn off around 3 hrs in. They both turn off around the same time. I guess it is too good to be true to hope for a 6hr noise cancelling headphone at this point. Another issue I have is the switching of the audio modes. Tapping the left bud allows you to switch between noise cancelling, ambient sound, and normal mode. This switching is really buggy. Sometimes it won't switch and I have to remove the earbud and then put it back into my ear again for it to start working properly. There are currently not many options when it comes to truly wireless noise cancelling earbuds so I am not going to bash these earbuds too hard. The sound quality is great and the noise cancelling works well in the plane. I still have to carry around an extra pair of earbuds whenever the battery runs out in these ones. I hope the next iteration will offer better battery life.

These are very good with sound and noise canceling. They are very comfortable and great to use on a hot day (when the over ear may be a bit sweaty. I have some signal stability problems when using with an iPad Air2. Otherwise it would get a 5.

I am writing this based on use with an iPhone. Pros: The sound is very impressive for an earbud. The noise cancellation is also very impressive. I always judge the quality of noise cancellation based on how it sounds on an airplane since that’s when it matters to me most and on an 8 hour flight, I was very satisfied. The engine noise and crying babies were almost nonexistent. I also like the ambient sound option when you need to hear people talk. Cons: The ease of connectivity with an iPhone is a real issue for me. I found myself fiddling with disconnecting and reconnecting several times a day which I found very frustrating. Maybe it’s better for android users but for iPhone it is a pain. I found myself just going back to my AirPods for everyday use and using these when I really wanted some good sound quality. Honestly the connectivity was a big enough problem that now that they announced the AirPod Pros with active noise cancellation, I will be returning them. Even if the sound quality in the airpods is slightly worse, it’s worth it to not deal with connection issues. Good sound quality and noise cancelling but just kind of a hassle.
The case scratches easy so watch out
I couldn’t get them to fit comfortably in my ears. The sound is great, connection was easy and fast. It would be nice if they could connect to multiple devices simultaneously.

column8: Improvement on competitors but still not a solution for talking on phone.
column9: I like the case and the magnetic feature that assures you the headphones are in place. I feel like it connected fairly easy to my iPhone the first time but took some trial and error to get it connected to my MacBook Pro the first time. Battery life sucks. Just played two 1.5 hour podcasts and battery is already alerting me it’s low. It does that once it’s under 50%. Also each earbud doesn’t use up battery life at same pace. I got these because I commute on public transit a lot and needed something that was good for listening to content but equally as good for talking on phone with them. They do not work well for talking on the phone when not sitting in a quiet office. I spend most of call saying “Can you hear me?” I hate the look of AirPods but will totally get rid of these the minute they come in black.

Phone call quality is terrible. Your voice comes through choppy and hard to hear. These would be the perfect earbuds otherwise. Music quality is amazing and the noise canceling is good. For phone calls, don't waste the time or money on these.

column8: Terrible - dont believe the popular reviews
column9: Cons: Battery life is 30% less than advertised, Sony app is terrible, voice quality when uses for calls is so bad that you are unintelligible. Pros: fit in ears is comfortable. But you wont wear them much, because you'll need something else for phone calls and the batteries will be dead anyway.
Overall a great product.

The biggest issue was fit for me, everything else is as expected. Not many truly wireless earbuds are even close to as expected, including the SP-700n, which you can't watch videos with. Both are significantly better than the galaxy buds for me, bluetooth connection in the buds were trash.

updates： before returning... I decide to give the earbuds another try. However, the situation suddenly became worse... From only oneside of the earbuds can connect to my devices, to pairing rejected by the wf1000..... Right side of the earbug never works!!!! O tried on my Android and iPad ....... What is wrong with Sony?????? ?

column8: Sony can’t you provide a product that doesn’t fall out?
column9: I bought these when they first came out and was too late to return them. Used them for an 8 hour plane ride. Sound quality is good and so is noise cancelling. My issue is they keep falling out. It’s a super expensive item to lose. So it made my plane ride filled with more unnecessary anxiety. Sony (or a 3rd party vendor) should be offering different ear tips with ear wings. Disappointed and frustrated. Sony can’t you provide a product or adaptive ear tip and/or ear wing so that your product doesn’t fall out?

column8: Returned after 1 day, not worth the price
column9: The build quality is great, and the magnets in the case ensure the buds won't easily fall out. However, the initial sound quality is garbage until you change the EQ settings in the companion app. The manual says a popping sound is normal, but the right bud never stopped popping. They randomly disconnected from my computer several times, and they don't appear as a paired device in the selection menu. Yes, the latest software was installed on the computer and buds. The 3 point secure fit works well enough, but the textured rubber part never touched my ear. The elongated ear tip does the majority of the work. These buds stick out far enough from my ear that it started getting uncomfortable after a few hours. I've been wearing wireless buds for 3 years, and this is the first time that happened. I returned them after 1 day of use. For $230 I expected a lot more, and no water resistance rating for a high end product is a joke.

column8: are you sure this is a Sony product?
column9: Soo..... battery life is great Music quality is good but could absolutely be louder Deal breaker!!!!! call quality is horrible, every time i get on the phone the other person says i sound like a robot. Noise cancelling is either a joke or mine is broken. GOING BACK FOR SURE
Most amazing earbuds give ever heard
Perfect product. If using one at a time you can go days without charging the case. Love this product to death.

column8: These are the Best! Just used on a 2 hour flight, still charged at 97%. Love them!
column9: These are AWESOME! Great comfort and sound! Thank you Sony! !’

Returned the first unit and got a replacement which is working properly. I love everything about these earbuds except two things! The sound quality changes when you listen to music with ANC on. Somehow, it doesn't sound as good as music with ANC off. However, it's my personal opinion. Another problem is the fit!! I never used large eartips for any of my earbuds but I use large eartips for these and I still don't get a decent seal. If I'm walking or doing any type of activities, I can feel the earbuds becoming loose and I have to push them back in the ear canal. I did read the instructions from Sony and I still don't get a tight seal. Other than these issues, everything works as it should and the sound quality is awesome. Try The excited equalizer preset. It sounds fantastic if you love heavy bass and crystal clear sound. I also owned powerbeats pro and jaybird Vista but they cannot compete with these earbuds when it comes to sound quality. However, these Sonys cannot compete with powerbeats pro when it comes to call quality and battery life. Also, the sound quality of the powerbeats pro is really great. The call quality of the Sonys are acceptable. I don't recommend them for long phone calls.
Bought these for my son and he loves them!
Very good

column8: Good but overly priced for what it is ans quality control issues
column9: Let me start these earbuds are some of the best true qireless earbuds i tried. The sound quality is easily the best out of the ones i have tried. Noise canceling featuee isn't as great as lets say the bose q25 or 35 but its a nice featuee to have especially in the office. The real issues however bring this product down substantially. 1. The fit is fine for office use or light walking. Anything more than that and you will have real problems with the buds falling out. 2. Battery life is a real issue its advertised at 8 hours i got more like six and the battery on the left side apparently is much better than the one on the right. 3. The fact that you can only hear recived calls on the left ear bud is annoying In the end i had to return them because of the battery issues. They are great ear buds....as long as you don't intend to use them outside the office

column8: Amazing earbuds with HORRIBLE call quality
column9: It's a shame that such a good earbud has horrible call quality. It's practically unusable for calls or videoconferences. A lot of noise and robotic voice. People can't understand what I am saying. Everything else is really good. Sony needs to fix this ASAP.

column8: Darn near perfect but they still suffer from the same thing most wireless earphone do...
column9: ...wind. The connection tends to drop when outside and the wind is blowing...if your phone or NW-ZX300 is in your pocket. The connection will be spotty, at best. Other than that, they are great! !

column8: Great battery , noice cancellation, and sound quality!
column9: Happy consumer, would recommend.

I have the Beats wireless buds and these by FAR are better, sound, quality and the case is not big like some reviews have left, I travel with my job for business and this fits in my bag, pocket no problem. The sound on these are great, the app is easy to use, I put the ap on my Iphone 11 and works great, blue tooth is easy to get. I looked at alot of earbuds wireless and these by far were the best.

Terrific sound stage with crisp and clear mids and excellent bass response that’s not too heavy just a nice hefty bump. The highs are crispy. The noise cancellation is unbelievable; and I haven’t had any issues with drops or disconnects. Battery life is also amazing. My recommendation is that you buy these earbuds, you won’t be disappointed.

column8: Nice looking, not a great product
column9: The buds where too big and annoying felt always like they were going to fall off also the case is sooooo big

column8: Good wireless earbuds - for the gym and beyond
column9: After catching the cord for my old earbuds on various things and sending my phone flying on more than one occasion, I needed a pair of wireless earbuds for the gym. I settled on the WF-1000XM3 after reading reviews; they looked to be of good quality and the price seemed reasonable compared to similar products. I've had them for about a month now, and so far, so good! The default size fit my ear nicely, but I like that they come with 3 different sizes (in two different materials) to try. Setup was easy, and sound quality is great. The noise-cancelling feature is pretty decent as well, though you really have to screw these things into your ears for it to work properly - and even then, some movements/noises seem to throw it off from time to time. Battery life is great as well - the case does a good job of keeping them ready to roll. I've recharged them 2-3 times since I got them, and I probably only needed to do so once. My complaints are few: it'd be nice if you could customize the touch actions of each earpiece (via the accompanying app) a bit more, and the app's ability to switch the noise-cancelling function automatically is a little unpredictable - to the point that I'd recommend just disabling it in some environments, and manually changing it when needed. The only other thing I would mention is that I ordered the black set but I received the silver set instead! I ended up keeping them because I was so anxious to start using them, but I actually quite like them. Give the silver pair a shot!
Good sound quality, Amazing noice cancelling, Decent life battery, Fast charging amazing.
They hurt my ears!!! Too big and they fall out during runs.

I wanted to like these so much. and while I do use them, I have a few gripes. everything everyone says about these is technically correct. but these are far from perfect. the sound quality is good. but the volume level doesn't excite me. I have way louder headphones that get me into a good jam session in my mind. people have a hard time hearing me when using them for phone conversations sometimes. and sometimes it's perfect. also I dont like that its default setting when you turn it on is noise cancelling. I haven't figured out how to fix it. I think sony pays a lot of money for good reviews on this and I think I would have been much happier buying an off brand. and saving money. if you can try them before buying them do it. maybe you will like them.

column8: the way they fit the ear.
column9: Nothing

column8: The Product is Good, But so many little Things, Could be Better.
column9: Trouble setting volume, Trying to get more. The ( Learning curve,) It takes awhile to get the Most out of them. For the first few days, It’s a learning Experience. The Manual is Very Little Help. Almost a Waste of Paper. After a few Days, I Enjoy, Having them, ( Trial and Error ) The learning curve, Is steep, The Manuel is a Waste of Paper. It takes More than A few Days, It comes down to trail and error ! ) It should Not Take so Long to Get the Most out of Them. ( I Hate Having Buyers Remorse ) The longer I have them the More I Enjoy Them. They should Be Great, Good is Not Enough. A premium Price, It Should be A Premium Product. I Hope This Helps, ( Learning Made easier ) Tech Support, S.L.Holt

Buds pretty good. Sound quality quite good. NC fair. But software so bad and unstable that if it wasn’t so infuriating it would be laughable. Actually got a push notification to inform me that the latest software update had disabled most of the features of the buds. Sony just pushed a survey through the app, which I took, and was shocked to find it superficial and marketing focused. Afterwards, the app badge persisted until I was forced to turn all app notifications off. Software shoddy to a fault.

column8: Good not great sound with EQ tweaks and otherwise disappointing...
column9: I wanted to like these and thought because they were so expensive and were made by Sony that they would be better but I was really disappointed. I bought 4 different pairs of headphones to try and have a few others at home that I compared with. 1. Sony WF-1000XM3 2. Anker Soundcore Liberty 2 Pro 3. Anker Soundcore Liberty 2 4. Anker Soundcore Life P2 I ended up with keeping the Anker Soundcore Liberty 2 because they stayed in my ears a bit better, had decent sound, and were only $100. I would have stayed with the Sony headphones but I was not impressed the the non-EQ tweaked sound quality. It was good but not good enough for the price. That noise cancelling was a joke as well. There was almost no difference with it on and off. The NC/ANC button didn't do anything. It would just beep and occasionally it would have a voice prompt that would say Active Noise Control on/off. Most of the time it just beeped. PROS: - Better sound quality than others I have tried. - Fit well and stayed put pretty well. - Light and comfortable. - NFC pairing - I wish more companies did this. - Auto pause feature when you take one out is nice. CONS: - Sound quality was lacking for the price. - ANC/NC button functionality was very inconsistent. - Noice cancellation did almost nothing. - Case is on the large side.
The only complaint I have with these is for long listening periods they can cause a lot of ear fatigue.

column8: The sound these earbuds produce Is better than most headphones I have tried.
column9: Awesome earbuds. My music sounds full and well defined. Got an extended warranty to go with it because these, are a keeper.
General music usage. Worked as advertised.

column8: Excellent Sound Quality and Noise Cancellation
column9: Sound quality and noise cancellation are top notch and are even comparable to most over the ear noise cancellation headphones. The biggest problem I had was it keeping the earbuds connected. They would randomly shut off/disconnect while listening to music or watching a movie despite being paired to either Note 10+ and Galaxy Tab S6. There was a recent firmware update which has greatly improved bluetooth connectivity. In addition, the recent firmware update now shows the battery life of the charging case. The only drawback at this point is the lack of any IP ratings for sweat which has prevented me from using them at the gym. Overall, I am giving these earbuds 4 stars based on sound quality, comfort, battery life and noise cancellation. It will be interesting in seeing how the upcoming Bose 700 NC earbuds coming in 2020 will compare to these.

Really great audio quality. Not a huge audiophile but this is the best pair of headphones I've ever bought. Does take some practice/swapping of tips to make sure you get that snug fit, but once you do the noise cancelling is phenomenal.
Honestly I cannot compare with air pods. this is way better!

I got this and the over ear Sony WH-1000XM3 together at the same time. At first I was severely disappointed at the noise cancellation ability compared to the over ear ones. I felt like it hardly did anything! I tried the smaller plugs and it didn’t help and even worse my ears hurt. Counterintuitively, it turns I had to use the biggest ones. It didn’t hurt anymore and more importantly, the noise cancellation was far more effective! My test was with a hair dryer at full blast. While it doesn’t completely eliminate it, the noise level is dramatically reduced, more like fan noise. Another cause of initial woes was the touch controls. You’re supposed to tap the left or right headphones to change various functions. My problem was that it was very sporadic, maybe working 25% of the time. Doing a google search, it turns out you need to tap quickly. So now everything works and I’m satisfied.
Great wireless headphones
Beats power pro sound 100% better

I have been searching for the best true wireless earbuds with great sound. I liked the Cambridge Melomania (even though they sound like they are named after a deadly form of skin cancer) before one of the earbuds died two weeks in. Returned those. These Sonys sound great and have fairly good active sound cancellation as long as you make sure you have a quality “seal” — your ear canal must be totally blocked. Now for the downsides: 1) These things stick way out of your ears... think early 2000s Bluetooth earpiece. They draw some funny looks. 2) No waterproofing. 3) The sound quality on phone calls is barely passable. Many times I had to swap back to the handset for people to hear me. 4) Frequent Bluetooth disconnections on phone calls (not when listening to music) Particularly if you have an iPhone, go for the AirPod Pros. The noise isolation and sound cancellation are jaw droppingly good for their size and are small enough that you don’t stick out for wearing black marshmallows in your ears and can fall asleep in bed wearing then.

Just used on a trip to Texas and these worked great. Almost as good as the old pair of Bose headphones. Great sound, deep bass and overall very comfortable to wear. So glad I purchased. And so much smaller to carry on a plane than my old headphones.

To put my review into perspective, I own a Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless (to compare to true wireless) as well as a Sony WH-1000XM2 (to compare to noise cancelling). Comparing these Sonys to the Sennheisers (MTW). 1) Battery life. The Sonys are FAR superior to the MTW. I have yet to run into battery issues with the Sonys. They are awesome! The MTW's main weak point is the battery life. They stink. Power runs down as they sit in the case. In 3 days, they are dead. 2) Sound quality. This is more subjective. If I could sum it up simply, Sonys are really precise, analytical, and dare I say, without too much character. Yes, the sound is good, but it isn't warm... perhaps a tad bright. MTWs are wonderful... I didn't think I was a fan of the Sennheiser sound profile, but I guess I am. 3) Fit and comfort. I have Comply tips on the MTWs, and using the included foam tips on Sonys. I have fit issues with the Sonys. I feel that they don't go deep enough, so getting a proper seal to get proper bass is hard. It takes a lot of fiddling. Once in, they are comfortable. MTW are great, but they do hurt my ear pinnas after a while. 4) Noise cancelling. Now I am comparing these Sonys to the Sony XM2. I haven't found that the nose cancelling in these Sonys to be that impressive. Maybe it is related to the fit I just mentioned. Overall impressions. I really like these. Solid feeling case and magnetic capture of the earphones are simply wonderful. The MTW case has a wobbly lid. That said, there are some things I wish these had. I wish the case had wireless charging. I wish I could change the volume using touch. If anyone has suggestions on a compatible Complys, I would love to hear (no pun intended) them.

I purchased some memory foam ear tips to replace the provided ones since none of them works for me. With that "upgrade" it's been an amazing experience with these pair of earbuds. The active noise reduction and audio pass-through both work wonderfully considering the size of the earbuds. I can easily forget that I'm wearing them, partly thanks to the memory foam ear tips, but the shape and weight of the buds are still amazing. However, I wish the performance of these earbuds could be more stable/reliable. During walking, connection between either earbud might get disconnected and I would not hear sound from one of them. I experience this quite more often with some other earbuds so I can tolerate that. But recently, after updating to the latest firmware, I have experienced 3 times, in a day, where the left bud would suddenly play a sharp "pop" sound and go silent and then restart (I would hear the battery 100% announcement again) in a couple seconds. These happened during a train ride and a walk. This reminds me that before the update, either earbud would still randomly shutdown, just without the "pop" and the restart.

column8: Best battery life, sound detail, and comfort. Minor quirks
column9: Loved almost everything about these, especially the battery life and quick charge (really works). Sound is amazing, and comfort is excellent, Ease of use is great. Quirks are: if you remove 1 both pause, if you push on one in your ear they may pause (I haven't read the instructions and functions yet so this may be easy to overcome) if you smile a lot they come loose and can fall out ( I am a tattoo artist so I have to always wear medical gloves and touching them with fingers is not optional. Pushing them in when loose with arm will sometimes pause). And really that is about it for issues that I experienced so far, without even reading the instructions.

column8: Buggy software. Amazing sound when working. Dont try to talk hands free cause it doesnt work.
column9: 3 stars because the software for these earbuds is a complete mess. I cant connect these to anything else but my cell phone. That said. The sound quality is AMAZING on my phone. Super deep bass and all around great sound. Noise cancelling? GREAT! Works very well actually. Talking on them? Impossible. The other person cant hear me at all. So then I have to pop the earbuds out and change the source on my phone before the other person hangs up. SAD! The software is just very buggy and it makes it hard to love them. But when they work they work very well.
Way better than Jabra 65t

My first impression of these ear buds is that is the best one in the world, in comparison to my old earbuds they sound so much better with the noise cancelling feature and the audio quality is pretty good. It has a snug fit that won't fall off even when you go out for a run. The wirelesss connectivity is great . The touch control is responsive as well the battery life is also impressive. I was impressed with device and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

if you want to use these for longer than 30 min be prepared for your ears to be irritated. not good for running or workouts in general, either they will fall out or slowly start to slip from your ear. Sound quality is good and the battery life is great but could not justify $200+ so ended up returning the product.

It’s been a long time since I really enjoy using earbuds. I’ve tried multiple brands but have finally found my happy place. These Sony earbuds are now a MUST in my work backpack! I work in a very loud office and these are perfect for it. I find the best mode to use in my office is noise-canceling mode. I can easily shut off all the noise around me while having my music only 50% of the way. When I see someone approach me, I easily hold the button on the left side to turn on ambient noise and mic which gives me a superhuman hearing to catch comments from co-workers or my boss with no problems. I love the fact that you can assign actions to the single touch button each earbud has. I currently have the right one to pause/play/skip songs and pick up phone calls and the left to change modes of ambient noise and noise canceling. I have had these earbuds for almost 3!months now and have never run out of battery! At lunch, I simply put them back in the case and they are 100% when I come back and that lasts me through the day. The design of the case and the earbuds are also pretty cool. I have gotten multiple compliments for them and have shared my experience with coworkers that have already copied me! Overall, I am very happy with this purchase!

column8: Amazing sound quality and snug fit
column9: Design:⁣ - The design of the headphones are very classy. Even the rose bronze colored cover on the charging case exuded class.⁣ - The in-ear pieces themselves, while large, fit beautifully and neither felt heavy nor over-sized.⁣ - The charging case itself was much larger than I was expecting, due to the ability to provide 24hrs of playback charging, and I would have taken a case that was 20-30% smaller at a sacrifice of 6-8hrs.⁣ - The red charging LED was noticeable yet understated. Pairing & Interface⁣ - Pairing was fairly simple once I installed the 'Sony | Headphone Connect' app. I could not pair via the normal method I was used to.⁣ - Customization via the app was very detailed. There are four environmental/activity profiles that you can set different noise cancelling levels for. I did enjoy how as the slider moved an image of people, cars, and buildings would transition from 100% transparent to completely solid, giving you a visual representation of the noise cancelling setting.⁣ - Answering calls and changing tracks was simple and effortless. ⁣ - I am very disappointed that there is no volume control on the ear phones, especially as I had planned on using them for activities that generally do not allow easy access to my phone.⁣ Audio:⁣ - I have owned about six (6) pairs of wireless in-ear headphones and without a doubt, these are the BEST sounding ones I have ever used. The bass response and power are unreal. I set the equalizer on the app to 'Excited' and it raise all levels a little and made the treble a little brighter, which really made these headphones shine.⁣ - The noise cancelling was quite impressive. I ran a miter saw a few times while noise cancelling was turned off and then slowly moved to full cancellation and I was amazed at how well it suppressed the saw noise. At full cancellation I could barely hear the motor spin up.⁣ - Every now and then where people on a call state that they cannot hear me. I switch to my phone I come through clearly. For those that just want audio quality, buy these. If you are looking for headphones with a full control feature set, these are not them.

The features were great butt the on first pair I received the right earbud did not respond to tapping the outside. The right earbud on the second pair stopped working after 20 hours of use or so. I cannot bring myself to replace them so I got a refund. Too bad the noise cancelling feature was great.

column8: First true wireless with real ANC
column9: I have been using my Bose QC20 for years now. I loved the noise cancellation. I have been wanting to go wireless but there was two criteria that were never met: -Small enough to go in my jacket's pocket -Real effective ANC Those earphones are the first ones to offer both and I am very happy with them. I am glad there was a firmware update to fix the pairing with WIndows 10. The sound quality is great, ANC is almost as good as my Bose (basically the passive noise cancellation is better on the Sony which makes it up for the active one being a bit less effective).

column8: Had to return earbuds--poor Bluetooth connectivity
column9: I had to return these ear buds after purchasing them on opening day. They wouldn't connect to a high end Windows 10 laptop except for brief moments. They connected fine to my Samsung S7 Edge. For the price on these Sony shouldn't have released these for sale before fixing the Bluetooth issue which a great many people had.

Fantastic headphones! Audio quality - top notch, great range. NC - really great. Very pleased with the active sensing and adjustments based on activity and surrounding noise. Mic quality - initially poor but after installing latest firmware, it is greatly improved. Recommended!

column8: Great product! Cant hear my dad beating my mom with the noise cancelation.
column9: Awesome product!!! Noise cancelation was a must have, now I cant hear my dad beating my mom anymore in the background. Great product for the 230$ price point, well worth the money noise cancelation is a must have for situations like this. 10/10

column8: Don't let the small size fool you
column9: Man, these headphones are amazing. I do not claim to be an audiophile or an expert in sound engineering. The features and sound that these little headphones come with is crazy good. I work in a very noisy office that is filled with office chatter and white noise. Once I insert my earbuds, it all goes away and I can enjoy my podcast/music without any distractions. The noise cancelling is so good that people have to tap me on the shoulder or I won’t be able to hear them. And once the buds come off office, it’s crazy to hear how much sound gets isolated from entering your eyes. The battery life for headphones of this size is exception. On one charge and a lunch break, I was able to get a full work of audio. I prefer to get phone calls on my phone but the head buds do just fine. The google assistant feature added a whole new look on what modern headphones should do. I do enjoy being able to receive text and being able to listen to the text without having to reach for my phone. Over the last month I have been very impressed with these small buds that pack a nice punch with all the added feature and the very excellent sounds. I would recommend these to anyone who prefers a more minimalist headphones that can compete with over the ear headphones. Oh I forgot to mention these headphones are very comfortable after extended use but I have average sized eye canals so your experience may vary.

I really wanted to love these but there are too many bugs for me to recommend them. The mic is terrible and makes them impossible to use for calls which is what I bought these for. The ambient nose sensing is more of an annoyance than a feature and the left earbud often disconnects randomly. Sound quality and noise cancellation when it works is great. Can't recommend them in their current state.
Good fit suitable for exercise. Noise cancellation is quite good considering size and battery capacity.

column8: Noise cancellation fearures didnt work on my iphone
column9: I couldnt get the features tonwork right on my iphone. Wish i would have kept them since i have an android now so i could try again.

I've had these since release and feel I can offer a good review at this point. Pros: 1: For an ear bud the noise cancelling is very good. 2: For me, they are comfortable. I've also never had them fall out of my ear while running or working out. 3: I'm not a sound expect, but the sound quality is very good to my ear. Cons: 1: A little bulky, but not cumbersome and as I said they have never fallen out of my ear. 2: Expensive. But for me, I wasn't looking for the "in fad" item, I wanted the best item. I do think these have proven their worth. Overall, I strongly recommend them as a bluetooth ear bud option for someone who wants substance over anything else.

I mean I got them used so the unboxing experience wasn't so magical lmao. It was missing the charing cable but it's fine because my Samsung S10 is the same charger and I was missing one of the foam ear tips but there great earphones overall. The active noise cancelling is aweosme!! !

column8: They keep falling out of my ears (I tried all the ear pieces it came with)
column9: I regret buying these and not waiting for the apple airpod pros instead. The sound quality is good with limited noise cancellation, don't expect anything like the over-ear head phones in terms of sound cancellation. The operating software is buggy. The sound controls don't work well with my Google Pixel phone, works better with IOS. Loses connection from time to time and they get confused sometimes when i take it out of my ears and put them back on. My biggest complaint is that the earphones are quite big and it keeps falling out of my ears when I walk around, so i don't even think about using them while exercising. I tried all the adjustable ear pieces these came with and they still fall out of my ears which is unacceptable. I would like to return the items but it has been over 30 days since i bought them so now I can't return them.

column8: If you have an iPhone, get the AirPods Pros instead
column9: As an earbud, it functions phenomenally. Sounds terrific, noise-canceling is terrific, and for all intents and purposes, battery life is adequate. But it loses it's two stars in accessibility and ease of use. It's kinda big and bulky. As a result, cannot be used in a rigorous movement without the risk of dropping out (fast jog and more). Besides that, to use the touch controls for pause, play, transparency mode, etc, you have to "tap" the side but really you have to A) be accurate with your touch; the button isn't ber intuitively designed, B) press the tap sensor but as a result, you are directly mashing the earbud into your ears which is very discomforting. The pause/play and button responsiveness is also comparatively slow. For example, to switch noise-canceling mode, you tap the side controls and wait a solid second. It doesn't seem like much but it really gets annoying. On the iPhone, the app is mostly useless. Lastly, this is probably an iPhone thing but it's connectivity kind of sucks. If you have an iPhone, just spend $20 more and get the Airpods pro. This earbud is for android users and/or people who are incredibly sound sensitive to the smaller details of the speaker.

These cancel out the surroundings sounds. I could do work and listen to music without hearing background noise. The earbuds connected to my iPad and phone almost instantly. Convenient to charge and store in charging case. The battery lasted a long time. I could leave them in my purse for a day it two and the battery life stayed at a full charge. The case is easy to use for charging the earbuds. The case is light weight; I didn’t even realize they are in my purse. Extra earpiece sizes are included.

column8: Very good, but won't fit in my ears
column9: Listen - I'm not an audiophile, but I do have some level of music background. I've been looking for decent replacements for my Westone W40 (~$499) and W30 ($349) for some time. These have a wide range of tips which allow me to jam them in my ears, providing noise reduction (elimination), but not noise cancelling. Over the past year, shoving smaller tips too far in gives me vertigo, so that's part of the reason I bought the Sony's. These were to replace AirPods, which, although I love, don't block sound out on airplanes and in noisy offices (unless I crack up the volume). Note - I solved for fitment issues with the AirPods by using third-party silicone wraps (found on Amazon). Ultimately I returned them after a day. Why? I could not get a good seal in my ears - tried all tips (soft/rubber and the soft/foamy ones). I tried twisting and moving around in my ears (the ear canal angle is weird), and also attempted reversing (R>L and L>R). Good - Smaller and lighter than I thought (only seen one other person with these, on a train) - The sound stages worked pretty well - they were different enough and didn't "assume" Rock/Pop/etc. sounds like you want - they use actual "moods" - Sound _is_ excellent, when I pressed them close to my ears. Ample bass and treble, and more clear separation of L/R channels than any other wireless headphones - Charging case isn't as large or annoying as some reviews note. Similar build quality to Apple, but the rubbery/matte finish attracts fingerprints Bad (other than sound/seal) - I hate having to use an app to control headphones - and it didn't work a lot (see: screenshot) - The touch buttons are WAY too sensitive, and did stuff when I simply adjusted them on my ears - Ear gels all felt similar in size, which is odd - They regularly disconnected - even in "maintain connection" mode (I'm spoiled by AirPods) - Can't tell exactly what AptX actually does (on/off) - Volume for some music (iPhone/Apple Music) was really low Other notes - not all the time - Initial connection was somewhat of a nightmare - took 5 attempts (15-20 minutes) - Software update took 35 minutes because it kept stalling/failing. One of them had charge level drop below a certain point, so I had to charge and start over. However, kudos to Sony that it will accelerate to where it last left off, but it's still a pain - Ear photo/sizing took 3 attempts on one ear, then I realized I don't have any apps which support it

These are incredibly awesome little headphones. Noise cancellation is actually comparable to that of the overhead ones, not as strong but very good nonetheless. Music sounds fantastic in these! The feel a little awkward to me in the ear but that’s probably because I’ve never used wireless buds before, I’m sure I’ll get used to it. People say you can’t work out in them because they aren’t waterproof or sweatproof, but I personally haven’t had problems and wear them to the gym all the time. Overall a great buy.

column8: Awesome sound in a cool package
column9: The Sony WF-1000XM3 Industry Leading Noise Canceling Truly Wireless Earbuds offer amazing sound quality in a cool, rose gold package. The earbuds sound quality was well beyond my expectations although adjusting the sound volume is a little challenging as it cannot adjust via the earbuds. I am still getting comfortable with the functionality and exploring what works best for me. I used these on a cross country flight which was a blessing as there was a screaming toddler sitting directly in front of me. The noise cancellation feature is one of the best I have ever experienced and the loud volume worked well so I found I was able to fall asleep and stay asleep on the flight. The adaptive sound was phenomenal and completely awesome. The set-up of the earbuds was pretty straightforward although it took me a couple of minutes to understand the emoji instruction sheet (lol) however I had everything fully functioning within 5 minutes. I liked the automated set-up functions which made it super simple to complete. The earbuds came with multiple size ear pieces which was helpful to ensure a proper fit. The charging case charges easily and fits nicely in my bag pocket. The battery lasts longer than other comparable products which is a plus. A couple of suggestions would be to add a place for a cord to attach to a belt loop or bag as well as wireless charging options. Overall, I am very happy with the Sony WF-1000XM3 Industry Leading Noise Canceling Truly Wireless Earbuds!

column8: Fix the Bluetooth connectivity! Then boom! They'll be superb
column9: Audio Quality - Great Noise Cancellation - Awesome Design - Good Bluetooth connectivity - Terrible Sony makes great products, don’t get me wrong. Hence the superb sound in most of their products. But the Bluetooth of this thing is just so hard to deal with. The left earpiece is the master and the right earpiece is the slave, they’re not interchangeable like the AirPods. This means that if you want to listen only through one earbud, you can only use the left earbud. But because the other earbud is idle, the automatic shutoff feature thinks both of them are not in ears and shuts them off. I also struggled to update the device because it wouldn't do it unless both are at 100% charged and you have to let them remain in your ears.

The Sony Noise Cancelling earbuds model WF-1000XM3. The design of these earbuds are very nice, they look sleek, the case is a little large but very nice. The sound quality is very, very good. They are one of the best earbud/headphone audio quality devices I have heard in the last 2 years. (Note-not all ears are created equal, earbuds for me, tend to have a difficult fit) I use earbuds when I work out, running on the treadmill, stair climbers, lifting weights. Earbuds need to stay in the ear and not fall out and get damaged in the machine accidentally. Unfortunately, the design of these Sony earbuds, they don’t stay in my ears very well when I am active. I realized this and decided to limit the use to travel or office use. In office use, I would want to be able to take calls without taking these earbuds out, since they have a microphone, I want to keep them in and take my calls. The folks on the calls said I sounded like a robot talking, very digitized. I also noticed on calls that the playback I was hearing would pause occasionally then start playing back like chipmunks until the call was caught up. This happened more than once for me. So I cannot use these earbuds for calls. I traveled with these earbuds to Orlando. So I thought this would be a good test, being on a plane. The noise-canceling really doesn’t cancel out that much background noise. They almost immerse you with more sound that you want to hear to compensate for the background noise. I don’t know if just having super high volume is how I want my noise-canceling to work. From a travelers perspective, on a plane, I can’t see how these can compete with an over the ear noise canceling set of headphones. Overall, if I reach down to my bag, an earbud falls out, if I take a call, I need to disconnect Bluetooth to disconnect the earbuds, or want to change the volume, I have to pull out my phone, the cost versus benefit is not where I need these to be at this point. UPDATE: Since the firmware update, noise cancellation has improved. I will travel with my over the ear solution. Riding in a train or subway is probably a perfect fit for these.

column8: Massive features in a miniscule package
column9: The Sony WF-1000XM3 noise canceling wireless earbuds pack a lot of features in a small, comfortable form factor. I highly recommend these earbuds for their size, convenience, noise cancellation and sound quality. FORM FACTOR These earbuds do no sport any hooks or molding for wearing around the ear; they worn directly in the ear, and are light enough to be worn for long periods of time without any discomfort. Included are several sizes and material tips, to accommodate various ear sizes and shapes. The touch sensitive buttons are responsive and easy to use without have to feel around or search for. The charging case is very portable and allows for safe keeping and charging of the earbuds when not in use. SETUP/SOFTWARE Installing the accompanying app on my phone was easy; pairing and setting up the headphones was quick and painless. The app affords a lot of various configuration, notably being able to set up location-based adaptive sound control scenarios, such as walking/commuting/staying which allow for various levels of noise cancellation and external voice focus. I was able to effectively use this in various activities without having to pull out the phone to change settings. The application also allows for personal custom equalizer settings. I just noticed a setting in the app for 360 Reality audio, which is new, I'm glad they are continually adding new features. SOUND The noise cancellation is on par with the leading noise cancellation headsets, I think having a good seal within the ear they may even have a slight edge in keeping sound out. Train and plane rides are more comfortable due to the the cancellation, it is not overbearing like some of the other headsets. The customizable EQ in the app allows me to tailor the sound as I see fit, as well as a welcome bass boost. BATTERY LIFE I was able to use the earbuds for about 5-6 hours straight with cancellation on, charging with the included case took about 1.5 hours to full. Upon removing the earbuds from the case and putting them in your ears, a voice prompt will tell you approx how much battery life is left. SUMMARY The Sony WF-1000XM3 earbuds are a tiny package full of cutting edge technology. I highly recommend this set of earbuds for it's lightweight design, feature set and incredible sound.

Sound Quality 5/5 -The way the noise bounces from earbud to earbud is awesome, it completely disconnects from your surroundings. Call Quality 5/5 -I have used different noise cancelling headphones before and this one is by far the best with the audio/call quality. Noise Canceling 5/5 -I really enjoy the noise cancelling feature, I was standing next to a soundbar that was playing pretty loud music and decided to try the earbuds and the room went completely quiet. It was scary but awesome. Fit 4/5 -I've been using the left earbud most of the time for about a month and recently the earbud is not staying in my ear anymore. I don't use the right one as often but I haven't had any issues with it Technology 1/5 (Edited) My issue was fixed with the latest version update but the instal of such update was not a good experience. -I have been unable to use Google Assistant functionality because of the current problem with IOS 13.1, I am currently on IOS 13.2 and there has not been an update to fix that functionality. -Earbuds work great if you are using both at the same time. I normally use the left one to be able to pay attention to my surroundings and if i remove the earbud the music doesn't stop and if i try using the right one only it will never connect to my phone. -Sony released a new version to provide a fix to the Google functionality issue. When installing the update if I was not playing anything on the earbuds, the earbuds would turn off and cause a fail update. Once I figured that was the issue, I played a song while the update finished. When I switched apps to set up the Assistant I had to reset both headphones app and the Assistant app to help the earbuds be recognized in the Assistant App

column8: I love, love and looooove these earphones!!
column9: I love, love and looooove these earphones!! If you compare this masterpiece of engineering to any other noise cancelling buds, everything else pales in comparison. I can assure you that the noice cancelling on these buds is stunning in conjunction with the passive sound isolation they provide. When I put these on for the first time, I was shocked how much noise they're able to cancel. After that, I downloaded the app and noticed that noice cancelling wasn't even turned on! My head got turned upside-down when the revamped noice cancelling actually kicked in. Really, really amazing. Also worth mentioning are the Ambient Sound modes which, in my point of view, got even better. The sound quality is top-notch and they fit well into my ear canals. The life span is astonishing and the case feels and looks even good albeit quite large compared to some other brands. Sony has played their cards right this time. I'm sure that these are going to sell like freshly baked breads in a local market. And no, Sony didn't pay me to write this review as there are two downsides I'd like to mention: I'm quite sure that you heard about the absence of liquid resistance. It's not a big deal for me, but alas, for gym fellas, you should go off and buy something else. Also there is no way of controlling the volume? Even in the app there is no remapping in regards of volume control for some reason. By all means: why? But oh well. In conclusion, if you are considering carrying a pocket-size, well thought-out, and meticulous pair of earphones, then go for it.

column8: Easy to use. Great usability, battery life and noise cancellation
column9: The small size makes it easy to take everywhere. Good battery life and the noise cancellation is similar to the bigger brother. Can easily zone out and get a lot of work done with no disturbances.

Lots of reviews on YouTube hype these up to be the absolute best wireless earphones have to offer (or among the best). So I thought heck, why not try them out and upgrade from my Airpods/Galaxy Buds (both of which I own for different purposes). My experience is very mixed on these, they have their good and bad points. Sound: They sound quite nice, a full, rich sound that my previous earphones fail to reach. I do wish they had just a bit more bass. I turned the Clear Bass meter all the way up and noticed only a slight difference and I really wanted to feel the thump and rumble from certain songs but it left much to be desired. Much more suited for genres like rock. Fit: Fit differs from person to person, but for me these fit alright. No matter what tips I used, I could never get them to a perfect point that felt satisfying. They always felt a little loose, and found myself always pushing them back in every so often. Not the worst fit in the world but worth noting. Battery Life: The battery life I thought was pretty good. On a certain day I used them quite literally nonstop for a couple hours, and they were still at 50% without a charge in between, which I think would fit most people's timeframes. Noise Cancellation: The NC was serviceable, not amazing by any means but it was there and it worked. Without music it does an okay job but with music, even at mid volume you don't hear anything around you, which is nice. Connection: This is truly where it all falls apart. None of the established reviewers talk about this, but holy f@#k the connection for these is abysmal, and I know it's not my Galaxy Note 10+ cause all my other earphones don't have connectivity issues with it. Just pairing these was a pain, and that's not even getting into the terrible Sony app to control these. An update was required when I first turned them on, but halfway through they would disconnect randomly, without reason. Literally the phone and the earphones would be on the table next to each other, still and without movement, and I must've had to restart the update process 5 times which took like half an hour just to get them going. After that, it was a true crapshoot whether they would choose to connect or not. Often only one would connect, dispite both being put in the case and taken out at the same time. The range once connected is good but what does that matter when they can't connect in the first place? A true disappointment, and a frustrating product to review. If they had no connection issues, a fit more like the Galaxy Buds and a bit more thump like the Apple Airpods, they would've been the perfect set of true wireless earphones. Not worth the $230, wait for the next model. Returned mine after a week. I suggest you buy yours where you can return them even after being used to test run them, like Best Buy, to know if they're for you.

This is all around a great deal. Expensive, yes, but easily is worth the cost. These are not earbuds for audiophiles, they do not stand up to really expensive headsets of any kind. However, the sound is certainly awesome considering they are earbuds. The bass is there if you want a ton of it, and doesnt seem to distort the sound much no matter how high you put it, so thats a thing. Just have to mention that since a lot of people look for that. I cannot stress this enough, these are easily one of the best ear buds for commuters of any kind. The active noice cancellation is not a gimmick here. Definetly works very well. Being able to let ambient noise come in when you need it, at will though the touch pad on the earbud is awesome. You are easily able to have a full on conversation with someone without ever removing them just by pausing or lowering rhe music and turning off noise cancellation. They arent the most comfortable thing in the world, theres no getting around that for the most part with buds of this type that create a seal in your ear canal. But its really subjective, i can a few hours with them in and not worry about it too much. If you want comfort, get a over the ear headset. Very easy and quick to set up on any phone, android for sure and probably iphone, i do not own one. Galaxy Note 9 here.

I regret buying these, they haven't been anywhere near as good as I thought they'd be. I'd previously owned a pair of AirPods, and the Sony WH1000-XM2 (what a name!) over ear headphones. First, the good. They've got decent sound quality, they look good and they feel rugged and well made. There's no brittle or easily breakable part on it, unlike the Sony over-ear headphones that always crack on the headband. But the downsides make this hard to recommend. The battery life is inconsistent, and each earbud seems to run out of battery power at different stages. In my case, the left one will run out of juice as much as an hour before the one on the right. Secondly, the alerts and noises are irritating and loud. The low battery alert in particular is so grating that you'll find yourself trying to avoid getting near the 'BEEP – low battery please recharge headset'. Sony still hasn't updated the firmware on these to allow pairing to multiple devices, so to switch between devices involves disconnecting and reconnecting every time. Why can't these hold a connection to multiple like the Bose headphones? In addition, there seems to be a bug where immediately after connecting to an audio source, the headphones will play at maximum volume before syncing to the correct paired volume of the device. This is excruciating, and frankly dangerous. It's made me rip the earbuds out when it's happened on multiple occasions. If these were half the price, they might have been worth it. But I find myself reaching for AirPods much more often these days.

The sound quality is excellent. The controls at the buds seem to work intermittently. The active noise cancellation is not very effective (especially in quieting the noise on an airplane, my prime interest). The battery life is superb. The physical form factor is somewhat awkward (rather large and heavy). They are fine staying put in the ear sitting and walking but certainly not running or at the gym.

column8: Very good quality and sound, but my vote goes to the AirPods Pro.
column9: I Purchased the Sony‘s a few weeks before the AirPods Pro were announced, based on multiple reviews proclaiming them the best sounding true wireless NC buds. I used them a fair amount, and agree they sound very good, although I do feel the app is quite complicated, and the fit and feel of the buds themselves wasn’t ideal. When the AirPods were announced, I bought them online thinking that I would keep whichever ones I liked better. Unfortunately, my return window for the Sony’s is no longer available, but if it was they would be going back. They just don’t feel as premium, and although they do sound great, I like the sound and fit of the AirPods pros better. When using them, I sometimes don’t even feel like they’re there… Something you will never say with the Sony’s. I listen to a wide variety of musical genres, and the while the Sony‘s provide great bass and full sound, especially for certain bass-heavy types of music, my opinion is that they just don’t measure up to the experience the AirPods Pro provide for other types of music. Also I'm told the call quality is much better with the AirPods Pro vs. the Sony, so if that is a consideration, it's definitely something I noticed. Don't get me wrong, the Sony's sound great and work quite well... given the benefit of a side-by-side comparison, I'll be using my AirPods Pro!

Couldn't wait to get them out of the packaging. The case is superb and storage is very simple. Great selection of ear buds. It did take some time to understand the operation. the fit is perfect for me. The quality of sound is exceptional. These are true noise cancelling. tried with phone call and also work very well. I used with Google assist and it was very simple. I am concerned if I use while outdoors doing yard work that they may come off. Will keep you updated.

These are dependent upon I very tight seal in the ear to the point of being uncomfortable. Otherwise noise canceling does not work. Airpods Pro work very well with a very comfortable fit. I don’t think the Sony’s really do noise cancelling. It appears that they just block outside sound rather than cancel it. That’s what I’m hearing.

column8: Sound is better than I expected
column9: The first thing I noticed when I opened the box is I thought the case for these is adorable the black and rose gold color makes it look super fancy. I saw the inside of the package said to download the app so instead of reading the instructions I wanted to gauge how easy it would be to pair them by just connecting the app and following directions. It was easy and no major issues I like items that are easy to use and set up quickly. The sound quality is so good the music sounded so clear. I like that you can use just one ear bud at a time and it still plays it's important I can hear my phone and what's going on around me at work. I also like the various options in the app to personalize and adjust the sound to your needs. I have small ears and the extra ear tips are a requirement for me to get the best fit possible and the variety is nice in case I ever let someone else use them in my household. The buds themselves aren't eye appealing but the sound is what matters to me and they sound great. I am excited to own these.

Do you remember when you were a kid and the Walkman was the coolest thing to have? Well wait no longer as these ear buds rock! 🎶🎶🎶 The pure sound and rich bass that these ear buds is amazing and truly my favorite feature. The sound is so incredible and blows the air pods I have away. The noise cancelling feature is my next favorite thing. If you put these bad boys in and turn on the music I promise you won't hear anything but the music. Truly Noise cancelling. The app also has great features that allow you to adjust sounds any way you like them. Now let me tell you about charging. I can use these continuously for 8 hours on a single charge and when I put it back in the charging case it will charge back up and I can use them again. What's crazy is I can't even tell you how many times this case has charged my buds without charging the case. Simply amazing! The cell phone quality is just as amazing as the music as you can out both in and block out any sound. Another cool feature is the auto-shutoff when you take a bud out of your ear. If you need stop the music just take one out and it automatically pauses the music. Put it back in and you can pick up from where you left off. The technology of these air buds is second to none as it is now my daily tool for all things music and phone related. Don't waist your time looking for other air buds or headphones as you the only ones you need are the Sony WF -1000XM3’s. Bring back the Sony Revolution by picking up a pair and putting them in your ear while rocking out to your favorite jam! 🤘🤘🤘🤘 long live the

I’ve been using Jaybirds in the office and never loved the sound. These arrived today and now I’m writing a rare review. I love them...the fit, the sound. Got up and walked around a bit and they stayed connected. I also have the over-the-ear version. While these, of course, won’t be as great as a set of cans, but they’re a lot more comfortable and convenient. Agree with another reviewer that Sony hit it out if the park with these. Sony could improve its app, which has been a little glitchy, but it’s all good.

I absolutely love these earbuds! The presentation is stunning, with great design on both the earbuds themselves and the case as a whole. The controls are very well thought out and super easy to use, I just wish that there was an option that would allow you to change the volume. The charge is superb and lasts forever, not to mention that it recharges relatively quickly. On a separate note, the modes are very helpful and the quality is incredible! The depth of sound is so good that I found myself discovering new things in songs that I had been listening to for years, whether it be surprise instrumental or vocal snippets of audio. The noise cancellation works flawlessly, surprisingly so even at a relatively low volume. The best part is that these earbuds are made for everyone, since the amount of ear tips that come with the packaging have every size you could ever possibly need and there are two types to choose from (just make sure to space out the wear time because prolonged wear can cause sore ears). Overall, I was extremely impressed with these and would definitely recommend them to anyone and everyone.

column8: Pretty much exactly what I was hoping for
column9: I had been wanting truly wireless earbuds for a while but had no idea where to start looking for quality buds. I did a lot of research before making up my mind on these and I am not disappointed. I did not want AirPods (since I find them uncomfortable and only fair in quality) and I must say these are about 10 times better than the competition. The sound quality is fantastic and the numerous nub sizes pretty much guarantee they'll fit comfortably in any size ear. I don't use them for more than about an hour at a time so battery life has never been a problem. It was unclear whether or not they would wirelessly charge in the case, but they DO. The only reason I give them four instead of five stars is because the noise cancelation is only fair. I found it didn't quite live up to the hype and I don't need great noise cancelation anyways so I'm satisfied with them. Also, the Bluetooth connection will randomly disconnect and reconnect on occasion though it only interrupts the music for a second with a ding in the ear and doesn't prove to be much of an issue in my opinion. I find that the problem decreases over time. All the controls work well and I've had nothing but success with them so far. Overall, I think they are a great investment and worth the price of what you get compared to other brands.

Bought these for my husband. Superb product. It looks good and stylish. Quality build. The carry case stands out. Earbuds fit snugly and the options for the rubber ends cater for all sizes. The surround sound effect is out of this world.

Not as advertised for iPhone. While great for gaming and music, headset is essentially unusable for phone calls and video conferencing. Constantly cuts Bluetooth signal in those use cases and jumbles YOUR voice to other party on an intermittent basis. Lots of R&D needed to address.

The build quality, audio performance, and comfort on these earbuds is top-notch, with only a couple of minor quibbles. -=PAIRING=- Pairing with a bluetooth phone is nearly instantaneous, and the earbuds have no trouble maintaining their connection. On a Windows 10 PC, that's another story. The default Windows 10 drivers may not recognize this as an audio headset, and you may need a firmware update from Sony's site to get them to work at all. On a Razer 15 (2018) laptop, the pairing was constantly problematic. I have faith these kinks will be ironed out, but - as it stands - your mileage may vary. If PC connection is your primary usage scenario, I recommend the Jabra 65t's, unless noise cancellation is your top priority. These are Bluetooth 5.0, so they can handle two simultaneous connections. -=AUDIO QUALITY=- The WF-1000XM3's excel here. Highs are crisp and clear, mids are well defined, and the bass has a rich quality that is as good as I can expect from earbuds. The microphone has a tinny quality on the other end, but is otherwise serviceable. If you plan on talking all the time, look at the Jabra's instead. -=NOISE CANCELLATION=- The noise cancellation is nothing short of astonishing, if you take the time to get a good fit and seal. Rarely do "noise cancelling" earbuds live up to the claim. These are the exception. -=COMFORT=- The WF-1000MX3's come with seven different eartip options to ensure the best seal and fit. The earbuds themselves are lightweight and well-designed, and it's easy to forget that they are in there. -=BATTERY LIFE=- I have yet to successfully kill them before popping them back into the case. I see no reason to argue with the claim of 5 hours+. -=OVERALL=- If you're using these as noise cancelling earbuds for a phone, these are the top of the line. If you also want to pair to a PC, or plan on making a lot of calls, you may want to consider the Jabra 65t's instead. With those caveats, the audio performance - and especially the noise cancellation - is stellar.
Totally satisfied with this product.

column8: The Best in True Wireless Earbuds
column9: These were the true wireless buds I’ve been waiting for. No negatives really. They fit my ears perfectly (middle silicone buds).

I have used these earbuds every chance I get. The sound is nice and full creating a very nice musical experience when playing music. The noise cancellation and ambient sound settings are also great features that can be managed from the headphones app. The app is useful for setting how each earbud will work in terms of controls and activating or deactivating noise cancellation, etc... The range of use prior to experiencing a break in connection from the connected device is pretty lengthy. I can walk from one room into another without losing connection. Charging is pretty fast. I would like to see them last longer from a full charge when on standby. I've noticed if I place one in my ear for calls, I may take one or two calls and within an hour to hour and a half I get an alert to charge it. Longer standby time when not in active use would be great. I wasn't able to connect them to my computer or other devices that didn't have access to the app. Which resulted in the need to use other devices that were more universal connectivity options. Overall, great wireless earphones for sound experience and calls. The charging case maintains a charge for many days which I like and provides the ability to charge one and use another if needed. Recharging the case is also pretty fast which is good when in a crunch. I also found that they can be connected to two devices at once which I love!! I can set them for calls on my phone and for media on my tablet for listening to my audiobooks or music. Great capability! !

column8: Good for hearing music. Phone calls - impossible. Very bad quality microphone.
column9: This is probably a very good headset for hearing music, but I had to return them and they are useless for me. I would expect that expensive headset, which inlcudes a microphone, to have the Microphone actually works and to be able to have phone calls with it. But after a few phone calls that the other side could not hear me or understand me (including Sony support :) ), I understood that there is a problem here. I started with Sony's support, which they said that I have to download the mobile App and to use it to upgrade the Firmware. I explicitly asked them whether they expect it to improve the situation or they are just 'gaining time' with me (I don't want to waste my time on this). They said that upgrading the Firmware will improve the situation. I did, and no improvement. Then I looked at Sony communities and understand that this is the product by nature, I am not the only one with a problematic microphone. Actually probably all these Sony earbuds have a 'non working' (well) microphone. So I decided to invest time and write this review, hopefully to save you from making this kind of mistakes. If you think of using earbuds for making phone call - this is simply not the product.
Excellent headphones

column8: Really close but. It quite there
column9: I really like the fit and finish on these. The noise cancelling is great for an earbud but if you are expecting the type of noise cancelling you get from other headphones you will be a little disappointed. The Bluetooth connectivity cuts in and out at times and always seems to happen when I am taking a business call. That is annoying but not a deal breaker at all. I bought these mostly for use on an airplane and in the airport and they fit the bill nicely for those applications.

First off, I LOVE the look of these earphones! The case itself elevates them to another level. I enjoy looking at them and showing them off. I wasn't especially impressed with the noise cancelling abilities, but that might be because I'm so used to my Bose noise cancelling headphones (which I've been using for years). The thing about my over-ears, though, is that they're bulky so that is one of the reasons I was super excited for these small earphones from Sony. So, because of the convenience of these new in-ear headphones, I suspect that these will be with me on most trips. Audio quality is good. There is a nice balance although a little mid-range heavy. With some tweaking, it is possible to bring some bass and treble forward but doing nothing to the default settings still produces clear, pleasant sound. I do love the fact that they can adapt to the environment I’m in, which is a feature you can easily turn off if you don't like it. Battery life is one of the most important things to me and these did not disappoint. It will depend on how you use them, but I have gotten close to their advertised life so far, and the case holds another 3 full charges. Ultimately, I'm very happy with these. I'm sure I'll be wearing them for quite some time.

I got these headphones to replace my old wired earbuds. I’m not usually a fan of wireless headphones, but I decided to give them a shot since everyone told me they are very convenient. I picked these based on several reviews from tech/audio publications. From what I experienced, these head phones have good accurate sound, base was not overpowering but still present. However I found that it always sounds a bit muffled and not as “there” as other good wired headphones present themselves. I also found the noise canceling to be mostly a gimmick, even when I changed the earbud size to get the best seal in my ear. Microphone quality was okay, could be better but also could be far worse. Over all I would say that if you are looking at wireless headphones, these are far superior to any Apple product you could purchase, however if you are looking for the best sound in an earbud, a wired option like the Beyerdynamic SoulByrd might serve you better.

Cannot wait to test the latest Noise Canceling Wireless Earbuds from Sony. Yes it is tuly active noise cancelling with excellent sound. The battery life is decent for a whole day. The charge case is convenient and slick. WF-1000XM3 is the new benchmark for true wireless earbuds.
Nice one, little bitter uncomfortable when wearing. Noise cancellation not that useful.
Call becomes digital after a few minutes

I travel a lot and usually have the over the ear sony WH-1000XM3. At first I was sure they wouldn't sound as good but I was wrong. They actually play loud rap music and rock and roll without any distortion. The bass is clear and thumps and the highs are punchy. Super satisfied and will be using these wherever I go. I also thought they were a bit difficult to put in my ears but once I got the right nib everything was good to go. Also its a must that you use the equalizer in the sony "headphones" app. Such a huge difference.

Sony earbuds are awesome! The first time I tried this product, it was an amazing experience. The sound quality was the best I have heard ever! They are easy to use, feel very comfortable, and are lightweight. After a period of use, these are still amazing!
I use these mostly to watch Hulu on my tablet during my lunch hour. The sound is great. Bass is perfect and they fit in my ears nicely. I would buy them again.

column8: meh ANC and connectivity issues, don't waste time
column9: These earbuds look good and have great sound quality thanks to Sony's DSP and EQ functionality. However, two issues caused me to return these earbuds. First, the noise cancelling is at best mediocre. I tried all of the included tips as well as my own Dekoni foam tips which created the best seal and the noise cancelling still was not nearly as good as my older Bose QC-20 and QC-30s which don’t even require such a tight ear canal seal. For a better example, when washing dishes, the running water is much more audible on the Sony’s than on my older Bose ear buds. The other major flaw is that the right earbud would sometimes just stop playing sound, often if I pushed the play/pause “too quickly” (never happened on other headphones I’ve owned). The QC20/30s are still the best I have experienced. The QC 20s, though, are wired, something which I am trying to avoid in 2020, and the QC30s had a major decline in quality, i.e. basically started falling apart after a few months of use. Altogether, there has yet to be a satisfying ANC earbud released. The Bose 700 earbuds set to be released in 2020 could be it, but their quality control has plummeted recently, so I have doubts.

column8: Use the tutorial... you won’t be disappointed
column9: My first impression was disappointment. But after I watched a tutorial on how to “seat” this earbud, I was completely blown away. it really does have a solid noise canceling effect. And all of the ambient settings are really nice. I did have trouble pairing to my iPhone. But a simple reset was all that was needed. The sound is outstanding, although I wish they could get slightly louder. Overall, completely satisfied.

Sound quality is top. Noice cancelling is really good, tested on airplanes. Still think they are not ideal for active sports and also I cannot believe they cannot be used on a computer, only compatible with smartphones. This is almost unaccetable and would think twice to buy this item if I knew about it before I bought it

column8: Save your money - not worth nearly $250
column9: Anyone who says to buy these earphones is paid by Sony. They fall out of my ears routinely 8 times a day, when i have phone calls people say they can’t hear me, and they cut out sometimes while I’m walking around. I tried to dictate that with the earphones in and this is what it got: “Anyone who says to babysit for me Peter. Fall out of my ears routinely EKG, I have phone calls to see the kids for me, Washington catcher”
Grandson loves them, says they are far better than Air Pods.
uncomftorble

I received these as a gift and I absolutely love them. I can't believe how well they work. They come with a bunch of different sizes for the earbud part, so I was able to find ones that fit perfectly. I love the little case, which holds a charge so I will just keep it in my purse and put the earbuds back into it if they need more battery. However I'm really impressed with their battery life and I've gone a couple days in between charging the case. I use them at work to listen to music and in the car to take phone calls. The sound quality is amazing.

column8: Hands down the best noise cancelling earbuds. Hearing damaging compatibility issues with iPhone.
column9: I already had the over the ear WH-1000xm3 model - they are just amazing. The sound quality of these is equal, though the noise cancelling is quite not as good as with the WH model, perhaps because of additional physical isolation of the over the ear ones? The battery life is just 4 hours or so (vs. 30 hours with the WH), but with the small charging case this is really not an issue. I use the buds especially when doing sports such as walking and gym, but I think they probably would not stay in ears with more rigorous activities such as running. My only complaint is that every time I start to listen podcasts or music on my iPhone, the volume goes always up to 100%. There is no way around it in my iPhone settings, nor can you start listening with the earbuds off your ears because the music is automatically paused as soon as you do that. I hope either Apple or Sony come up with some kind of a fix to automatically limit the max volume, otherwise the hearing of many people will be permanently damaged.

column8: Good. The price does not make sense. Audio industry is corrupt. Read below.
column9: Overall rating is 2 Stars. (should be 1 Star, read below) Pros : * Convient Cons : * Pricing is too expensive for a pair of headphone.
