(audio industry companies is corrupt for money, read below) Alternative : # KZ ES4 * They cost $19.99 * 12X less money than Sony WF-1000XM3 * Has as much or even better than sound quality than the Sony WF-1000XM3 * Has as much or even better than sound quality than any large brand headphone maker in 2019. * noise canceling works because of great insulation and not fake tech that ruins audio * It does have cables and isn't wireless and no noise canceling technology but the sound quality is best in 2019. P.S. I returned 7+ pairs of headphones to buy the KZ ZST and KZ ES4. Trust me, headphones in 2019 are not anywhere near close the retail price of $100 or more. The Audio industry is corrupt because they over price materials and tools. If you want the best pair of headphone compared to every other large brand headphones, buy any of the headphones from KZ, because they know what they're doing. P.S.P.S I don't like 2019 noise canceling headphones because they mess around with the audio and it ends up being to fake music.

This product is amazing the sound and the base is one of the best I’ve had. The only reason I return this item the phone feature was horrible. If you’re looking for great sound these earbuds are for you. But don’t buy expecting the phone feature to be good

I got these noise canceling headphones with my husband in mind.. he works from home a couple days a week and with 5 kiddos sometimes it gets loud and he really needs to focus. These headphones easily drowned out the sound of a cranky toddler! I was surprised at how well they sound playing music with and without the noise canceling on. They fit perfectly and are comfortable to wear.. I was also very impressed with the battery life. My only downside is that they dont work well for phone calls.. each time we have tried using them for hands free calling the person on the phone cant hear us well at all. Other than that we are happily impressed and would recommend these earbuds!

column8: Excellent Choice for small factor earbuds
column9: My first impression of these ear buds is one of admiration, in comparison to other earbuds they sound so much better with the noise cancelling feature. It has a snug fit that won't fall off even when you go out for a run. It doesn't have the same noise cancelling features as a full on over-the ear headset but you can't really expect that in such as small factor. The wirelesss connectivity is great but the app needs a bit more work. The touch control is smooth and responsive, the battery life is also impressive, I usually charge these buds every two days! Over all I was super impressed with device and would definitely recommend it to friends. My only pet peeve is that it feels a tad bit heavy compared to other earbuds.

column8: Keeps falling off, okay noise cancellation
column9: Active noise cancellation is nothing compared to the over the ear headset version. The issue is that it easily falls off my ears despite trying all the different sizes. Audio quality is exceptional

Overall these are my favorite earbuds. They are also my first pair of noise-canceling earbuds. I've had a bunch of cheap-o in-ear buds and the Sony WH-1000 series. I've been very impressed with the noise-canceling features and the sound of the earbuds. The app is actually great and is able to determine different scenes and adjust the noise-canceling accordingly. I am very particular so I was pleased with the amount of customization in the headphone app. In the app you can change controls and what the headphones do when you tap them. The app also lets you change the eq levels and adjust the bass and treble. The battery life has exceeded my needs and combined with the charging case and regular charging I haven't reached a dead battery yet with some solid use. I'm glad it utilizes USB-C so it can age well and charger with the rest of my newer tech devices (minus my iphone) Call quality is pretty good on the WF-1000x M3s. I'm able to take/end calls with the touch and sound captured by the mic is pretty good. Given the distance from the bud to your mouth it does capture come ambient sounds and is not superior to talking directly into the handset which put the mic closer to your mouth but it's great for hands-free. I prefer talking on calls using one earbud so I can still carry-on conversations in person and I'm happy these buds can accommodate that. I like the look of the case. I ordered the black version and sometimes it's hard to find all black earbud cases so the bronze/rose gold accent makes them a lot easier to spot and add some elegance to the case. There are a bunch of nibs included to customize to your size. I tried all the nibs and the ones that were on the buds out of the box ended up being the ones that fit me best. My wish for the m4 is that the headphones get louder. It's plenty loud enough for me when using two earbuds but when I only use one I wish it was louder. Also, I wish the headphones were better at connecting to multiple devices. Currently, you can only connect to one device at a time and if it's connected to my phone I have to go into setting and disconnect before I can connect to another device. All in all, these are some solid great-sounding earbuds.

column8: did not live up to expectations after reading positive reviews
column9: I so wanted to like these ear buds as a replacement for my failing air pods The first set wouldn’t power on after a couple of weeks, got a replacement set on which this review is based Pros They are very comfortable in the ear many configuration options allow the sound to be set up to your individual taste There is a way to reset the ear pods Frequent software updates The case is nice Cons Supposed to be iPhone compatible, with an incoming call the ring tone is heard, if you answer via swipe the sound reverts to the phone, you have to force the Bluetooth to be the audio channel. To have a seamless transition you have to double tap the left ear bud, I found the double tap rate to be very variable The sound quality of the out going audio on phone calls was not awful, sound from the call is very good. i had to revert to a single AirPod to be heard on many calls after being told that I could not be heard. The app is not great, and how the noise cancelation works is a mystery I had to consistently reset the ear buds to get them to connect, which is very disappointing So in the end, I bit the bullet and bought the air pod pro ear buds which just work

column8: One of the best true wireless ANC earbuds - but horrible for calls
column9: These were the best sounding headphones I've tried in a long time, only beaten by Bowers & Wilkins PI3 in music quality. The good pieces: - Good noise cancellation - Good music quality - Intelligent sensors (take of the ear and the stop playing) - Ability to use either piece as a mono headset. Unfortunately, I don't need it just for listening to music, I've to do lots of conferences and calls, and that brought me to the blocker that made me return them: - The noise cancellation picks up too much ambient noise, to the point listeners can hardly hear you. - The case is huge, making it cumbersome to carry around. - The earpieces themselves are a bit heavy can become tiring after a couple of hours of use (at least for my ears). So, they are excellent for music and hearing, but horrible for conferencing and calls.

Love this but it just not that good with iPhone. Love the music when u play from your phone and all but u can’t do stuff like hey Siri n so on I think it’s perfect for Android or Samsung phone just not iPhones. The noise cancellation is good real good but I real wish it work good with iPhone

column8: Perfect for the daily commuter or traveler
column9: I’ve had these earbuds for about 2 weeks now. They have been a pleasure to bring with me wherever I go. The noise cancelling is shockingly good. I was skeptical to compare the noise canceling with my full-size over-ear headphones and they proved to be really efficient. Only moment of concern with ambient sounds was when I was hearing high winds while walking in the city. The battery life has not been an issue whatsoever. I only recharged once after a long week of use. My average commute includes about 30-45min of headphone use each way. Then they go back in the case to recharge and too off the earbuds again. I haven’t put them to the test on a long flight yet but I’m really excited to! I would recommend these headphones to artists, travelers, commuters, and people who work in noisy and distracting environments. They are also fashionable and comfortable!

First let me start by saying I own the fantastic over the ear headphones SONY WH1000XM3 and they are one my favorite items I own, specially since I travel a lot and they make my long haul flights much easier. As a music lover and musician, I’m always looking to listen to my music in the best form possible. When apple came out with their earbuds I wanted them but I thought they were very strange looking so I skipped them til this day. As soon as I saw the WF-1000XM3 I knew I needed to try them ASAP. Overall I am very satisfied with these Earbuds. Below are some highlights I found so far... •Design •Sound balance (Great Base, Mids and highs) •Smart listening with adaptive ambient sound •Size •Fast charging •Instant connectivity •Noise canceling •Comfortable I can’t wait to bring these on a plane to see how it goes with the noise canceling.

column8: Good when they work properly, but just get airpod pros instead
column9: These earbuds are great with regards to their sound quality, I mean fantastic, however they are incredibly buggy which is why I would unfortunately not recommend these to anyone. I really stuck by them for a while, waiting for firmware updates to fix issues with: bluetooth constantly disconnecting and reconnecting, only audio playing out of one ear, and touch controls being complete garbage that don't work(they have input lag and input queuing issues). However, none of these issues have been fixed months after purchase. One thing that is perhaps just an issue for me is the fit. They sit pretty far out of the ear and their anchoring method is bad. No matter which tips I use, they come loose whenever I do the most minimal of jogs within seconds. So they are impossible to exercise with. I just recently tried my friend's airpod pros and man do I feel cheated. It seems like Apple just made a superior product for the same price. Take my advice and just go buy some airpod pros.

column8: Excellent Sound, phone integration. Creates productivity.
column9: One of the best purchases I've ever made. Amazing sound quality, excellent noise cancelling, and easy integration with google assistant. These headphones have made me more productive, being able to answer calls, listen to texts, sway to music, all in a quiet bubble of my own while I work on a laptop in the middle of a noisy coffee shop. Love these! !

When you open the box you are presented with a very nice display and the case and headphones are very sleek looking with a matte finish. The headphones definitely look a little more modern and stylish than other true wireless headphones. They give you plenty of extra earbuds made of silicone and foam in different sizes which is great since not everyone has the same size ears. Calls are great and people can hear me clearly and I can hear them clearly as well. Music sounds really good. Good-Noise cancelling is great, comfortable fit, very sleek, audio quality and clarity is great. Not so great-not waterproof so not good for the gym, the fit is good but it can fall out pretty easily with too much motion, wind causes sound in the headphones because of the mic, the app could be better. While these headphones aren't perfect I would say they are still the best on the market. True wireless tech is slowly improving and getting better but it I don't think anyone has made it perfect yet. But if you want a true wireless pair of headphones with ANC and great sound quality I would say this is your best option.

12/4 Updated Review: I was able to figure out my "user issues" had to do with understanding the auto “environment” detection. Once I figured it out and was able to adjust and change settings, I was able to fully understand my user error. I have taken these on my daily walks, mowing the lawn, at work, and on airplane flights and they perform flawlessly. I love these and do not intend to set them aside for no reason. I highly recommended this product. I have been using the earbuds 100% every day since I received them. Their sound and quality are superb and they are overall excellent performers. The case and earbuds both seem very sturdy and high tech. I do have a few minors sometimes annoying quirks: once in a while I hear "dings" on my earbuds. I have been checking to see if there are any kind of notifications that create these "dings" but have not been able to figure it out. Also, sometimes I am not too clear between the different modes when I am exercising or static and I find myself switching from one to another. I think these are more user issues since I have not really read any tutorials, and these are high tech earbud in my opinion. I plan on going through the tutorial so that I can fully take advantage of all the nice features these have. I also have to figure out how to enable google assistant so that I can take advantage of it. The minor quirk I have about the design is that although it comes with 3 or 4 ear tips, I do not find a big enough one for my ears and I am constantly re-inserting them, so they don't fall off. I wish they had a deeper and wider tip I could use instead. I have been looking for some on-line but don't want to order them since I am not sure they will be any bigger or wider.

These earbuds represent the quality that I have come to expect from the Sony brand. The build quality of both the earbuds and the case are excellent, commensurate with the premium price tag. The case, while a bit large, is lightweight, and has the usual LEDs to designate charging status. Although the earbuds themselves are also a bit larger than others, presumably to accommodate the NC electronics, comfort level in the ear is quite good, allowing me to wear the earbuds for extended periods without irritation. The multiple sets of earbuds provided should provide a good fit for just about everyone. I am getting about six hours of use per charge, which is more than enough for most listening sessions. I generally recharge overnight, so I can't comment on the claimed quick recharge feature. Sound quality, with good bass, and noise suppression are so much better than the bargain earbuds that I have used in the past. I have been using them during yard work and have no problem hearing the music as the the lawnmower and other equipment noise is well suppressed. I'm especially happy that the earbuds are maintaining the streaming connection with my phone throughout the yard with no drop offs or synch issues, although I do have a strong outdoor wifi signal with my mesh network. I haven't had the need to use the touch controls much, especially since there is no volume control on the earbuds themselves. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase.

There are a lot of things I love about this set. I love the sound that I get from the earbuds when playing music. Music is very clear and I can hear more of songs that I could before. They're also very comfortable and easy to pair. I can wear them for quite a while without my ears hurting or feeling tired. Pairing them with my devices was very easy and the app was easy to use as well. I also appreciate the noise canceling optimizing itself automatically as I listened to different audio. Charging them was very easy and I love the indicator on the case showing they're charging. The case is a little large for some but I do like the size for me personally. Google assistant is very helpful and I like the feature of having it read out my notifications through my ear. I'm not a huge fan of loud noise coming from my phone so I appreciate being able to hear my notifications through the earbuds. My issues with the earbuds would be the battery. For whatever reason, my left ear bud would drain faster than the right ear bud. Overall, I used the earbuds quite a bit but I did have to charge them quite a few times throughout the day. It's not completely bad but something I had to keep an eye on. Also, my voice would go in and out during calls. There were plenty calls that I had to restart to try and get a better connection.

So I love these headphones, I have tested most and the sound quality coming out of these is bar none the best. So why the 2 stars? Cause the lack of waterproofing and reaction to getting wet literally damaged my hearing in my left ear. Sony stated "We never had any complaints about issues with people working out in these"...TOTAL SCUMBAGS. These got wet from sweat and let out a high pitch squeal that has left me partially deaf in one ear. DO NOT WORK OUT IN THESE OR HELL... DON'T EVEN TAKE EM IF ITS RAINING!
What a great set of headphones. Sound is excellent and calls are crystal clear. Noise cancelling is very good to excellent just make sure you get a good fit.
Its ab amazing product 5/5

Overall, these earbuds are better than any alternatives available on the market. They generally do a good job of canceling out background noises, but don't quite have the same capabilities as over-ear or on-ear options. I really like the ambient sound setting that allows you to have conversations without having to take the earbuds off. They are pretty comfortable and easy to wear for extended periods of time. Battery life is pretty good, I tend to get around 6-7 hours of life when using the noise cancelling and/or ambient sound modes, and longer when those are off. It's very convenient charge the earbuds in the case, and I have never run into a situation where the earbuds and the charging case were both out of battery. My one gripe here would be that the case is rather large and bulky for earbuds. They are easy to pair to Android headphones, and the Sony Headphones app makes it very easy to customize the earbud touch controls. Unfortunately, the first pair of earbuds that I ordered stopped working after a couple weeks (the right one was not able to be charged). However, it was relatively easy to order a replacement pair. Overall, these are, in my opinion, the best option for wireless earbuds currently on the market in terms of sound quality and noise canceling ability. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a pair of great-sounding earbuds!

All I can say is wow. Sound quality is amazing, noise canceling Is magic, synced right out of the box no problem. Many options of size for the ear piece. Another thing I like is they don’t stick out to far from my ears. I use them in the noisy NY subway and they are so good!
They sound great but charging is an issue. They don't support wireless charging and the charging cord is only about 4 inches long. Also not sweat resistant. Returning

I've been putting these things through the ringer and I am loving these earbuds. My only issue is with taking calls. Unfortunately, the people on the other end of the line say they have issues hearing me. Aside from that, these are great! The sound quality is amazing, battery life is extremely long, and the noise cancelling function is spot on. These suckers arrived just in time for the start of elementary school band. My daughter chose to play the sax and I'm sure someday she will be amazing, but for now I find solace in my noise cancelling Sony WF-1000XM3 earbuds!

I absolutely love these earbuds. Sound quality and noise cancelling are strong suits of these earbuds. Although the base isn't as good as my powerbeats it's still my preferred earbuds. Its definitely more comfortable at least for me. I suggest everyone to install the app to get the firmware update. The one con is the app however and is far behind anything apple provides in terms of convenience. I will update if I run into any problems.

column8: Forget the instructions just follow the App for Set-up
column9: Very cool, I set the Left Bud to silence, turn on and off Ambient and Noise canceling. Set up the Right Bud for Google, Siri, or Alexa. This allows you to not just answer and make calls but rather to ask anything like weather, time, Next Track, Restart, last Track. Negatives: Volume is controlled only by your phone. However, with my Galaxy Buds you Swipe volume up and down and that really did not work at all. I have both this model and the over the ear models. Yeah, They are expensive so I hope they last and I bought the 3 year warranty,

These earbuds are great for my listening needs, since I am on the go a lot. The wireless feature means not getting tangled up in a cord or having limited head movement. The noise cancelling feature means I can listen to my music or chat on a call from anywhere and hear clearly. With a variety of ear tips, the earbuds are comfortable for long term wear and the battery life lets me listen for hours. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest opinion.
Crisp clear sound. These seal to your ear and the sound quality and noise cancelation is excellent

column8: High Fidelity Speakers in a compact earbud size
column9: 1) A true noise cancelling headphone packed into a compact earbud size. These earbuds are an audiophile's dream come true. When you put these on and activate noise cancellation you are totally immersed in the sound you are listening to. With just the touch of a finger you can hear somebody speaking to you and when you take your finger away the blissful sound of music returns with no background noise. 2) Adaptive sound control is a great feature and the app allows for fine tuning for greater control. Whether you are walking, running, doing yard work, a passenger in an automobile, on a train, or flying; the adaptive sound control can sense what you are currently doing and will allow more or less noise cancelling as needed. It is also active and switches modes automatically as needed if you have this feature turned on in the app. 3) The size of the earbuds are a little bit bulkier than average. They do fit well within the ear and there is not much of an issue of having them fall out as long as they are inserted properly. They do come with several different sizes of gel like ear pieces, and then the conventional style pieces to choose from. 4) They work with Google Assistant, Siri, and thanks to the latest firmware update Alexa has been added. 5) Sound quality coming from these little guys is just truly amazing. I don't think anything will ever beat a true quality set of over the ears. However, if you are a music buff, or just enjoy quality sound and want to travel, these are for you. The frequency response of these speakers is breath taking. Listening to soprano tracks of Whitney Houston voice capable of 5 octaves is a great testament to what the highs and mids can do for these speakers. As for the bass, I have NEVER heard such punching full deep sound from such a compact device. You won't find another pair of earbuds that sound this good as of right now. 6) Battery life is great, I can play them all afternoon and still have a charge left. Toss them in the case and they are ready to go at 100% again in no time. The case can recharge the earbuds about 6 times without a recharge. Now thanks to the latest firmware you can tell how much battery level is left in the case via the app. 7) With the latest firmware Sony has also added volume touch volume control. While the price may be a little higher, the quality of this product certainly makes up for it two fold! Certainly a must have for any techy or music lover.

I’ve had these headphones for about a month now and I can say they are one of best headphones I own. I always wanted some wireless noise-canceling earbuds and nothing came close until the Sony WF-1000XM3. The set-up process is little complex and needs a little work. With Bluetooth and the app, is supposes to assist with the connection process and ability to provide a stable connection. The sound quality is awesome. The app provides an opportunity for you rotate through all kinds of different genres, from pop, R&B, to rap. Combine with noise cancelling feature, it provides an excellent out of the box experience. The design of Sony WF-1000XM3 is nice and with all the custom ear tips, you can get a perfect fit for your ear. I use different size for each ear to get a tight fit. With the good fit, it can cut out ambient sound effectively. The battery life is all day without active noise canceling and with noise canceling you will get about six hours. With the battery charging case, you can three addition charge for up to 32 hours of play time. If you every forgot to charge your battery, a quick 10-minute charge will give you up to 90 minutes of play time for a great workout. Overall, I love this headphone and truly will be by go to headphone. I would recommend Sony WF-1000XM3 to anyone. Only disclaimer, I did receive this headphone at a discounted rate for my review, however, the opinion express in this review is my own opinion.

Set up of the Sony WF-1000XM3 Wireless Noise Canceling headphones on my phone was so simple! I will admit I had trouble before my phone updated though. They sound amazing just as promised. These earbuds come with multiple covers to find the right ones to fit perfectly in you ears. I have the issue of earbuds hurting my ears usually but not these. They just slide in, a slight turn and they click in place. I am even able to use them on multiple devices which I like. The fact that the carrying case also charges the earbuds is really convenient. It takes some trial and error but worth it! I would definitely purchase these again. I received this product with a rebate for testing purposes in exchange for my honest review.

column8: A must have: Excellent noise cancelling and battery life
column9: This head-phone looks a bit big in pictures, but it doesn't feel that way at all when wearing it. In the beginning it's a bit tricky to figure out the noise-canceling, you need to ensure that you are using the right earpiece to prevent gaps from allowing noise to enter your ears. Other than that it's just great, high-quality, long lasting battery and very easy to setup.

column8: Great headphones, a little slow with Bluetooth connection
column9: Let me start my review with what i think is my biggest tip to using these earbuds properly. Make sure to try all the included tips to make sure you have the right one. I thought the ones ithat were of the style i normally use on different earbuds were the right ones for me, but i was completely wrong. The differences between the wrong tips and the right ones are like night and day. I typically use these while out and about, listen to music, audiobooks and make phone calls. I like the fit, and have not had any problems with them falling out of my ear once i had the correct tips on and learned the proper way to twist them on. Sound quality is excellent as is voice quality to the phone i use. I did recently upgrade my phone and had to pair them to the new phone using the Bluetooth settings on my phone rather than with the app, but after i figured out using the app to pair wasnt going to happen, the pairing process went smooth. Noise cancelling on these worked outstandingly well. Flew on a 32 hour flight recently and they were comfortable and quiet for most of the flight. I did charge the case in the seat charger, so i missed an excellent opportunity to check total battery life, but i just didnt want to be without them when i wanted them. These are not waterproof, but when i buy something i intend to use it how i want to and if it doesnt hold up, ill move onto something else. I was in southeast asia during monsoon season, and i would wear these out and around doing nothing special to keep them dry other than what i do to keep my head dry...used and umbrella. I also go to the gym once a day and usually spend an hour on the treadmill. And im a sweater hehe. Even just out and about in tropical climates i sweat a lot. But have had no issues with these as far as i use them still going strong. So overall these are the best sounding of the six different brands i have, their charge lasts for several days of my use. Their noise cancelling is great and they do everything i ask them to do better than any of the others i have tried. So much so, that these are now a part of my every day carry gear.

column8: Too fancy for its own good
column9: Perhaps I am unable to select the right features but I have not enjoyed these expensive earbuds. I use them for everything from meditation to when I am out and about. Very often, even in quiet meditation, the software changes the sound quality from nice to transistor radio quality, then eventually, quiet, goes back to some other sound quality. It sounds like several different earbuds all in one experience. I can find no difference with "noise canceling" either. Sometimes it disconnects for no apparent reason.

In this particular moment in time mobile phone companies have deemed the headphone jack to be an unnecessary feature. So naturally the current electronics landscape is full of options. I received a pair of Sony’s latest true wireless earphones the WF-1000XM3 at a discount for my honest evaluation. Packaging Once you open the box you are greeted by a card which gives you pairing instructions in three simple steps. I had no issues pairing the earphones with both android and iOS devices. You are given 6 additional sets of earphone tips so finding the proper size for you is simple this helps you to get a proper seal that helps to b lock some of the ambient noise around you. The inclusion of USB-C at least for me is much appreciated thus cutting down on my need to carry multiple charging cables. The Design With the included sets of eartips I was able to easily find the right tips to get a perfect seal. I did find the lack of an IP rating and wireless charging to be a strike a against what is thus far an excellent earphone. The price point in which Sony sells the WF-1000XM3 other competitors fit those features in. Battery Battery life for the earphones are excellent 8hrs without noise cancelling 6hrs with noise cancelling on . Having the case fully charged can give you over 24hrs worth of use which is plenty for me. In my use I found these estimates to be mostly accurate. Noise Cancelling I did manage to use the noise cancelling in a couple different circumstances and must say that it managed to drown out background noise effectively. Bluetooth Now with other first generation bluetooth earphones I have owned in the past from other manufactures were prone to constant disconnects. I must say I have not experienced this at all with the WF-1000XM3. Sound Quality Music The Sony WF-1000XM3 does an excellent job of reproducing music through the different music streaming services that I use. The earphones offer an engaging and refined sound that allows me to listen to music for extended times when I am out and about. The Sony connect offers a few different equalizer settings allowing anyone to tailor the sound more to there liking. Sound Quality Calls When it comes to speaking to someone during a call using the earphones the quality is just ok. The other party has trouble making out what I am saying at times if there is a lot of background noise around me such as by a train station or bus station. With the exception of the lack of IP rating and wireless charging the Sony WF-1000XM3 is easy to recommend but Sony should offer these in the next generation if they want to keep up with their competition.

column8: A good, not great, set of earbuds
column9: Good fit. Sometimes the sound level arbitrarily is decreased, but resetting these back into the holder resolves the problem.

column8: Great noise canceling and sound quality. Calls ok
column9: These have outstanding noise canceling ability and good sound. They adapt to what you are doing for safety. The only knock I have is that the call quality is not perfect.

column8: They really do block out the backround noise. 👍🏿👍🏿
column9: 🔥🔥🔥🔥 SO HAPPY I MADE THIS PURCHASE
Amazing in a crowded restaurant. switching from ambient to noise canceling instantly quiets the room and put you in a very sweet place with your music. Great way to totally ignore someone.

column8: Fix connection issue with earbuds and app
column9: The connectivity with the iPhone was spotty and the app kept crashing

Once you get the right fit, they are fantastic. Do yourself a favor and get the compatible Comply pro fit memory foam ends. They make a huge difference with the isolation and the sound is amazing. Also,they’ve added the ability to adjust the volume on the bud which was lacking on purchase. I highly recommend these.
bass was way better than expected

After reading a bunch of reviews, I tried these. I have a bit of hearing damage after years of working with heavy machinery. So I really prefer something with heavy bass and plenty of noise cancelling and volume. I have always been a Powerbeats 2/3 user. I tried the PowerBeats Pro which are okay, but even they lack bass and volume - and that's a Beats product. These are stylish and come with a great app which allows you to tweak settings and equalizer settings for use with every sound source you're using - a huge plus. But ultimately, the noise cancelling was just mediocre and they have VERY weak bass compared to Beats and the volume doesn't really go that loud. Sound wise, I didn't think they were that clear and nuanced, but honestly, my ears aren't ones to judge. If you're looking for volume and bass, look elsewhere. However, if you're looking for style and general use headphones, these might be just the fit.

Really Great case is a little big but the battery on the case and earbuds are great. My biggest issue is it is constantly disconnecting and reconnecting and sometimes it is a hassle to get it to connect to my phone.
Will randomly disconnect from phone. Also says that it’s connected every time it’s out in your ear even if it isn’t connected
Falls out of your ears. Great sounds, excellent build quality. However, start walking or jogging and it'll pop right out

I wanted to take just a few minutes to provide some tips for these earbuds. I consider these the best sounding wireless earbuds out right now and listening to music was the primary reason I got them so I won't comment on call quality since I really haven't used them for that. - The noise cancelling out of the box seemed non-existent until I changed the earbud covers. Sony sends several sets of both silicone and foam types. I use the largest silicone ones and instantly the noise cancelling starting working like you would expect the Bose ones to in store. Definitely try the others and find the proper fit! - Immediately out of the box, these sounded awesome! I messed around with the equalizer and suddenly they didn't. I prefer bass heavy sounds (think Beats, not Bose) and quickly realized what I had did. First off, I use Android and already used a custom equalizer which was why they sounded so great when I first used them. I proceeded to mess with the the equalizer in the Sony app and figured out it wasn't for me. Changing the equalizer provides very "clean" sound changes and you can also add or remove "clean bass". I realized clean bass wasn't for me as I preferred (dirty?) original bass. I also noticed the volume quit increasing after my phones "Safe limit" when the Sony equalizer on. I ended up just turning off the equalizer and voila, my music was back to sounding amazing like when I first turned them on. Those that prefer the "balanced" sound of Bose or Apple will likely enjoy the equalizer but I just didn't like how any of it's options changed the music. - The voice assistants seem to work well. I chose Google assistant over the others and it's quick and easy to use. - USB C charging thank goodness! - With the high quality options turned on and the active noise cancelling, i'm averaging around 4 hours of play time. These recharge really quick as well so I have no issue with battery life. Also, the cases battery capacity seems to just keep going. Overall, highly recommend. I also own Galaxy buds, older Sony earphones, and the Jabra 65s (tested a few others including Airpods, Bose, and Beats Pro) and the sound quality and active noise cancelling with these Sony's are unmatched.

Wow!! What a miss... I really tried to love these. I did. Two stars because sound quality and noise cancelation are superb even though there is a learning curve. Controls are super finicky, even the wind will make my left ear bud ding! Annoying! You can remove the options to control your earbuds using the touch function but I should not have to experience a loss of functionality due to a faulty design. Especially not at this price point! But the worst part is just how absolutely painful these are to wear. I’ve had them for about 4 days and have tried absolutely everything, twisting, different positions, different tips. They just HURT. The design is not a fits all kind of design and after a couple hours of wearing, my poor outer ears are aching. If I try to not push them in as deep, I cannot get a good seal and the noise cancellation is ineffective. I find myself taking them off and going back to my cheap pair of earbuds every day. I’ve completely given up and will be returning these ASAP. These are totally unusable to me. Sooo disappointing.

For something so expensive I don't have a high tolerance for the little things. The design is tough and the user experience can be rough around the edges but for a 8 hour factory shift (very loud) I found these to be an almost perfect product. They are just a few thing involving day to day use (like controls) that need a little work.

column8: Everything about the headphones are as advertised
column9: I wish they were a little bit louder

column8: I love these headphone PLUS latest update (Dec 2019) added volume control on the earbuds
column9: I'm not going to go into great tech detail as many have done so before me but this is what I like about these. PROS: * Noise cancelling is amazing for ear-buds. I used them on New York subways and have no trouble listening to quiet music * The sound is amazing -- much better than other noise cancelling headphone such as my QC35 and Airpods Pros. Nice to be able to set different EQs and even create custom ones. * Battery life is superb * I love the adaptive sound control, i.e., you can set the earphones to one of 3 different modes (Ambient Sound amplified and ANC off, just ANC off, or ANC on) depending on whether you are stationary, running, walking, or moving in a vehicle or mass transit. * For me (your mileage may vary) the buds fits snugly and comfortably in my ear. * If you hold you hand over your left ear, ambience sound comes through (good for hearing subway announcements, etc). * I like how you can configure each earbuds touch control using the headphone app to set the level of noise cancellation, pause/play, access Siri/Alexa. Newest upgrade just added VOLUME CONTROL. * The case is very stylish and holds a lot of juice for multiple charges. * New software automatically disconnects from old device when you connect to new device so switching is a breeze. * Firmware updates are pretty easy (although you have to set the earphone not to turn off when you remove them if you don't want to have to wear them during the update which can take 20 minutes sometimes). CONS: * Sony did not give any kind of water-resistant certification which means if you get water-damage you are SOL. Not a problem for me as I wear cheapo sports buds in the gym and my jacket has a hood. But something to consider. * Headphone app does not always connect right away even though headphones are clearly connected. * The firmware corrupted once -- easy fix to reset the headphones, but I had to Google it to find out how. * If you set the left earphone to control volume, covering the left ear to let in ambient sound no longer works and it merely reduces the volume instead. For me not a big deal as I prefer to remove the right bud when I want to hear an announcement or if someone starts talking to me. * Case is bigger than AirPod case, but no biggee for me. * No functionality to find earbuds if misplaced (I think new AirPod pros have this). This is a "nice to have" rather than a real con. Overall, I am happy with my WF-1000mhx bud and I only use by BOSE during a long flight, in bed, or when I want to double it as earmuffs on a cold day. :)
Love these
I love these headphones Sony is the best! !

Not worth $250. They skip all the time and wouldn't even pair with my BT sound adapter on my PC. The sound cancellation can cause noise in windy situations so they are not good for riding on a bike, so I decided to use them at home for watching movies quietly. The sound cancellation is great for tuning out the AC unit but they wouldn't pair with the BT adapter. My $40 and my $80 earbuds had no problem with that. Not worth $250.
Able to use 1 earbud at a time

I have had every generation of the MDX headphones and these buds WF-1000XM1, WF-1000XM2, and these are the best so far. Sony is clearly focused on aesthetics these look great, and they finally fixed the battery issues and added a charge case like Jabra and Apple, which is kinda of a must have for budds now. The second gen was horrible at battery life. The noice canceling is the best in its class and I have tried them all, Jabra #2. Sound is great. But for me, the deal breaker is how bad the Bluetooth is. You may not have this issue, but for me I have a old unlimited plan so I have Bluetooth but Bluetooth sharing is disabled by carrier. But Sony doesn’t account for this. So I have to manually connect the budds every time I take them out of the case, instead of connecting automatically. It sometimes does, but that’s rare. Sometimes connection just drops and you cannot connect, and see a temp device name in your Bluetooth settings. Phone calls are almost always dropped right off the bat. These issues have made these budds unbearable so I would not recommend, maybe gen 4.

column8: The best true wireless audio in an almost perfect package
column9: First off let me start by saying that the audio quality these true wireless earbuds put out is unmatched. While you may get slightly more bass out of a certain competitor, the overall range and rich sound quality truly outshines the rest while the bass remains very solid and doesn't distort the audio in the slightest. These earbuds also have DSEE HX which makes a HUGE difference when listening to compressed audio. The noise cancelling is perfect and the ambient sound allows enough hearing through but is easily negated if the volume is up at a medium level. One of the coolest features is once they are drained, being able to get a solid hour and a half or so of listening time off a quick 10 minute charge! Adaptive hearing works pretty flawlessly as you transition from sitting to walking to driving, and I seem to get a solid 4 hours of battery life on high volume, although the battery will last longer at lower volumes. It comes with 6 different ear piece fittings so I was easily able to find the right size and the case is magnetic as to keep them from falling out easily. My only complaint with these headphones is when attempting to answer or make phone calls, people cannot hear me very well, so I end up always taking my earbuds out and completing the call on my actual phone. If you're looking to use these with high priority on call clarity, these may not be the best fit for you. However if you are focused on finding a true wireless earbud with top notch sound quality, I think you can look no further.

Been wanting these for months and finally worked up the money to get them. I did plenty of research on them before but so knew they were good but I haven't been disappointed at all. Also sony did a software update which gave the ability to change volume with the earbuds and not have to take out your phone which is nice.

These are great earbuds. The only gripes that I can think of are that: 1. The sound seems average but is definitely better than your cheaper typical earbuds. I think they could sound better though. 2. The noise canceling is cool and so is the wind noise reduction and the various ambient levels. They truly do work but I can still hear people with NC on but it's not bad at all. 3. The batter is great but I think that a single bud get about 5 hours usually. And the case last for about 3 days of constant use from 6am to 4pm. Also if you shake your head very fast and hard about 4 times they will fall out. And lastly the touch controls are awesome. Just wish you could mess with the volume instead of telling Google to do it or manually. Overall these are great but are over priced haha. But thats just how it is. And that's my opinion.

To start, I am very satisfied with these earbuds. However, there are a few things that prevent them from a 5 star rating. Im sure these issues could be fixed w/future updates, which is a good thing. Sound: This is where these really shine, the noise cancelling is superb. Once you enable the full noise cancelling effect, you are locked in! Full bass, crisp highs, no distortion from what I can tell. Comfort: It is imperative you spend some time messing with the different earbud tips or else you wont get the proper sound or fit. At first I was using the incorrect size and was not impressed with comfort, sound or fitment. But once I messed with the different bud sizes, it was like night and day. Battery/pairing : I havent run into any issues even running them almost at full volume, plus the case doubles as a charger so thats pretty sweet. Pairing is super easy, just open the case and youre almost instantly connected. Features/app: This is where the buds get dinged a little. So the recommended app is kinda limiting I think and needs a little work. The auto-noise cancelling feature is a bit gimmickey and doesnt always work nearly as it should. I find that just turning the feature off and manually adjusting the amount of noise cancelling needed. Touch controls are a bit hit and miss. Registering touch isnt always on point. Water/sweat resistance is another big deal for me. I primarily use these at the gym and not having water/sweat resistance is a bit stressful. I like the Google Assistant feature and it works surprisingly well so thats a plus. Switching songs can be frustrating sometimes bc of touch sensitivity. Overall these are bad ass and I would recommend them. Small firmware/software tweaks can address all but the water resistance issue.

column8: Great sound + noise cancellation in a true wireless earbud form factor
column9: I have been using these for a couple of weeks and have been very pleasantly satisfied with their audio performance. Full bass without being overpowering and warm sounding with pretty good soundstage. Battery life is not a problem but if you do run low a 10 min quick charge gives you 90 more minutes of playtime. They come with a wide selection of ear tips including silicone and memory foam which are pretty comfortable and allow for pretty good passive isolation. You are able to toggle between noise cancellation on/off and ambient sounds. When using the app you can select automatic adjustment which seems to do very well-when you are walking you might want to know what is going on around you, but if you are commuting on train/subway noise cancellation makes it possible to listen to your music/videos at a lower sound level. Noise cancellation works great for subway/train. I did try them on an airplane ride as well and they get rid of a lot of the droning sounds but are not quite as effective as the Sony over the ear noise cancelling headphones (WH series), however I prefer the compact portability of the earbuds. As far as any drawbacks, pairing/switching with iOS was a little problem but seems to have been fixed with a firmware update. The case, though stylish in Black with Copper metallic accents, is a little on the bulkier side compared to other wireless earbuds. Also they do stick out of the ears a little more than some other earbuds, and the fronts do seem to catch the wind and cause some noise if it's windy out so perhaps not the best for jogging/running (also not waterproof). However, the touch sensitive circular surface for controls is flat and easy to delineate. Over all I am very happy with my Sony WF-1000XM3 ear buds. If only Sony would work on their naming conventions! ;)

column8: Great sound qaulity, wouldn't be ideal for anything active.
column9: Great sound quality with ajustable EQ. Noise cancellation works well but seems quite sensitive and will toggle on and off occasionally. Wouldn't be good for working out as they fall out relatively easy when I run or jump, or even bending over. That aside, they are solid earbuds with good quality sound. Charging case is pretty nice and charges quickly.

Spoiler alert, I really like these headphones. These were sold out for a long time and I see why. Having never used AirPods I can’t compare them but I know from previous interactions with the headphones design and shape that they’d fall out regularly. Which is why I guess the pro version seems to have addressed this. But back to the products in hand. They had been recommended to me by the same friend who had used the over ear WH-1000XM3’s hmmm and loved them. Like their over ear older brother they’re light and sleek looking. I needed something low profile to work out in and just take up less space. The over ear counter part is at times sometimes too impractical for working out but the WF-1000XM3’s small shape and light weight design are great for training. I did a head shake test and the headphones stayed very secure. As such I trust them for working out. I will say that on an Airplane I would opt for the over the ear WF-1000XM3 for noise cancellation. The other thing is that because they are larger and therefore more visible people tend to ‘get the message’ that you do not wish to be disturbed, unlike when using the in ear headphones. I have used other wireless earbuds. While the case that they came with was smaller it didn’t hold nearly as much battery life. In the time that I have been using them over the past month, it has been rare for the headphones to not be fully charged when I’ve pulled them out of the case. The case (though sometimes a little bulky) and the headphones are also much better looking and the headphones are more comfortable to wear. As you would expect most of there is an app which helps you to connect to your smartphone. You can do a lot to customize the settings and like with the over head version, the automatic mode helped to set audio levels with minimal effort from me. Couple things to note here. As a busy man I often don’t get to read manuals and watch tutorials on new gear that I get. So I expect things to work straight out of the box. These did but that brings me to my second point. I haven’t taken time to work out the things like how to change the track or the volume but do know how to pause and play music, which is enough for me to enjoy the experience. I don’t like that when adjusting to different sound environments the headphones stop playing music. It can be quite jarring when listening to something. I also don’t like the size of the case as sometimes it doesn’t fit in to pockets discreetly. I do like that the headphones seem to know when I take them out of my ears and when I return them to my ears. This is simple and effective. Sound quality is amazing with note bass and depth than I would expect from something so small. The app gives many options for changing the way the music sounds with a range of presets. Noise cancellation is much better than I would expect for in ear headphones and again I was pleasantly surprised by just how well the noise was handled. Altogether a great product. Worth investing in. (Full Disclosure - received these in return for a review)
Loved it some difficulty to pair with iphone

Model of Phone: iPhone 7+ IOS version: 13.3 Firmware of earbuds: 2.02 Connection issues: Bluetooth connection drops every few minutes with "bluetooth disconnected" message, and the only way to connect back is to go back to settings and manually connect back and the whole fiasco keeps repeating, with dropped connections, unable to finish even one song. I have set the stable connection as priority over sound quality and that does absolutely nothing. Crappy App: Headphones app will not start if notifications on iphone is enabled for it. It will keep crashing out when user starts the app. Only when notifications is disabled for it under general->notifications then the app will start. It took me hours to figure this out, otherwise the app wouldn't start and we need this app to get this to work and after spending so much time with it, the connectin keeps dropping. Frustration doesn't even begin to describe it! Edit: Finally figured out the issue of constant disconnection, if your house has anything that is using the ancient bluetooth 2.0, it will interfere with the 1000XM3's connection and cause it to drop constantly. I had a USB bluetooth 2.0 adapter connected to my PC and when my PC is switched off, all connection issues stopped. So, if you exeperience constant disconnections at home, move outside 20-30metres and if all turns out well, then it sure is something that interferes with it. I disabled bluetooth on my PC and there has not been any disconnection since. I would now rate this a 4.0 due to the above-mentioned app issue. The sound quality and ANC on this earbuds is amazing.

I did a ton of research on blue tooth wireless headphones. My research led me to two different brands so I made the decision to go with the new Sony 1000xm3. A decision I have not regretted. Not only is the sound quality something you would expect from a Sony product, but the noise cancellation is literally out of this world! If you are torn between two products like I was myself, go with the 1000Mx3’s you won’t regret it!

column8: If you use these to talk look for something else
column9: they work great for music but no good for talking.

Sound better than AirPods pro but is nothing compared to liberty 2 pro. Bass is tinny, mids and highs weak. Bluetooth connection is weak. Battery meter is unreliable, battery life is also less than manufacture specification.

Had very high hopes for these. Love the size/portability and they’re really not uncomfortable. The biggest issue is they CONSTANTLY cut out while listening to music. I have updated the firmware and my phone is in my pocket or lap while using them. A song will be playing and all of a sudden for no particular reason one will just quit working. Then the other. They always come back on, but this happens on every song in my playlist. It’s very frustrating. The sound quality is good. They pair right up. I don’t have any use for noise cancelling but that seems to work fine as well. Battery life definitely needs to be better. Get about 4 hours of constant usage. But due to the way they cut out, they are worthless to me. I would return them but I kept hoping a firmware update would fix the issue but it never has. Now it’s beyond the return window, so I’m stuck with $220 junk. Do not recommend.

Not sure why these are getting such glowing reviews. Noise cancellation mezzo mezzo at best, AirPods Pro are substantially better. Terrible for phone calls. App is a hot mess of poor organization and badly translated Japanese. Audio performance takes a noticeable hit when noise cancellation is active.
No proper documentation or manuals

column8: Perfect Earbuds, only a few cons.
column9: Pros: - No lag, great for videos. - Super long range with no stutter or cuts. - Great sound quality. - Overall sexy design. Cons: - Case scratches up really bad really quick, not so sexy for long. - None of the included tips stay in my ears perfectly, I always have to push them back in. - Software always says the earbuds are at 100% - Bad update caused glitch where volume control keeps flashing on my screen randomly. No fix.
The sound quality is very good. If you plan to or thought about using these for phone calls forget it. They are amazing for sound quality though.
Good sound quality

I've used these earbuds for a month now and they work pretty well. I wouldn't say they are completely noise canceling, but they did a really good job at cutting out the noises on an airplane recently for me. I'm still having a hard time trying to figure out how to turn noise canceling on and off, it seems random to me. I didn't read the instructions, so that is probably my own fault. I REALLY like the charging case. I have never had wireless earbuds before and this is a really nice touch. I don't have to worry about them dying on a flight and needing to plug them in, because they can just be recharged in their case. I have the lighter colored earbuds and really like the color. They look and feel high quality which I appreciate. I did have one issue with connecting them to my phone's bluetooth, where it started playing my music from my phone and not my headphones at work. Luckily it wasn't playing an inappropriate song because I couldn't tell if it was just playing really quietly on the earbuds or what was happening and my coworker had to tell me he could hear it. I wasn't able to figure out how to connect it to my computer's bluetooth yet, but that is okay for now. I also haven't used them for a phone call yet, but I like that you can do that if you wanted to. Overall, great product that I would recommend. I just need to do a little more research to figure out the answers to my questions I think.
One of the great product I purchased. If you are looking for WH-1000XM3 in a earphone product, this is the one you are looking for.
Great sounding but I would like if it had little more life in the batteries
Amazing quality, sticks in my ear better than expected working out. And the perfect buds to use with a motorcycle helmet.

Sound quality is superb especially with the 360 surround sound app , the sound gives a in the studio feel with great separation of voices and instruments, in ear fit is great and they are comfortable, I enjoy them , great addition to my life for couple hundred bucks, I don’t work out so can’t speak on sweat resistance and such , I’m just a frustrated musician in another lucrative career , a vicarious listener imagining that I am playing instruments

Great sound quality and noise cancelling, battery life is excellent as well. However the connection is often unstable, and has been so between two different phones. There's also a switch for sound quality vs. stable connection. For this price I feel you shouldn't have to compromise. When connection is stable, however, everything is great.

Was sent these to try out from Sony and was beyond amazed by them! I love these earbuds because I have the Sony WH-1000XM3 headphones and thought they'd be a nice companion to those in case I ever needed to travel extra light and was right about that. Didn't expect earbuds to sound so nice and crispy like the headphones and was really surprised by the quality. The design is cool too! Props to whoever designed them as a nice aesthetic is always awesome to have with great performance.
Quality headphones. Excellent battery life. Good Bluetooth range. Noice cancelling is really good. Overall a 8.5/10
Sound quality is outstanding. It has noice cancelling and sound ambient control to hear your surroundings without taking it off.

column8: I haven't charged them sence I've bought them!
column9: Great for on the go. Charge lasts forever!! !

column8: Waste of Time- Airpods Pro far Superior
column9: I bought the WF-1000XM3 because it was highly recommended by friends. The case is very large and cannot stand on its own. The sound is extremely bass heavy with muted mids. This type of sound signature is not for me--would be extremely fatiguing to listen to because I would constantly feel like I am missing frequencies and exacerbated by an over-emphasized low-end. To my ears, the Sabbat E12 is 10x better with a far expanded sound stage and still has a very present, good bass. Even the Airpods Pro has more balanced sound and real ANC. But if you like this sound signature make sure to try all the ear tips, the large foam ones fit best for me and had the best seal. Separately, I also tested the Airpods Pro for a while now. Previously, the ANC really bothered me--gave me some nauseating cabin-pressure feeling, but I've grown accustomed to it, it makes a world of difference in noisy environments, and it is much less fatiguing now. It really is the best all-rounder and obviously the clear winner, regardless, if you have an iPhone. I do make a lot of phone calls, however, and the Airpods 2 are still hands down the best for phone calls so I keep that by my desk at all times so I can easily multi-task and pull up stuff on the computer during a call. With Airpods Pro, the recipient often cannot hear me clearly, even indoors, let alone if outdoors and noisy/windy. I bought the the WF-1000XM3 on sale but I'm returning it tomorrow. What a waste of time. Sabbat E12 - for daily walk Airpods Pro - in the pocket for daily use Airpods 2 - at the desk and on-the-go if I'm expecting an important call
Exceptionally nice
If i could use the left one only it would have made this review a 5 star other than that these are great.

I was questionable at first but these provide better noise cancelling then my 2 year old beats. Sound quality is fantastic. I actually purchased these because of a lengthy review left here, which gave great detail on the proper use. They should give that man a commission. He sold them, then the product didn't disappoint.

column8: Very good headphones but with an important and serious flaw.
column9: First of all I have to say these headphones a fantastic for listening to music. But for phone calls they are horrible. Everyone I spoke to through these headphones complained that they can't hear me or the sound is too muffled. I'm not sure if its specific to my unit. Using Bluetooth for phone calls is an important reason for buying these headphones. I hope Sony as solution for this. As much as I love these headphones I can't live with them if they are useless for phone calls. It's dangerous trying to answer calls and trying to make the head phones while driving.

It has been 2 months since i am using this product. The phone call quality is really bad as the microphones amplify the surrounding environment quite a lot, which creates a noise for person on the other side of the call. I have updated the firmware but still the issue persists. This looks like a fundamental issue, which is a very sad. I hope Sony team is looking at this review and do something about it.

I've had issues off the get go. 1. Buds would not connect automatically without effort, and they keep disconnecting when I stop using, so every time I want to use them I have to reconnect Bluetooth - very annoying. 2. The forward, backward and skip function do not work properly; not user friendly. 3. The App totally sucks. I don't know if anyone else is having this problem, but the app crashes so I can't access the eq. 4. Not water proof (?). They are useless for the gym. For the price Sony should have considered active people, not just for walking around. 5. Sound is not much better than my $28 Soundpeats ear buds. Very disappointed, I really wanted these to work for me! Now I have to return them and find other buds .

column8: Great sound and quality but has some downsides
column9: The noise cancelation is good, but if you have the vocal pass through turned on it let's through all vocals, including sung ones. So if you're like me and listening to them at work were a radio is playing, you have to turn off vocal pass through. The controls are weird. I love that I can pause and skip forward, but even though i should be able to skip backwards I have never been able to make it work. Also not having volume control on the headphones sucks. But overall for cordless earbuds they are amazing. I love the sound and I love that I can charge them in the case.

First and foremost, I am apart of the Sony Alpha Collective. An ambassador program with Sony for photographers and videographers. I have been in the market for something a bit more heavy duty then my airpods, so the opportunity came up to test these out for Sony. Full disclosure, I am not giving these back. The design great and functional, sound quality is full and robust and the noise cancelling is superb. Especially since I live in Brooklyn, and I don't want to hear the ambulance and ambiance all the time. Highly recommended for someone looking for something besides airpods.

column8: Noise cancelling doesn't work well- returned them
column9: I bought a few pairs of headphones in an attempt to find noise cancelling for sleeping on planes/noisy places. In comparing these against the Bose wired in-ear headphones I found the noise cancelling didn't even come close. I turned on the noise cancelling and could hardly tell a difference. They're immediately getting returned
For the money paid.....Not impressed..item returned.

Sound When it comes to sound quality these are up there with the best it not the best. Noise Cancelling The noise-cancelling is like nothing I have experienced in some earbuds. It matches the WH1000XM3 which I also own and love. Build The case is huge, however, the headphones themselves are very sleek. I personally struggle to keep the rubber tip headphones in my ear because of my smaller ear canal but these are solid.

column8: Best sounding earbuds I’ve ever had!
column9: these are great and I love them, but they’re not perfect. Pros: These are the best sound quality earbuds I’ve ever owned. Mixed with the Sony app they have a lot of adjustability when it comes to the sound signature which is great. The noise cancelling is good but not spectacular. Do not expect the same level of noise cancelling as the over the ear headphones, but that being said they do the job well and the ambient settings are nice but overkill. An on or off setting would be fine like with the airpods pro, I don’t need 10 ambient settings. Other than that these fit wonderfully in my ears and they include foam tips which I much prefer to the silicon. Phone calls work well and the microphone pics up my voice well. Cons: So here’s the thing, there are some cons. While they do fit in my ears well they do stick out a bit so when I wear my winter hat they dig into my ears a bit. Also I’ve been having intermittent connection issues, I don’t know if this is because I have an iPhone but it’s worth noting. If you are an Apple user the iPods pro are much more intuitive for you’re phone and a lot easier. They have an on/off ambient noise setting and are much more portable and streamlined in the ear. That brings me to my next point the case. Airpods definitely have an advantage here as the case is much smaller and more portable. I usually carry a bag so this isn’t an issue but it’s something to think about if you’re using these as daily driver earbuds. Also I would not use these in the gym, they do have a coating but I wouldn’t push the limits for a pair this expensive. Get some jbird vista’s, they’re completely sweat and waterproof. Summery: These are great if you value great sound quality, customization, and noise cancelling earbuds. These are a perfect cheaper alternative to the over the ear headphones by Sony and work very well as daily drivers if you don’t mind the case size. That being said, If I’m not carrying a bag I’m going to grab my airpods pro but with my bag I would definitely take these especially if I need good quality audio (I’m a professional singer).
I like all that was advertised reference to the earbuds
It's definitely the top of the notch for true wireless earbuds at the moment. The rich sound quality the long lasting battery and the slick design makes these buds worth every penny.

Makes my old Jabra look super junky. Amazing sound quality. I can use Alexa with one click. I don't even need the other controls I just tell her to change the song, volume, track. The sound is amazing compared to the Jabra 65t that I gave my husband. I don't workout with this. I just walk. I love it.
Constant phasing in and out. The right head phone periodicaly turns off. Garbage product.
Love everything except the battery life of it. Wish it could go a full 24 hrs before needing to be recharged.

column8: Dumb Blinking LED lights that won't stop! - Edited
column9: The design is nice. The sound quality and noise cancelling are excellent. Not great for making phone calls though, you have to be in a pretty quiet room for the other person to hear you well. Battery life is way too short though it recharges fast. The only thing that REALLY REALLY bother me is why on Earth does it require to have any blinking lights at all. It's not like I can see the lights while I'm wearing them. It's just a crazy light show for flight passengers around me. And the blinking lasts forever. SO dumb! I changed my rating to 5 stars because I found out that if you put the Automatic Power off function to "Off when headphones are taken off" mode then the LED lights will not keep blinking.
I really loved the sound quality of these earbuds. The only negative was when I used them for talking. My own voice was overpowering in my ears. Like speaking with your fingers plugging you ears.

Sound quality is great when playback is working, but most of the time the skipping is just unbearable. I used the app, configured and updated it. It still skips like mad. When sound comes through though it's quite nice. I think they loaded way too much software on these things. They're not stable. Will continue to use for a couple days. If issues continue they're going back. Update: I seem to have found the issue. If you touch or use your phone while music is playing, it will continue skipping. Makes them pretty substandard IMO
There good for music suck for all else

column8: Solid ANC, great sound quality, but call quality is garbage...
column9: If I treat them as a set of headphones without a mic for using for phone calls, these are great. Really good battery life, the noise cancellation worked well on a recent flight, they are comfortable and music sounds great. BUT, don't make a phone call. The other end of the conversation will hear everything around you, but you will sound like you are in a tunnel. I was on recent conference calls and had to apologize after being muted by the presenter when coming off mute to ask a question even through I was in a relatively quiet environment. Trying to get a replacement set with Sony now, but I fear this is a firmware issue issue.
They're great, they are a little uncomfortable after a while depending on the size of your ear. Not great for a lot of moving

In summary, heavy and below average sound quality. I have owned Sony and Bose noise cancelling since they began. These are not practical compared with the wired versions. I can wear wired versions on 10+ hour flights. These grated after 3 hours and battery died after 4 to my relief. My ears thanked me. The noise cancelling is poor compared with all my previous headphones. Sadly avoid these uncomfortable and poor noise cancelling headphones.

column8: Sony comes up a big winner over Apple
column9: Bought these after returning AirPod pros that kept falling out and wow am I impressed with the new technology in these Sony WF-1000MX3. For audiophiles like me the difference in sound quality, bass and noise canceling is extreme. Sony kills Apple this time and they’re on sale now so $50 less than the hard to find AirPod Pros. As far as syncing with Apple’s iPhone I have an iPhone 7 plus and my wife has an iPhone 11 Pro and so far music is flawless. The Sony app is garbage but if you get the Google assistant app you can set alarms, make call as Alexa stuff just like Siri. To me I gotta go with the Sony WF-1000MX3 over AirPod Pros in 2020. The only drawback is Sony doesn’t have sweat resistance but I read the AirPod Pros barely met the minimum requirements to qualify as water resisting. And one con is the short (about 17cm or 8” long charging cable that comes with Sony’s wireless earbuds. Next time give us a bigger cable. On a positive note my purchase cane with 3 months of siriusXM mobile but I would have preferred Spotify premium or Apple Music like the 4 months you get with new Apple products.
I guess I learned my lesson. I heard these were really good earbuds but the right bud arrived broken. They wouldn't connect to my phone. I'm so sad I was so excited.

I wanted these earbuds to watch YouTube videos at night without disturbing others. Let me tell you these are great at noise cancellation so great I can hear anyone or thing around me when I have them in! They are very bulky and ugly in my opinion but they work for their intended purpose.

Hands down THE best earphones ive ever had and yes better than beats and apple pro only down fall i mean its not a deal breaker but water resistance would be nice but I'd buy them 3 times if needed too
It disconnects sometimes
Absolutely Great sound and good build quality.

So given that these were high reviews by a lot of tech folks, I paid the premium and gave them a try. As far as sound quality and noise cancellation, they're great. But for me, they're just too heavy in my ears. Most of the weight was on the center part inside my ear and after a few minutes it became quite uncomfortable, so I ended up returning them (after cleaning everything off for the next person that picks them up used). I wanted to like them but for me they just weren't a good fit.

column8: Best sounding wireless buds out there
column9: Out of all the wireless buds I've demo'd so far (Powerbeats pro, Jabra Elite 75t, Sennheiser momentum, airpods pro), the Sony WF1000XM3's are the best.

column8: Great earphones, not so good for small ears.
column9: Well built, high quality. Very good overall. However, I have small ears and they didn't fit so well, even with the smaller tips, so after some time they would actually hurt my ears. If it wasn't for that, would definitely keep them, but I had to return the earphones.

I bought these thinking that it would be just as all the reviews have stated online but i was wrong. The only thing that these earbuds do well is noise canceling. The earbuds are heavy, look massive in the ear, look like a hearing aid, doesn’t fit your ears well and to top it all off, the features that they touted, don’t work that well. The pause audio feature when you remove one earbud sometimes works and when one is out of the ear the music starts playing for no reason. There’s just so much going on with the sony headphones app, in this case too much choice isn’t good. It basically dictates to you what it thinks is best with all of this ‘advanced tech’ when all you need are simple on and off options and an EQ. Sound quality is good but I’m sure you could choose Bose, Beats, B&O, JBL etc and get the same quality so i don’t think you should be buying these purely for sound because you can get the same from nearly 15 other earbuds. The earbuds are also slow to connect to my iPhone, one side would connect and a few seconds would pass until the second connects. column8: A great (maybe the best) option, price permitting.
column9: I've had these basically since they came out, they are great, however they could be improved in a few areas: - Water resistance/proofing, - Better codec support (aptX...) - Case: The copper accent (case) look nice, however they scratch really easy, and becomes very noticeable. On PC they work great, however you have to toggle between headphone and headset modes in the OS sound settings, and headset mode sounds awful. Noise cancelling is also handled through the app, so that doesn't work on PC either, same with touchpad function mapping. Being fairly new, they have also been getting timely app and firmware updates, such as volume control on the earbuds, you may need a firmware update for it, however this was one of my biggest gripes and I'm happy to see it finally addressed. Other than all that, from a software side, the only thing I would really like to see is custom function mapping for the power users so we could use the touchpads for more than one function through different gestures for different functions, example a tap/hold for volume and a double tap for ANC options. Overall I really like them and would recommend them if your in the market for premium, truly wireless earbuds.

column8: Really nice with only 1 real flaw even after flaw was "fixed"
column9: Im a huge fan of sonys noise canceling head phones. I bought the first mdr1000x's when they first went head to head with bose's qc35's so getting these or their newer over the ear noise canceling headphones. These fit my work usage much better. When buying these I already knew of the flaw of not being able to adjust volume from the ear buds themselves. I decided it wasn't enough of a drawback and I can happily say it's not bad. If anything while I'm at work I don't adjust volume much unless I know I don't need to talk to people. Now Sony did end up pushing an update that introduced the ability to adjust volume from either the left or right ear buds, but that is at the cost of sacrificing one of the more (in my opinion) more critical features. In order to enable volume adjustment you have to give up the ability to change the noise canceling mode/press and hold for ambient sound or the ability to skip or replay tracks. I find myself using the aforementioned features much more than adjusting volume. If the volume adjust methods were worked into one of the other options better I'd give these a full 5 stars. Other than this they're great. Battery life with any form of noise canceling on will drain the battery faster but the charging case is amazing at giving these buds with enough charge to use them in a short amount of time. The taking one bud out feature to pause music can be spotty at times (having my finger accidentally touch the sensor on the ear bud will give a false positive that they are back in my ear, and my music or the video I'm watching will begin playing til I take my finger off. The case isn't too large and fits nicely in my pocket. The ear tips they sent with them are generous and have allowed me to fine tune how comfortablr these are in my ears. The ambient noise feature is amazing for allowing me to listen to my coworkers and music at the same time. It also works great for silencing micromanaging technical program managers, or any form of upper management really.

Comfortable to wear, excellent sound quality. the best ANC in true wireless earbuds although in ear earbuds seems to do good to very good isolation, the only drawback is the sweat and dust resistance absence the latest software updated added volume control and the case charging level (although updates on 100, 70, 30 , and 0), all in all, I recommend sony wf-1000xm3 to all who really care about the sound stage and sound quality
