column8: Don't waste your money if you're looking for noise cancellation...
column9: Completely upset with my new Sony WF-1000XM3!!! Like some other reviewers (those having given very few stars) I completely agree that you should NOT buy these earbuds if you're looking for noise cancellation as one of your primary goals in this product. I've tried absolutely all the buds (2 types and 3 sizes for each), deep and not so deep into my ear canal, dragging on my ear while pushing them in (as some Sony instructions suggest), and nothing had any effect other than minor noise reduction with the noise cancelling on (fully, i.e. ambient sounds switched off). I also tried the 3 nodes (active NC, Ambient sound, everything off) and in terms of ambient noises around me in different environments (e.g. hum of a shopping center, hum of a street, etc.), there was almost no perceptible difference between these 3 nodes. Finally, I then did 2 comparisons in the same noise environment (shopping center): a) tried my JBL Free regular earbuds, and the Sony product and the JBL one both provided a rather similar amount of noise reduction (mostly stemming from you partly blocking the noise physically since you have a physical earbud in your ear). But noise reduction by both of them was rather minimal; b) tried putting on interchangeably the on-ear noise cancelling headphones (Sony and Bose) and the Sony NC earbuds. It's there that I really saw that any really notable noise cancelling that you (finally) get is from the on-ear NC headphones. From both of my tests above, Sony's MF-1000XM3 product is all marketing and advertising with almost no real effect of the noise cancelling kind. Another negative for me is the battery - after about 2 hours of use the system told me that the battery is very low and I need to recharge... The only positive with these earbuds is good music sound in the NC mode. But to really experience it (aiming to reduce the environmental ambient noise) you have to increase the volume almost up to the maximum (which the NC earbuds should be meant to help avoid!). So, bottom line is - do NOT waste your money on these earbuds if you're looking for any really notable noise cancellation! P.S. I cannot so far believe the comments of some other reviewers who say that with the NC on they almost completely drown out the ambient noise. My friend bought similar set of new earbuds on the same day and he's having exactly the same experiences as I do (so it can't be that both our (new) products are equally deficient).

Adaptive Control -- nice feature/option. It changes according to your surroundings. Latest firmware allows you to customize playback/volume control on the earphones. Unsure about voice transmission -- I got cut out a couple of times trying to call .. Another firmware update would potentially fix/enhance the voice calling. Bluetooth -- also got dropped off but reconnected quickly a few times -- still, shouldn't happen -- Maybe a firmware update would help. Battery life seems good. The charging case is a bit heavy/bulky.

Wife picked these up for work and she absolutely loves them. She researched for months and finally decided on these, she could not be happier with her choice. Really good sound and great for phone calls.
This is what the case looked like after one day of being on my pocket. Very disappointing.
Excellent product

column8: The sound would Frequently cut out and was not stable even using their stable sound feature
column9: After what I thought was a good research period I bought the Sony’s but returned 🧐 The noise canceling is excellent but that’s the only thing excellent for these $200 earbuds the fit is OK the sound quality is OK And the sound would cut in and cut out frequently Contacted Sony and their response was to use their sound stabilization feature and it was not helpful the sound quality skipped or glitched

column8: Great first pair of wireless earbuds.
column9: Great sounds quality and fits my ears perfectly.
Work great

I was excited for this headphones, but not good for small ears. Very uncomfortable even with the small ear tip. Of course, not good sealing on the ear which you have to accommodate every time and not good for the gym or even walking. I give 3 stars because is they are good in terms of sound and quality, but whats the point of having these things if you can't keep it in your ear. Pity I had to return them in less than 10 hours of having them.

These fit and sound great. They live up to the hype in that regard, all the praise you’ve heard is deserved. I have 2 minor gripes: 1. The case is huge. Forget about shoving these in your jeans pocket. 2. Some Bluetooth issues (sound cutout) in areas of high wireless usage, like an airplane. Nothing significant, but an issue I don’t have with AirPods.

I absolutely love these earbuds. I live in NY and wanted something that had noise cancelling, was wireless and not bulky. I was initially going to get the WH-1000XM3's but then Sony came out with these earbuds using similar noise cancellation technology, so I gave it a go. I am SOOOOOO glad that I did. For reference, I was previously using the Beats X headphones and really liked them. Battery life was great, quick charging, but they died on me after a year. I went shopping around for other options. I tried the Bose Soundsport Wireless headphones, they were comfortable, but the sound was not good in my opinion. For Bose Headphones I expected much more, I then went on to the Powerbeats Pros, and those dug into my ear like no other. They were super uncomfortable, didn't offer noise cancellation and didn't pass the train listening test for me. I didn't bother with AirPods because the regular Apple earbuds never fit my ears, and the sound quality never impressed me. I returned the Bose & Powerbeats Pros, and luckily a friend sent an article about the Sony WF-1000XM3 coming out I think a month later. I pre-ordered them from Amazon and honestly won't go back to another brand. Sony did a phenomenal job with these earbuds. I don't get any fatigue from wearing these and honestly forget that I am after a while. They stay in my ear without any issues, even when I'm in the gym on the treadmill. The battery lasts the six hours as advertised and the charging case charges it very quickly. I maybe charge the case 2-3/week at max. The sound is incredibly remarkable, especially for the form factor. The adaptive sound control, ambient sound control, customization of both, as well as the EQ customization is such a welcome change. There are presets for EQ, but you can also change them based on your preferences. I love bass, and adjusted accordingly, and these earbuds deliver without any problems whatsoever. Sony has been continuously updating the earbuds via the app, and allow you to change the controls on the touchpads on either earbud and I love it. Coming from Beats X to these absolute stunners was what I didn't know I was missing in headphones. If you're looking for noise cancelling earbuds, with great customization, that don't break the bank, these are the ones you NEED to get.

The noise cancellation and Google Assistant support make it best in its class. Lives up to the name and expectations. The only reason for giving a 4 rating is the battery drained out in 2.5 hours (80% standby - Bluetooth connected but music not playing). I was hoping for a 4-5 hour standby time, as I use it at work- makes it simpler to charge it only twice per day.
These are the best ear phones I have owned yet! If you are in the market for a rock solid set buy these they do not disappoint.

column8: Worth it and Fantastic...but not perfect.
column9: These are amazing, however certainly not a replacement for over ear headphones such as the WH-1000XM3’s. The noise canceling is it’s only real downside it could be better, but still a great commuter choice. The case is large and become uncomfortable when sitting on it. You may have to deal with an awkward front pocket bulge for everyday carry. I love the USB-C charging, but it should also have wireless charging given the $200+ price point. I hope there will be at least an IPX rating in the future model releases.

These have exceeded my expectations. I only use them with my phone so I'm not getting any of the connectivity issues I see in other reviews and the audio quality is better than any set of earphones I have ever used. I have a set of rha wireless earbuds that don't quite meet the quality that these do and I've owned high end wired Sony earbuds around the same price point as these that had similar audio quality. The call quality also caught me off guard when it was better than a majority of Bluetooth earpieces I've used which were only meant for phone calls. I would recommend these to anyone looking for mobile earbuds. I wouldn't use them for working out because they aren't water proof, but everything else is great.

column8: Good quality at a heavy price
column9: Noise cancellation works with certain buds better than others. Also ambient sound destroys sound quality. Everything else is great. There are much cheaper options with many of the same selling points.

Very disappointed! Bought these based upon video, but they’re not nearly as good as my wife’s Apple AirPods. Noise Canceling is only partially effective - my wife’s AirPods are just as effective and they’re not Noise Canceling. Still trying to make these work. Called Sony, but all they said was that the mobile app for these had some bugs with iOS 13. Should have waited for Apple AirPods Pro to come back into stock.
The sound quality and noise canceling are great, but call quality is poor. These also not for running or the gym. But I only use them for music and audio books.

After reading a ton of positive reviews I picked up a pair of wf-1000xm3 expecting they best of the bunch, but unfortunately the quality on my pair is really poor. Not exactly the "sound quality" per se, but the connection quality - i sync with an iPhone and the bluetooth seems to be struggling to get me a smooth audio signal. I never lose a connection, but there i get lots of little "glitches" in the sound quality where it is as i might if my phone where in a different room (it's in my front pocket). The sound seems to have a phasing issue with R and L sides and little pops and bits of what sounds like noise compression (maybe?) show up constantly regardless of where i am listening - this tells me it's not an interference issue. The sound is very similar to fiddling with the headphone jack of a wired pair of headphones where the quality is really choppy. If i can figure out a fix for this i'd give these high marks as i like the fit etc, BUT right now i'm back to using my crappy wired headphones. Feels like this pair is defective and i'm hoping that someone at Sony will reply here for some help as i can't seem to find the right support on the Sony site.

I own several shure wired ear buds but wanted to try a wireless noise cancelling set and decided on the Sony's. fyi I purchased these locally but wanted to leave my review here. overall very pleased with these headphones. I own a couple of shure earbuds, and the sound from these Sony's is every bit as good. I don't think the noise cancelling is as good as some other products out there (namely the Bose over the ear headphones) but these do eliminate some outside noise, and again the music quality is I feel excellent. I have not used these to answer phone calls so I can't address that topic. the Sony's come with a set of 6 extra ear buds so most folks should be able to obtain a good fit. I haven't had them all that long, but so far the battery life suits my needs well. overall a good purchase and I would recommend to others.
Excellent earbuds...SONY always coming with great products...totally recommended
One of the best pair of earbuds i ever bought
Very good

My 20yr old son got these for his birthday and they are the best earbuds he's ever had. A big upgrade from his Beats 2. He loves the ambient feature which allows him to pick up all sounds around him. The NC is very nice....same quality as over the ear Bose or Sony NC headphones. Battery life is great. No complains at all.
Comfortable noise cancelling is not as good as some of the over ear headphone but does eliminate most background noise
Battery life - ~4 hours. Sound quality great

I bought these headphones to use mainly with my Nvidia Shield TV Pro (Android TV) for private listening. They paired without any problem and maintain a connection very well. Both devices have Bluetooth 5.0 so the audio is in sync without any lag. The sound quality is great as well despite these headphones only supporting SBC and AAC codecs. Noise cancellation is pretty good as expected with small in ear headphones. The headphones stay pretty tight in the ears for extended use, but I would not recommend using these for sports or at the gym as they might fall out or get wet.

column8: Irritating user interface / poor app / mediocre sound
column9: Like some other reviewers, I've had trouble getting the headphones to stay on noise cancelling. The slightest brush against the left earbud and it shifts to ambient sound. But it can be hard to switch it back to noise cancelling (and the voice message telling you which setting it is on seems to work only at random times). You have to be careful to avoid pressing the right earbud lest the device decide you want to use Siri/voice control. Even though I have Siri turned off on my phone the headphones have somehow made several unwanted phone calls (apologies to the person first in my contact list). You can't turn this irritating and completely unnecessary feature off. The sound is okay. Nothing special. For the price it is mediocre. The iPhone app feels like something from ten years ago. Amazing that such an expensive product has such a terrible app. I hate to say it because it promotes Apple's lock-in but I wish I'd gotten the Airpods instead.
Ultimate sound quality. Rich deep bass is adjustable in the app assigned to the ear buds! I purchased 5 and was the best Christmas gift for my wife and children!
Noise cancellation was non-existent

column8: The Volume on these are absurdly low :/
column9: I was so excited about getting this product and did so much research on it. Although i have an Android device, it was between these and the new Apple noise cancellation earbuds. Seeing that these would provide better functionality for my device, I decided to go with these. All the bells and whistles are nice, all the features, and the app is very clean and easy to use. The buds themselves are nice and feel well made and I didn't have an issue with the size of the charging case either..my only beef, especially considering how much money you're spending, is that they really aren't that loud. And I understand that "loud" is subjective..but whenever I was somewhere that the background noise was higher than norm (on a train or outside) the volume just wasn't cutting it. And there was 3rd party apps you can download to help with it but it just made the sound distorted..and you shouldn't have to do that, considering you're spending almost $300 for em!! I had them for about 2 or 3 weeks before I just couldn't justify that price for something that I wasn't truly happy with. AGain, well made product, easy to use and help function app..and the sound itself is wonderful..but it just isn't very loud :(

column8: Best sound I've ever experienced in a set of headphones
column9: I bought these to use in the office, and, at least in my case, it's one of the best headphone purchases I've made. The noise cancellation is about the best you can get from in-ear headphones, which is to say, not the greatest. For the absolute best combination of sound and noise cancellation I recommend you go with the excellent, excellent over-ear Sony WH-1000XM3 (which I also own.) To me the problem with over-ear headphones is they make a groove on my long-ish hair (POC problems) and I don't want to walk around the office with jacked up hair. Aside from blocking out regular office noise, sound is the most important thing to me, and these are the best-sounding pair of earphones I have ever owned. Sounds are amazingly clear, they pack a decent amount of bass, and instruments just come alive while you're listening. The case is sleek-looking and the earpieces snap in with a satisfying magnetic click. The battery life is great, and with the case (which can easily fit in your pocket) you can always give it a top up. Definitely recommend these if they're in your price range and you prefer the smaller profile of earphones versus over-ear headphones.
Nice earbuds and I really liked the quality of the sound.It has great Noise Canceling feature and Great attention mode.

column8: Good ones.! But just not my type.!
column9: The sound quality is good, noise cancellation is very good. One main reason for only 3 star is it doesn’t stay in the ear well.!! Maybe i should have gone through some more reviews before purchasing it, but sadly no one mentioned about this one. It’s probably my ear and the shape, but still i can understand if I can’t jog with it but atleast it should stay in the ear with walking. Secondly, the calls, i use an iphone and no.! the quality is bad bad bad.! I hope people who read this understand that this is my personal experience with it and it may differ with individual phones and persons. I was really excited about this one since many suggested that this is the best ear buds in the market. Sadly returning this one.! :(

I have used these now for over three months and unfortunately for me they have just not matched their price. I'm extremely disappointed. 1. They just didn't fit my ears comfortably. No matter which of the many provided tips I tried. 2. If you use wireless earbuds for phone calls, these are the worst! I immediately started getting complaints from people I was on the phone with; and for every single call. I gave up and went back to the wired headphones that came with my phone for calls. 3. Sound quality is good, when they stay in the ear and when they are not disconnecting. 4. They keep disconnecting! Especially the left one. I repeatedly have had to put them back in the case and start over to get both connected. 5. The price. I'm now out a lot of money for what I thought would be top of the line earbuds. I'm going to find something different and hopefully I can recoup a few dollars by selling these since it's too late to get my money back.

column8: Had no idea earbuds have come this far
column9: Little background, I generally have two earbuds in my bag, one for working out/running and the other is for office/walking around use. Primarily listen to music but need for phone use throughout the day. Now to the good stuff- the size is perfect, small enough to not feel like you're putting on old school bluetooth headphones but not too small that they get lost when juggling your stuff around. The design/comfort is great for long duration, and plenty of different ear tip options come packaged and after-market options exist depending on how picky you are. Now the big selling point that I neglected to really weigh heavily until I used them; the noise cancelling features on these are impressive, and more impressive considering these are ear buds and not over the ear. The mics on each side allow you to "throttle" the amount of incoming noise, and even have it "voice focused" so you can listen to music while in a public setting and still hear people around you. No more days of people waving at you while you are doing heads down work at your desk. And with a simple push on the left side, you can give it a "complete pass through" for any quick conversations or if you need to hear an announcement and quickly resume listening. The full noise cancelling is impressive. Any consistent background noise; fans, trains, rushing air, traffic drone in the city - will be eliminated. Any "spikes" will still come through as expected, but wow. Really impressive tech. Now the sound - I am always seeking a good low end from my listening devices and these DELIVER. If you crave a "full sound" for instrumental music, these give you a complete sound rather than a distinct left/right. I cannot praise the range of sound enough when comparing to your standard wired buds with phones or the mid-tier samsung wireless BT earbuds. They are far better than anything you get pre-packaged with your device. Connectivity - this is the only hurdle I've had so far. My one older laptop had a little trouble but after seeking an updated driver, was resolved. Connectivity appears to be impacted on my older Galaxy phone/on a busy train/Optimize quality over connectivity - BUT if I selected within the Sony app "Optimize for connectivity" it was resolved, and I could not pick up on any difference in my quality of sound. When you get them, just run through your devices and be sure your computer drivers are up to speed. Carrying case is small enough, and gets you through "days" from my initial testing. I have yet to really drain them but appears to be on point with the ratings. If you want an everyday headphone solution that is a BIG notch above your average set of BT headphones - look no further.

column8: BEST WIRELESS EARBUDS IN THE INDUSTRY !!!
column9: OMG best wireless earbuds definitely Worth every penny. The sound is something else, noise cancelling is best in the game. Connection never cuts off and the charging is super fast. If you have the money get them. I normally get 8 hours with noise cancellation !!! I was extremely surprised they last so Long especially because on the box it says 6 hours with noise cancellation ,but I get 8 hours. I can switch between my note 10 plus and iPad pro like nothing in which cheaper wireless earbuds would lack of cut off. BEST wireless earbuds period.
You can barely have a clear conversation on this device.

column8: Absolutely the tech I've purchased in 2019
column9: Absolutely the tech I've purchased in 2019. Battery life is great. Connectivity is easy. Comfortable.

I am a huge fan of the Sony over ear noise cancelling headphones. After reading the reviews of the in ear headphones I was excited to try them. The experience has been very frustrating. Key points: - these things fall out of my ears all the time (yes I have tried the different sized ear buds, yes I have watched the online video about how to wear them .. the fact that they even need a video is ridiculous) - the noise cancelling is non existent. I cant even tell the difference when it is on or off. Again .. yes I have read the FAQ on the sony site, yes I have updated the software version. It just simply does not work in a real world setting. I have old bose in ear noise canceling headphones and they work a LOT better .. and are more comfortable. - there have been 2 software updates in the last 2 weeks .. there goes 30 mins of you life each time. Seriously .. why would you ever need to update the software on the headphones themselves unless you released before the product was ready. - When I pair with an iphone for voice calls people consistently tell me there is a lot of background noise .. even in a quiet room! I now use the free white iphone wired headphones and leave the on ones in the box. How bad is that! In short: terrible product. Cant recommend in any way. Would return if I could.
Noticed while walking on boardwalk sound is amazingly clear!! !
Great
Excellent product but does not sit in the ear properly
Great noise-cancelling but battery doesn’t seem to last that long. All and all would recommend.

column8: Amazing with some tweaks for Audiophiles
column9: For Bluetooth earbuds, these sound great. I use an iphone XS and found the best performance was reached by tweaking certain settings. On the Sony headphone app, leave DSEE HX on and adjust EQ, lowering the treble a few notches (last two eq levels). Another tip I learned is changing your iPhone screen color to black and white. This lowers system noise and gives you cleaner audio. You can assign a tripple click shortcut to the on/off button on the iPhone X to switch between black and white and color. One more tweak is if you are connected to wifi, separate the 2.4ghz and 5ghz bands on your router and connect only to the 5ghz band. This lowers system noise and gives cleaner audio. You can also get better sound quality at home If you set your iPhone to Airplane Mode, but keep wifi and Bluetooth active, given you have your iPhone set to receive phone calls via wifi, you can still get calls and make calls while listening to better sounding audio.

column8: They are better than your first impression
column9: I was underwhelmed when I started using them, they were not as good as everything I've read, however, I investigated a little more, and found out I needed to do one thing before all the setup: Select the right eartip, I was using the one they came with and they were unimpressive. I recently changed to the last one, and I can see why the reviews are mostly praises. Not giving it 5 stars due to calling quality, though, the sound is muffled and there is this odd noise that sounds when there is silence. It does the job, but is a minor annoyance you'd face if this will be used mainly with your phone.
The best!

column8: Will not stay in my ears. Noise cancelling not as good as Airpods Pro
column9: I read a lot of glowing reviews about these earbuds. I have owned a lot of true wireless earbuds, including every generation of the Airpods and the previous generation of these Sony earbuds. I got a good deal on these, but I had to return them for several reasons: 1) They will not stay in my ears. I have always had issues with earbuds that have tips that "seal" in your ears. Airpods actually work great for me because they just sit in my ears, but anything that has a rubber tip that squishes in works its way out while I'm wearing it. It's annoying and frustrating. The difference is, the previous generation had little tips that rested against the inside fold of your ear. Wingtips, if you will. These do not have those, so the only thing holding them in is your ear canal's ability to grip them. With that, they would never stay in my ears. I tried every single tip size and they all just kept popping out. 2) Noise cancelling: All of the reviewers seem to be praising this. These have been declared the best noise cancelling ear buds on the market. I'm hear to tell you that, for me, that was not the case. The Airpods Pro did a much better job. That could be because these things wouldn't stay in my ears, but even right after twisting them in, the noise canceling was pretty weak. Definitely not what I was expecting. 3) They are huge and the case is huge. It's really good quality and I like how they magnetize. It's much better than the previous generation, but it's a big thing to carry around in your pocket and the earbuds themselves are pretty large. Lastly, Sony please learn to name things. No one is talking about your WF-1000XM3 earbuds because no one knows what that is, even people who own them. Learn to name and learn to market. You want people to get excited and talk about your products? Name them so that people can remember what they're called. Thanks.

column8: Great sound, great battery, but wonky functionality.
column9: These headphones do the basics very well, but with enough quirks that I can't recommend them. I won't go into detail about the sound, plenty of other reviewers have done so. these are some of the best sounding wireless earbuds on the market. Bass is solid, highs are crisp, things do sound good. The noise cancellation is excellent, perfect for an office environment. Not quite as great on a plane or such as the gold standard Bose cans, but for in-ear headphones I've yet to find something that beats them. And the battery life is as good as you can get at the moment, with plenty of reserve in the case and a quick recharge. Unfortunately, the experience of using them is just too wonky to recommend. Using with the latest iPhone 11 Pro, the Bluetooth connection itself is mostly stable, stuttering occasionally in crowded urban environments but nothing too bad. However, the Bluetooth functionality is all over the place. Sometimes upon placing a call, the headphones just disconnect and don't attempt to reconnect. The software that comes with the headphones is clunky, and often fails to connect to the headphones. Updates take several attempts, and notifications for the updates come through days after you've updated the software (often in the middle of the night). The control surfaces (in place of buttons) on the buds themselves are not well-designed, requiring a hard tap that only occasionally registers, making double-taps impossible and sending a resonating thud through your ears when you try to use them. Call quality, as others have noted, is pretty terrible when it works at all. Even in a quiet room callers tell me I sound muffled, and when outside or even in a noisier office environment I can't be heard by the other party. These are unfortunately not useful for phone calls at this time, despite several software updates promising to "improve call quality". All in all these are frustrating- they do the job well when they do the job, but too consistently they simply do not. I don't see any reason the faults here can't be overcome by software updates, but thus far they have not been forthcoming and there has been no acknowledgement of any of these issues by Sony. Can't recommend at this time.

column8: The best wireless earbuds out there!
column9: these are by far the best earbuds out there! Amazing sound quality along all frequencies, amazing bass with the xtra bass option on the app. I think the equalizer is set a little high from factory, and I like bass, so I have the bass setting on +10 as well as all the equalizer ranges set at -2. Will beat out any AirPods or Powerbeats pro any day!

column8: Noise cancellation is more of a gimmick
column9: Tried them on a plane, NO demonstrable difference between noise cancelling on and off. I do notice it a bit in a quiet room, but it’s not worth the money IF noise cancelling is what you are after. Headphones are good quality, sound is excellent, noise cancelling is mediocre at best (they are wireless Bluetooth earbuds, so I wasn’t expecting too much, I was still underwhelmed)

I purchased these after owning the Bose Quiet Comfort 20s for a couple of years. I wanted a truly wireless set of ear buds. Compared to the Bose, the Sonys are brighter. As for noise cancellation, the two are about equal although I have yet to be in a noisy environment with the Sonys. I could not find a set of tips that came with the Sonys that would give me the bass they are capable of. I found that the AWADUO for Sony WF-1000XM3 Silicone Eartips worked best for me. Good fit and really good bass response. But, fit is highly dependent on the shape of your ear canals. So, try the Sony tips first then if they don't work find something else. As with any ear buds, a tight fit is essential for good bass. I also tried the Comply Isolation Plus Memory Foam Earphone Tips. Good fit but I just did not like the way they felt in my ears. Now for the negative: the touch controls on the Sony ear buds are a real pain in the rear. When trying to adjust the position of them in my ears, I would always turn them off or change the sound processing by accident. Thankfully, the touch controls can be turned off with the Sony app. So, I am happy with my purchase and am looking forward to many hours of wireless listening.

Once again, the Sony WF-1000XM3 are excellent headphones with a useful carrying case. These headphones would be ideal if I could keep them securely in my ear, even after refiting the cushions this continues to be a problem. I for one will be very happy once this universal problem has been eliminated.

column8: A constantly fell out and fell on the floor concrete floor and keep kept on taking. LOL
column9: I wanted to really like these earbuds and I am a Sony Fanboy. I have three Sony TVs I think Sony is one of the best at everything. But these damn things kept falling out of my ears constantly I tried all the different tips and can't get them to work sending them back and got the PowerBeats Pro. They don't sound quite as good but they're good enough and they do stay in my ears Sony needs to make some wrap around wings for their earbuds and that would be awesome.
Way overrated. Not worth close to the price- difficult to work with. Noise cancellation does not work well.

column8: First thing to do after unboxing them: Download and install the latest firmware.
column9: Excellent noise cancelling, and overall sound. Battery life is good, the case is a bit bulky but I appreciate the extra battery, and you can use them individually to extend your listening time. Call quality is disapointing out of the box, make sure you install firmware 2.1.0 right away, it gets decent after that.

So glad I spent the money on these! Pros: Great sound quality Amazing range away from the device The battery lasts about 5hrs Sound cancelation is the same grade youd find in "Bose Quiet Comfort" Cons Not ideal for working out in.
Great sound. Good noise canceling.

column8: Very close to bose over the ear
column9: As someone who loves bose over the ears and have used for years, I have not made the switch to earbuds, as none I have tried have come close. These do. While not identical, I would say 90 - 95% of the noise cancelation of bose. Same sound quality, and so much more convenient. Highly recommended.
My husband loves them! He says they are comfortable and work well!

column8: The best wireless headphones I ever have
column9: I love everything! Especially the noise cancellation.

column8: Best ear buds I’ve owned so far
column9: Battery life may seem limited but they recharge super fast in the case. Sound quality is amazing, noise canceling is better than I ever expected. I even bought a pair for my SO. My bose soundsports only lasted me a year before falling apart, these seem like they’ll last way longer.
Sound and battery life are the strong points of these buds.

column8: The best earbuds you can buy
column9: The only thing I wish these had was some attachment to secure it in your ear when active but beyond that easily the best of the best right now.
Love these earbuds. Sound great, comfortable and don't fall out.
I was very disappointed with these Sony ear buds. The sound was good but the battery was horrible. It only lasted 4-5 hrs. on a full charge. They are not very comfortable either.
Good

column8: Best true wireless headphones I've used, and I've tried all the big boys.
column9: Much better sound quality than the AirPods Pro, and more comfortable. The noise cancelling and transparency modes aren't quite as good, but everything else more than makes up for it. Also nice that the app has EQ.
hardware is ok, but sound quality is below what you'd expect for the price and the software needed to configure and pair the earbuds is poor at best.

column8: Good sound and noise cancelling for the price
column9: Great ANC for earbuds along with sound quality. Easy to carry and use daily. App paired with them could be friendlier for connection.

column8: Best Earbuds I have ever owned!!
column9: Last week got the Sony WH-1000XM3 Headphones and I'm still impressed with their sound quality. They sound so good that I wanted to even use them when doing cardio on the treadmill. Of course, with sweating the ear pads can get destroyed in a month so decided to get and extra pair of cheap wireless earbuds for treadmill use so got he Sony's Wi-Xb400 which are cheap but very well rated here on Amazon. Well, as soon I put the Xb400s ON I almost got sick of how horrible those things sound. Lot of bass but nothing else. I was so spoiled by the WH-1000XM3 that I felt that most likely I wouldn't ever being able to use another headphones or earbuds. Well after looking to some reviews, and even that the WF-1000XM3 are not IPX rated but a lot of people use them for workout, I decided to purchase a pair last night via Amazon Fresh and got them delivered this morning. As soon I put these things ON, a big smile came back to my face. I had to tweak a bit the EQ settings to match the sound of the WH-1000XM3 but now they sound so good that I don't know which pair I like the best. Most definitely I'm keeping both as both sound really good. My daughters have AirPods and AirPods Pro and they don't sound even close to the Sony WF-1000XM3. Now lets see if they don't break during cardio use :)

They work great for the person wearing them, but the microphone on them picks-up every single voice around you. They are too bulky outside of the ear and constantly fall-out, and definitely not worth the money unless you’re sitting still in a quiet place.

To start off, no I am not being paid to write this review. On the contrary, I have never owned a pair of wireless earbuds prior to getting these. I have always used earbuds you have to plug in. This means the experience you are reading right now is raw, first time wireless earbuds experience. What drew me to choose these earbuds was their noise cancelation feature that seemed to stand out among other well-known wireless earbuds and the touch sensor capabilities. Thankfully, it was good I bought the earbuds when I did (Started using them December 23rd) because there were some bad reviews on certain features in the past. Those problems had all been addressed by the time I got them. To get to the point, do I like them? Of course! They are amazing and I am always in a state of wonder with how cool this technology is and how well it works. I have been using them every day at work in a call center environment. Perfect testing grounds for measuring the full capability of the earbuds. Let's start with the negatives because I certainly know the flaws having used them for a month. First off, I struggled finding the right earbud size. Some would say it's a positive that the box comes with several types of earbud sizes which it is. However, I was frustrated because I didnt know how to know which one fits best XD So, it really just came down to me having to try every single size to see what fit best. The earbuds are a little on the heavy side (not too much) because of the touch sensor part. So, choosing the right earbud size is vital. Once I got the right fit, things were much better. Second problem I had was the learning curve that came with using the app in conjunction with the earbuds. All I have to say is the sooner you get the hang of using the app the sooner you will enjoy using the earbuds, experiencing all the features to the fullest. Examples of some frustrations came with understanding how ambient sound mode works, figuring out whether I wanted the auto noise atmosphere change feature to be on, and understanding how voice assistance works in conjunction with the touch sensors. Ambient sound mode allows you to control how much you let voices from around you filter in through the earbuds. The app let's you set your preference with an adjustable bar ranging 1 to 10. 10 means your letting pretty much all voices from around you come in through the earbuds. 1 means very very little voices will be let through. With that knowledge on my belt, I noticed the feature of auto noise atmosphere change. Something was really bothering me as I walked around with the earbuds when I would hear a beeping noise and suddenly the sound changed. It was a delayed change of sound. What this feature does is adjust the noise level based on where you are so if you are in a very noisy place, it will automatically switch to a quieter sound mode so you can hear your music. If you are in a quiet area, it will balance out so you can hear voices around you while still being able to hear your music. It's kind of weird, but an interesting feature. I do not like this feature. Why? Even when you select the option to have no delay when switching between noise environments, it is still delayed. You can turn off the beep if you want to that signals when the sound is switching to adjust to the noise atmosphere you're in. But I recommend not using this feature. Lastly, I had to figure out how to use voice assistant in conjunction with the touch sensors. I dont like Google Assistant and prefer using Amazon Alexa. I selected Alexa as my voice assistant and then my phone prompted me to select Alexa as a just once or always for this app. I selected Always which was a mistake. Before I can tell you why it was a mistake, you need to understand the touch sensors and how they work. The touch sensors are super cool and I use them frequently. The left earbud I have set to function as switching between noise canceling, ambient sound mode, and ambient sound mode off. It's as easy as tapping the sensor one time to switch between each one. If you have a co-worker come up to you suddenly and your music is playing making it so you cant hear them, all you have to do is hold your finger down on the left sensor to activate quick attention mode which forces your music to the background and instantly allows you to hear your co-worker speaking to you. Now, you have to keep holding your finger down to keep this activated and it does not pause your music just so you know. On the right earbud, I use the app to choose what I want it to function as whether it be voice assistant, Amazon Alexa, playback controls, or volume controls. There are several options to choose from and I like the variety. My favorites to use are playback controls and Alexa. Playback controls are wonderful. When you have this set to your right earbud, one tap pauses the music, two taps go to the next song on your playlist, and three taps make the song repeat. So, if one of your favorite songs comes on and you want to hear it again, tap the right sensor 3 times before the song ends to make it repeat. What's weird is the app tells you 3 taps goes to the previous song, but this is false. I tested it and all it does is cause the song you are listening to currently to start back at the beginning. Then, you can hold your finger down on the right earbud to activate voice assistant. Now, this is where I get frustrated with voice assistant. When I have playback control set to the right earbud, I do not want to have to manually touch my phone to lower the volume if my music is too loud. You would think the voice assistant could easily help by holding your finger down on the right earbud and telling Alexa to lower the volume. It's not that easy. If Alexa is your voice assistant, your phone screen must be unlocked to use it (only applicable to when you have playback control set to the earbud). Well, that's not very hands free now is it? To get around this, you could just set the right earbud to Amzon Alexa. When you do this, all you do is tap the right earbud one time and say Alexa followed by whatever you want her to do for you: increase or decrease volume, set reminders, tell you the weather, traffic update, flash briefing, etc. You can still do all these things when you use Alexa when the earbud is set to playback controls but your phone screen must be unlocked in order for the commands to get through. That wraps up all the negatives. I mentioned some positives in there, so here are some final takeaways. As of right now, I have found a comfortable routine at work when using the earbuds. The left earbud is set to control switching between noise canceling, ambient sound mode, and ambient sound mode off. I utilize quick attention mode when needed. On the right earbud, I always keep it set to playback controls. I accepted the drawback of having to unlock my screen to use Alexa because I only use her once every morning when I want to hear my flash briefing. When I'm finished listening to my flash briefing, I'll turn on my google play songs on shuffle and utilize the playback controls as needed. When I'm on break or lunch, I put the earbuds back into their charging case. The charging case is phenomenal btw. It holds up to its claim of maintaining a lasting charge. The app even tells you how much charge is left in the case so you know when it's time to plug it in. The charging speed is not a concern at all and nothing for you to worry about. The earbuds charge quickly like nobodies business, fantastic. By the time I get back from my break or lunch, the earbuds are fully charged. When you take the earbuds off, it automatically pauses the music. When you put them back on, it automatically connects to bluetooth but you have to press play again to get your music going. That's why I keep playback controls set to the right earbud so I can quickly start my music back up after returning from break. When putting the earbuds back on, it tells you the current charge level like fully charged or 50%, 75%, etc. Currently, I'm having to learn to utilize the quick attention mode more often and trusting it. Several times have I taken the earbuds out of my ears to hear a co-worker talk to me only to realize after our conversation that I should have used quick attention mode. By far, my favorite feature of these earbuds is the noise cancelation. I have noise cancelation mode on 90% of the time at work. It does not get rid of every single noise around you so you hear nothing but your music. That's not what it is intended to do so dont expect it to do that. Rather, it extremely muffles the noises of things around you. So much so to the point where the noisy chatter of the call center is transformed into a muffled background sound almost, akin to Charlie Brown and how the grown ups talk. I had a coworker walk up to me, didnt see her coming, and I turned to look at her only to realize her mouth was moving and she was talking to me. I had no clue she had started talking to me because noise canceling mode was on. That is amazing. Would I recommend these to you, a friend, coworker, or family member? Most definitely. They are always looking to update their app which is one of the great things about it. They listen to our complaints and update the earbuds accordingly. For example, just last week, they released an update to improve sound quality when taking phone calls using the earbuds so the caller can hear you better. Before I got the earbuds, there had been complaints about volume control among other things. They added this feature. There were complaints about not knowing the charge level of the case. They added the ability to see how much charge is left for your case in the app. So point of the matter is that it's an ever changing product that can improve itself with new features and updates to fix any issues. (I forgot to mention why it was bad for me to select Always when choosing Alex as the voice assistant. I had mentioned you have to unlock the screen to use Alexa when the earbud is set to playback control function. I wanted to test other voice assistants to see if they require the screen to be unlocked like Google Asistant for example. Because I slected Always for using Alexa as the voice assistant, I couldn't find my way back to undo that setting. I have a Galaxy S10 and googled how to change this setting but couldn't find out how to do it) It's a great buy! Lots of fun to use and very practical in a work environment.

column8: The best true wireless Bluetooth earbuds at this price range
column9: After owning or trying out several of the newest wireless earbuds, including those made by Shure, Klipsch, Jabra, Sennheiser, and Master & Dynamic, I had to crown these the winner, by a long shot, for multiple reasons: 1. The battery life exceeded the 6 hours during my testing, but I wasn't using the noise cancelling feature the whole time - perhaps it's rated for 6 hours with NC on? Nonetheless, I got almost 6 hours before it even warned me that the battery was at 20 percent, and after that I proceeded to use them for a total of over 7 hours! 2. The noise cancelling is probably the best I've seen so far in true wireless earbuds. I'd say it legitimately blocks ambient noise to the point where you can't even hear it, which is a first for me. 3. The fit and finish actually goes hand-in-hand with the noise cancelling feature - with 7 different sets of tips, you will get the perfect fit for your ear, assuring the best sound quality and noise cancelling. 4. The sound quality and clarity blew me away. I've never been a huge proponent of Bluetooth to begin with for this reason. The sound is every bit as good as units twice its price, and absolutely crushes everything else in its price range. I recently had the misfortune of trying on the AirPod Pro earbuds, and I can safely say that the Sony definitively tramples them in every category. They are so comfortable and sound so good, I've found myself wearing them at home, where I could easily switch to something much more intricate and expensive, but I just love the full, rich sound of these earbuds! It's as if the music is happening inside your head, on a whole new level. I can't recommend these enough - they really exceeded my expectations by so much - I'm a Sennheiser fanboy mostly, but I know what's good when I hear it, and these little earbuds truly deliver. I know 200+ is a lot to spend on anything, but if you can afford them, you will not be disappointed!
Great sound quality.
Great product.

I purchased these from another retailer but I felt I had to come here and review not because Im being paid to but because I only went to the other retail because I wanted them same day. I have tested ALL of the big buds, Airpods,Beats etc. even cheap ones and I have to say I love these. I have had them now for a week. I use them mostly while traveling and when exercising. First they work great with my One+7 McLaren. The sound quality great for calls. Though, in some noisy areas they're kinda bleak but arent all earbuds. Truthfully, I wanted these for good sound,batter,comfort and noise cancelling. I prefer to be in the zone when enjoying my music whether Im waiting on a plane or shopping in the store..I don't want to hear the man two rows behind me hacking up his large sub from lunch or the old lady complain why they moved the salad dressing for the 3rd time this year. I have small years but large canals and these fit great as I had many ear choices. One thing I will say the battery life is WITHOUT a doubt underestimated it says 6 hours I get about 9 just from the pods not including the case quick charge.

Skip to the bottom for the basic review I've had these since Black Friday 2019. I purchased them at Best buy so I'm not a verified purchaser here but I wanted to help write a decent review here to help out. I love these things. I was going to purchase the 1000xm3's (the headphone version of these) but decided against it because I'm an earbuds kind of person. The batter life is amazing sometimes I go days without chearging the case and hardly ever use the earbuds until the point I get a batter warning. They last and charge very quickly. The design feels larger than the galaxy buds I had previously, definitely can't use these as much when I work cause I move so much but if I do end up needing to move fast I have no problems with them falling out anyway. Not designed for working out but can handle their own when needed. Sound quality A1 the best I've ever heard and have currently. The equilizer in the app gives so much customization control. They go everywhere with me no matter what and even with the large case it's still easy and doable no matter the outfit or occasion. The copper will show scratching and scuffs fairly easy but I don't care battle scares just show how well theyve handled being carried everyday the past 3 months With every update the software gets better and the perks just increase with added volume control now and improved call quality these things just keep getting better over time. Sony listens and improves what people want improved. The noise cancelation is the best you'll have in a true wireless form. Just be sure to insert the bud correctly and you'll hear and feel the difference. When I first bought these I was putting them in wrong and it was kind of painful to have them in for long periods of time but once I went through the manual finally I got it down and now I have zero issues. I find these to be the best true wireless earbuds on the market right now with the sound quality of senhaissers the batter life of the dumb airpods and the best noise cancelation in a very compact form. They're a bit expensive but if you want the best this is it.

I'm writing this review because I'm about to replace my second pair... Great headphones if you're willing to deal with unreliable battery life and the occasional software glitch. First pair stopped syncing with one another. Replacement took about 2 weeks. Now the pair I got as a replacement has stopped working. The earbud that connects with the smartphone has slowly been getting less and less battery life. Became common that I couldn't be listening for about and our and I would get a warning from my left earbud was at 25% battery, while my right was still in the 75% -100% range. As of now the left earbud has stopped working all together. Hopefully I can get this sorted quickly this time. Maybe I just got two lemons in a row? Who knows?

column8: Horrible fit and skips quite a bit
column9: Just bought them yesterday. It was seamless to connect to my phone and laptop. It was all downhill from then on. 1. No multipoint connect. So if I am wearing them at work I have to constantly keep switching between my laptop and phone. The voice assist does not mention the device it is connected to which is extremely annoying as I have to find out where it is connected to. 2. The noise cancelation is decent. I use the bart and it drowned the noise quite a bit 3. The fit is horrible. It relies on you inserting them deep into the ear canal as the headphones are bulky and will fall off otherwise. This means that after an hour of train ride my ears were hurting quite a bit. I tried all the ear tips they provide and they all ended up hurting my ears after a few minutes of usage. YMMV. 4. The app is decent as long as it is connected. As there is NO MULTIPOINT connectivity it is useless once I switch devices. Returning them back for a full refund. All I can say is that I, like the many reviewers who have already posted, are thoroughly impressed with these new noise-canceling earbuds from Sony. Let’s start with the easiest. These things are visually gorgeous. The charging box in which they sit reminds us of the Sony of “yore” (is Sony seeing somewhat of a Renaissance these days? It sure seems so). The black and rose gold color combination is stunning, and the functionality of the charging box matches it. The individual earbuds fit perfectly in their holding spots inside the case, and are magnetically pulled and held into place. A USB 3 (thank you, Sony!) connects the charging case to the power source. The earbuds and the case are simultaneously charged if both are low, or only the earbuds are charged if the case is charged, or if you are using the case apart from a power source to charge the earbuds. Great design. Next, the comfort of the earbuds themselves is exceptional. I was highly skeptical that they would be either comfortable or stable in the ear, but I am happy to report that they are both comfortable AND easily stay in place. Of course, getting good sound depends very heavily on putting the correct size of the ear caps on the earbuds, so make this choice carefully. If you do not have the proper size on ANY earbuds, they will generally sound terrible. Again, Sony did well here by providing three sizes of two material types of buds so that you can get the perfect fit. Bluetooth connection is accomplished by a touch sensor on the right and left earbuds. You simply touch each simultaneously and the headphones go into connection mode. I had no trouble getting them connected to my phone. Both blue and red lights on the buds and on the charger signal charging, pairing, and connection. (It is advised to quickly look over the included blue-and-white instruction sheet to see the sequence of steps for each of these operations.) Sounds quality is very good. The headphones will not produce pounding bass, but with the right equalization settings, the correctly-sized earbuds, etc. Little practice, the sound is very pleasing. The signature is more-or-less flat throughout the range, with a drop in the lower end of low bass. However, there is still plenty of mid-range bass, and I find the speakers quite pleasant in the manner in which they accurately and clearly reduce the music. This part of any headphones is a highly personalized factor, but I can’t imagine anyone would be disappointed unless they are looking for something that turns out massive amounts of bass at all times. Finally, noise reduction. I don’t claim to be an expert, but I’ve been using Sony noise reduction systems for nearly 20 years on a variety of models with different headphones with great satisfaction (and before most people were even interested in noise reduction). There is absolutely no question that the noise reduction on these earbuds is beyond exceptional: it's almost unbelievable how well they work. As many people point out, they will not remove all voice noise (but will reduce it), but it’s the other noises—airplanes, fans, generators, cars, etc.—that these just handle with aplomb. To be honest, I did not expect them to be any better than my last Sony noise reduction sets, but they certainly are, no kidding. You have to hear them to believe them. This is a five-star item in nearly every respect. As people find out about them, they will become more and more popular. Amazing!

column8: Fantastic sound and comfort and isolation!!
column9: Incredibly comfortable and light. Sound better than I've conceptualized in an Airbus. Is they stay in reasonably well and last without failure, I've been spoiled for any other of my buds. Transcend the prior model by light years.

column8: Great audio quality/noise cancelling but not for everyone.

column8: Great earbuds, but no replacement for over-ears
column9: I own both the WH1000XM2s and the WF1000XM3s. After a day of listening and testing features, I can say that the WFs are inferior to the over-ears in every way except portability, ease of use during workouts and overall intrusiveness, as you might expect. That said, the WFs sound great, and anyone coming from a pair of low quality headphones/earbuds will love the sound and build quality. They are also far smaller than I'd expected. Noise canceling is not as complete as the over-ears but still damn good. I highly recommend having the companion app installed on your phone so you can make sure the settings are tuned to your liking. Connectivity is good but not perfect. On my 2015 Macbook pro I had some occasional stuttering, and the earbuds disconnected altogether from my iPhone 8 when I rejected a phone call. I have not had a chance to test in dense city. Battery life with noise canceling clocked in at exactly 4.5 hours, just as many others had tested. Perfect for a day at work (just pop them in to charge during lunch) or commuting, but not great for something like a long-haul flight. Overall, if you're looking for earbuds to compliment your noise canceling cans, these are fantastic, especially for the price. But if you're trying to decide between the WH model and the WF model and don't need the compactness of earbuds, opt for the over-ears. They'll serve you much better.

Love sony sound and this keep it true.. Sony sound is the sh*t and these stand up right to it! I dont care about noise cancelling or anything else which could be good, but itit's out sound quality to me and hands down its f'in there!! column8: Connection problems, left earbud loses charge

But I kept them and hoping the pain would go away, because it's the Apple cult brand, and until I found something comparable and was willing to give up some of the Apple integrated features that come with the Airpods Pro, as long as they dont hurt. column8: Great for listening, terrible for talking!
column9: The earphones sound great and the noise cancelling seems to work well. But the microphone audio quality is so bad you can't use it. Either it's crackly and broken up or it sounds like you're in a fishbowl, and the caller can't understand you. The earphones also disconnect from Bluetooth when you switch applications (like between music and recording a memo) so you have to turn Bluetooth off and then on again to connect (what a pain!). And they don't auto-select (on an iphone) when a call comes in, so you lose the call. If you just want to listen to audio (podcasts, music, etc.) then they're fine. if you want to talk on the phone or record audio, forget it! The don't work.
Love this product. My boss and I both have them and we work in a machine shop, they work excellent.

column8: Great Sound But Certain Features Missing
column9: Edit Feb 27: Reducing rating to 2 stars. Connectivity reduce to 2/5 stars from 5/5 stars. I've experienced stuttering with the connection on multiple occasions. It's extremely frustrating and makes listening to anything unbearable. Added a rating for call quality, 1/5. If you're getting these to use to use for calls think again. It's really bad. Overall I'm very impressed with these. I'll keep it simple Sound = 5/5 The sound is excellent. Once you get a good seal with these (for me one of the sets of ear tips works great) the sound is rich and the bass is great. The headphones allow you to change the sound in the app based on what you want to emphasize (treble, bass, vocals, etc.). Battery = 5/5 The battery lasts quite a while for this style of earbud. So relative to this the battery is top tier. Comfort = 4/5 I usually have trouble with headphones and comfort. I will say these aren't the ultimate image of comfort I would have. I do notice that I have them in after a long time. My ears will bother me slightly, but it's not terrible. One of the better earbuds I've tried. Weight - 5/5 Weight is light enough that you don't notice them when you're moving around. Case - 3/5 The case is pretty sleek looking. I like that there's a magnet to help guide the earbuds into the case. The biggest downside is it's pretty big, so if you're keeping it in your pocket it might be annoying. I personally either use them at work or leave the case in my car if I know I'll be wearing them wherever I'm at. Call Quality - 1/5 The call quality is awful for anybody I talk to. Lots of background noise on the other end. Connectivity -2/5 Updated to 2/5. See edit at the top. Features 2/5: This is where I think these headphones fall short big time. I'll list the negatives. -You can't be paired to more than one device at a time, which is really annoying. JLab devices can do this, so it's disappointing a high end product like this can't. -This means that you can't access the sony phone app if you're connected to a PC, which is extremely annoying for me since they're mostly connected to my laptop. This means you can't check battery of the case or buds unless you disconnect from your PC to your phone and back. -There is no PC app (kind of falls into the last complaint), which is also really annoying, especially for someone like me. This means you can't even check the battery life without repairing them to your phone and opening the app. - You can't see the case battery unless you put an earbud in and take it out. I assume this is because the case itself doesn't have bluetooth. When you put an earbud in and take it out, it must save the last reading of the case battery life. Kind of annoying, but not the end of the world. -The touch features on the earbuds could be better. They only handle a single tap to action ratio. I'd love to be able to program double tap on both of them to program two more features. Overall I'll end up keeping them, because of the sound quality, comfort, and effectiveness of the ANC. But I hope they release a PC app and some of the other features I mentioned. I'd give them 3.5/5 if I could, but 4 I think is more fair than a 3. They're good, but lacking in areas that are important to me.
I bought these for my iPhone and I love them. I wish they had more Bass. I already adjusted The Equalizer to its best.
Really nice product, love it. Sony keep their sounds quality outstanding, noise cancelling is a cool feature.

I'm still holding a little bit on a final judgement of these, but so far things are pretty good. I travel fairly often, but have never had a desire to carry a big case of over the ear ANC headphones in my backpack. For the past several years, I've been using the Phiaton BT220 NC headphones for noise cancelling. Good price, compact, wireless (sort of), and did a good job with noise cancellation. The only problem I had was they had a rather present hiss (across 2 pairs), so it detracted from the audio quality, which was ok at best. So I decided to look for an upgrade, and enter the Sony true wireless. The Bad (yes, the bad first, for a reason): The case is a bit bulky compared to other true wireless. Best performance requires the Sony App. They come with several pairs of ear tips, but for the most part they were all pretty sub-par. Comfort was not terrible, but they let in a TON of ambient noise. So much so that when airborne, I could barely tell noise cancellation was working. On a recent trip, I finally had a little extra time to pick up a set of Comply isolating tips. The difference was night and day! The only problem is the Comply tips I got were more of a universal style and don't stay mounted very well (in fact they stuck in the ear when I pulled the ear buds out and I had to dig them out). Waiting for them to get a size specific to the Sony posts. The Good Once you get a good set of tips, the noise cancellation is amazing. With the good tips, I would put it on par or better than any ANC ear bud, and quite a few over the ear models. Excellent sound quality with pretty good response across the spectrum (for ear buds), and with the Sony App, you can tweak them to your liking. Battery life is pretty solid of ANC true wireless. You can quick charge 10 minutes in the case and get another hour or so out of them. Case is good for 3 full charges. Comfort wise, jury is still out as I've only had up to 3 hour flights so far. Overall, these are turning out to be pretty great. Like most true wireless ANC earbuds, you're not going to get a 9 hour international flight on a single charge. But they charge up pretty quickly, so you can take a break to give yourself more time. Sound quality is excellent and noise cancelling is nearly unparalleled. Sony just needs to work with a company like Comply to develop some quality tips to include (and be available aftermarket) and these would be near perfection.

column8: Great headphones but bad case design.
column9: I love the sound of these headphones and it's noise cancellation but the case is just too fragile. Mine got super scratched up after putting it in my backpack once.

The noise cancelling is alright, not the best I've heard, but for something like this packed into earbuds, it's pretty impressive. You will, however, still be able to hear most sounds around you with the NC on. It's not perfect NC, I would describe it more as noise dampening. The cool thing with these is the Ambient Sound feature, which let's sound pass through the speakers so you can hear your surroundings better while still listening to music. Useful for jogging or other scenarios where you need to hear what's going on around you. I do wish they could have stretched the battery life to 8 hours, though. I think it's somewheere around 5.5 hours with NC on? You can recharge it pretty quickly with the case, but it's a bit annoying. Putting them in your ear is kind of wierd, basically you put them in vertically and then twist them to get them to "lock" into place. It just feels odd to me and it doesn't really stay in place. Sound quality is top notch. Even though the noise cancelling isn't the best, with NC on you can drown out all outside noises without having to turn the volume up super loud. About 50% volume with NC is enough to immerse yourself in the music.

I bought these for my wife to use on her daily commute. She had a pair of non-noise cancelling true-wireless headphones and after I upgraded my over-ear 'phones to the WH-1000XM3, I thought it would be good to get her something that would edit out the random noise on the train. I set them up for her and tested them and the noise cancelling and sound were on par with the WH (considering the difference in format). Since she started using them, she has commented multiple times how much she likes them for both the sound and noise cancelling. Setup on Android was very easy - install the app (optional), hold the phone up to the case so the NFC reader detects it, and the rest is automatic. The app has decent controls for the headphones, and is great for tuning the ANC and sound. Battery life seems to match the promised numbers for both the earbuds and the case.

column8: I Really Wanted To Like These Earbuds...
column9: I was looking for earbuds that have great sound and even better noise cancelling since I spend a lot of time flying. I also wanted something more compact than my Sony WH1000XM2 headphones. The 1000XM2's have gone on every flight with me and worked flawlessly for the past two or so years. They even worked at silencing and unhappy two year old during a VERY long 10 hour flight. Too bad they couldn't keep the kid from wanting to climb on me like I was a tree... Style / design is great. It's nice that there are multiple ways to fit these in each ear - except for mine. I must have the tiniest ear canals of any man because I could not get these earbuds to fit no matter how hard I tried. My wife tells me I don't listen to her, but I doubt that is because of any physical limitations. I could get them to stay in my ears, but if I shook my head hard they would have come flying out. What this means is that the noise cancelling was non-existent for me. The sound quality was only okay as well. I did a side by side comparison between these earbuds and my Sony headphones. I played the same series of songs at the same volume on my stereo speakers to compare the noise cancelling. I did the same with the t.v. to simulate background chatter. I then played two different songs on my iPhone to check the sound quality against the other. Using Sony's app, I kept the equalizer on the same custom setting. On every level, except packability in a carry on bag, the headphones beat the buds hands down. As I mentioned, I really wanted to like these, but no matter how hard I tried (without going to a hearing aid clinic and getting them custom fitted to each ear), I just could get these to fit. Replacing the bulkier headphones was almost as important. Regrettably for my next upcoming 15 hour flight, these earbuds won't be coming with me.

The depth of sound is crystal and balanced. If sound could be 3 dimensional, this is it. The pink and white, bass, mid and treble are so evenly and independently layered. I can hear details in music I listened to for 20 years and didn’t know existed because I now understand the layers in older technology muddled the “colors”. I wish I had synesthesia with headphones like this. Do not neglect the app. Set these headphones up correctly.
