I was listening to my older but amazing Sure SE846 for a couple of hours then was looking at my sony buds and thought - why not, lets see what I hear and they sound different but not worse at all. I am probably going to have to sell off at least one of my beloved full sized headphones (that cost 1699 in their day) because for portable use (BlueTooth convenience aside) they sound better. I did not used to believe that a Blue Tooth, noise cancelling, Sony branded product as incredible convenient as this could compete with my giant, heavy, amped, closed back audiophile headphones but guess what... They do. They cannot replace my open back audiophile system but for closed private listening, these are now my top choice.

I have (I think) every Sony headphone made, love this stuff. So of course, I jumped at the XM3's. Sadly, they went back to Amazon within the day. What was wrong? First off, this is an amazing unboxing experience, wow, so nice. Then the disappointments set in...the earbuds need that silly Sony app "Headphones". Sure, it can tailor a bunch of parameters but why does it need to launch every silly time I use the buds? Sometimes, I just want to insert the buds and play music on my iPhone (like my trusty AirPods). Then the funky hard-to-fathom noise cancellation process. I love my WH1000XM2 headphones and the simple push a button and recalibrate. Easy enough, but this XM3 feature is WAY overdone. Simple, Sony, make it simple! Oh...and the sound was dreadful, despite trying all the various equalizer options. There was some bass (depends on how they fit in your ear though). The XM3's just could not duplicate the brightness and presence of the lowly AirPods. I wanted so much to like these, but read in-between some of the reviews here and online and you will see these flaws mentioned....or buy your own XM3 pair and end up writing a 3-star review like mine.

column8: Great for music...not for phone calls
column9: Music playback is awesome. The sound quality is great and I love the in app equalizer as well as the noise cancellation slider. The call quality is lacking though. All of the great sound features are turned off during a call so you get background noise, poor connection, and even voice distortion. They are the perfect size for running or just being active. The dock is sleek and futuristic. It charges the earbuds super fast. If you plan on using this product strictly for music, they are perfect.

These are some superior headphones. The noise canceling function is superior. Ambient noise feature is helpful when you don’t need active noise canceling. Comes with multiple ear buds for your perfect fit. Only complaint is the larger size of the charging adapter. My only complaint is I hear it’s not great when making phone calls. The receiving end says it’s not clear.
If you have to use your phone to adjust volume, they’re not ‘fully wireless’. Even the cheapest earbuds have volume control. They’re a non-starter for me. I’ll wait for the next version.

I was initially impressed with the sound quality, only to have a major issue where it suddenly drops in sound quality for a few seconds randomly when listening to music. This is with an iPhone X and newer devices. This is a widespread issue, search Reddit or head-fi and you'll see more people complaining about this strange problem - which is either due to defect or can hopefully be fixed with a firmware update. I also have serious issues with the microphone - during calls I am told my voice sounds almost robotic and cannot be understood whatosever. Not sure if I have a faulty pair or what, but I will be contacting Sony support. I cannot recommend buying these until these issues are resolved!

Based on excellent experience with the Sony W1-1000x neckband wireless headphones, and the new Sony over ear noise-cancelling headphones, I was confident that these new "truly wireless" earbuds would be a winner. I've just arranged a return. Here are the problems: a) trying to go back and forth between noise cancelling and ambient sound is erratic to say the least. After holding the left earbud as instructed, and tapping again and again, I might get lucky and get back to noise cancelling. b) automatic bluetooth pairing often fails c) bluetooth occasionally drops d) right earbud kicks out intermittenly e) weird asynchrony where the sound in one earbud is slightly delayed On the positive side, the sound quality is pretty good, the noise cancelling is not bad when I can get it on, and I haven't had many dropped signals if I'm standing up; gets iffy if I change my body position too much. At any rate, big disappointment. I guess Sony was trying to beat Bose to market with these. Should have gotten it right first.
*Horrible Mic for calls people can't hear me. *Can't adjust the volume from Earbuds must be done from the phone. *Carrying case poor quality paint already coming off after one week of usage.

So I have been using three different types of headphones lately, My Sony WH-XB700's, Jabra elite 65, and some faux pods that at 30 bucks with animation I had to try. Needless to say the last were crap... The right ear on the Jabras died and after having to plead with their customer service to work on them, Im not going to go Jabra again. Especially not after getting a hold of these. The only ting better than these at noise cancelling are the bigger over ear 1000 Sonys that just came out. The battery life on these are right on point of the 6 hours and with the cradle you can get 18h of use out of them. I usually wear a headset when I mow so that's where I can really test how well the noise cancelling works, and again it was great. The only downer to these is when you get sweaty, they are a no go...Ive tried them while mowing and while working out both times to just terrible results once you get too sweaty and instead ill just be using the 700s for that. Pairing with the app was as easy as launching the app and opening the charging case.

column8: Seems like less battery than expected
column9: Quite surprised that I get battery recharge warnings starting at about 2.5hrs, when the app indicates that there's about 20% left in each bud. This is with noise cancelling on, however noise cancelling doesn't seem to be very dramatic... it just sounds like the volume gets a little louder. They don't seem terribly secure (although not uncomfortable), although I haven't experimented with all of the different sized sleeves yet. Otherwise, I like the general form and battery charging case, even if both are a bit large, and the sound is pretty good.

column8: Fantastic but needs more software development!
column9: These headphones are in desperate need of a few more firmware/software updates. The Bluetooth connection can be very VERY finicky at times and the "Sony headphones" android app can be hit and miss keeping a stable connection. A LOT of people are experiencing (including myself) either the left or right earpiece to sudden drop connection and stop charging at all. For these people this can be fixed by placing both ear pieces back into the charging unit and placing fingers on both the touch pads of the earpieces for about 10 to 20 seconds. Keep your fingers on them and then you'll see them begin flash and don't let go until you seem them stop flashing completely. This is a factory reset and will restore full functionality to both earpieces..but in my experience, this is a temporary fix. Don't let this discourage you from considering these earbuds though. As with all new product releases, there's a period of time near the beginning of the launch of a new product in which they need time to patch out the bugs. I say, give it a month or two. I do not regret buying these. -Update- 12/19/19 After the latest firmware updates, the connection is much more reliable. Thank you Sony.

1st of all Great Noise cancelling! Used them in a busy restaurant and fiddled with the noise cancelling and ambient sound toggle. It was pretty good for these tiny things. 2. Great sound quality. Crisp clear sound bass was good not overwhelming. However not super loud, left me craving just a bit more umph in the loud department. 3. The software is extremely useful I like how you can configure each earbud to do different things I had the left for track control and the right to toggle ambient sound/noise cancelling on and off very cool. 4. Battery life is weird i used them out of the box with a quick charge of 10 mins and they read 100% within two hours went down to 20% not sure what that was about maybe I had to charge them longer I dont know. 5.ok now heres my problem with these...I put them to the test in the gym and they suck!!! They would not stay in my ear at all!!! So disappointed I really wanted to like these but cmon Sony these are expensive how the flip could you not think of this? They are ok if your sitting still but try working out or chewing gum or food they will rattle loose. This is the reason I am returning these and this reason alone. Other than that they are great sounding so immersive if they would have been a little louder and fit was more comfortable and secure I would have recommended these.

These sounded nice, but were a bit heavy on the ears. The right one actually hurt the inner crease of my ear. Could only wear for about 10 minutes. Bummer. I really wanted to like these. Ultimately, if they are not comfortable, sound quality is a moot point.

column8: Noise Cancelling didn't work at all.
column9: The active noise cancelling effect was non-existent. I returned mine. The earbuds did a half decent job of noise isolation, and there are different earbud attachments to try and optimize this, but that isn't worth 200+$. There are a lot of online reviews that seem to hype these as being awesome- but mine weren't. If you're thinking of buying these, I'd recommend you find an online review that actually demonstrates the audio effect of the active noise cancelling. I have the over the ear version of Sony headphones and their noise cancelling works great, but these just didn't work for me. Good luck.

Fantastic product! I bought these because I work in an open office which is horribly distracting and loud, it was really impacting my ability to work. I was really hoping these were going to live up to the reviews and they absolutely do! Great noise cancellation, good sound quality and once you learn the controls, easy to use. Word of advice: Make sure you’re using the right size tips. If you’re not impressed by these it’s because you don’t have a complete seal in your ear canal. Down side: These take some getting used to, they are bigger than my AirPods for sure but my AirPods weren’t giving me any noise cancellation. The app for these is unimpressive and not intuitive, they have some work to do there. Overall, great product. I would definitely recommend them for noise cancellation in an open office.

column8: Couldn't get them to stay in my ears.
column9: Couldn't get them to stay in my ears.

column8: Best ear buds I’ve ever owned!
column9: Review for Sony Earbuds: Brought these along on a Spirit Airlines flight from Houston to New Orleans. The only hiccup I experienced was not Sony's fault... when I put my iPhone in airplane mode, it also turned off Bluetooth. This in turn lead to me playing part of the Moana soundtrack to half of the plane before realizing that the sound was coming through my phones speakers instead of my earbuds. Once I got that sorted out, it was a pleasant flight. The sound cancelling feature alone was worth ordering these earbuds. I couldn't hear the pack a day smoker across the aisle as he hacked up a lung, and my seat mates' freight-train like snoring couldn't be heard. I couldn't even hear the tires squeal as Captain Kangaroo bounced us down the runway in his best attempt to stop. Nothing was heard but music.

My first few hours with earbuds, and all I can say is amazing! The sound is crisp, clear and accurate. I generally listen to music in the car and den through good quality speakers. But listening through these buds brings out detail I'd been missing. The bass seems very clean. But the strength of bass depends on the recording: if the bass was recorded flat, it comes through that way. More current CDs enhance the low end resulting in more bass.

column8: They’re nice. Not amazing. Portability key feature.
column9: Update 2019-Oct-09 The headphones work consistently now (was inconsistent during original review).. turning on and pairing when I remove them from the case. When removing from my ear they pause and resume when returning to my ear. This is nice and useful. I have come to intensely dislike the haptic controls on each earbud. Almost every single time I would put the left ear in the noise cancelling level would toggle. It was so annoying that I used the Sony app to turn off all controls on the left ear bud. Talking on the phone, the microphone performance is now consistently poor so I have stopped using these altogether for phone calls. Overall still nice sounding and noise cancelling ear buds in a small package. Haptics.. bah. Original Review. Sitting in a noisy environment, the Sony earbud’s noise cancellation (NC) definitely helps a lot, the issue is that my 3 year old Bose QC35 full size headphones do much better at NC. I’ve tried multiple earbud ends to see if a different size would create a better seal to improve the noise cancellation. No success. High pitched sounds like crickets at night seem to be a big problem for the Sony earbuds. I can still hear them with the earbuds and not at all with the Bose. When music is playing, the environment is drowned out completely. So perhaps the convenience of being able to carry the earbuds in my pocket whenever I need them outweighs the improved NC of a full size set of headphones. I have had mixed results with phone calls. The sound is great and most of the time the caller can hear me well. But, sometimes I have callers frustrated because the microphone is working poorly.. even in a quiet environment. The dreaded “I can’t hear you well”. The earbuds themselves have been a bit glitchy. When they arrived, the right ear was fully charged and the left ear was dead. It wouldn’t charge or show any life. I had to go through the tiny print in the fold out manual (seriously, stop with the tiny, poor manuals) to figure out how to completely reset the earbuds. Not an intuitive process. When I did that, the earbud started to charge again and worked. When I remove the earbuds from the case, 95% of the time they come to life and find each other. Several times one or the other doesn’t connect (usually but not always the left). This happens the most when I take the earbuds out of my ear, set the, on a table for 15 minutes, and then put the, back on. Reconnection and pairing is spotty. The only thing to do at this point is to put both back into the charging case for a moment, then take them out again. This seems to always resolve the issue. One drawback with Sony current products is that, while the earbuds can be paired to two devices, they do not switch back and forth like Bose products do. This is an absolute must if you are listening to music on a tablet and the phone rings and want to answer the phone with the earbuds. I am confused as to why Sony hasn’t addressed this feature which I consider to be critical. The sound truly is very nice. Not as nice as my full size Bose headphones, but very nice for something so small and easily portable. This makes up for a lot of the little annoyances. For a portable, always available, noise cancelling device.. these work well. I think they could work better. Especially given their top tier pricing.

Unlike quite a few of the reviews here, I listen to very detailed classical music and the sound quality on these is outstanding. Other that this they are between poor to mediocre. First off, the left earbud does cut out occasionally. The touch controls are finicky and occasionally unresponsive. But the BIG problem is that these earbuds are completely useless for phone calls. No matter how strong the signal, these earbuds cause significant voice distortion and it's for this reason that I will be returning them.

First the most important : yes it's a great sounding noise cancelling true wireless. The sound is rich and detailed, they are comfortable to wear and so on. As advertised! BUT : 1. They don't work at all with Windows PC right now. I can pair but no sound. It's a known bug it seems, but that seems like unforgivable given how wired connections are impossible. 2. The sound often jumps / is interrupted during usage, even static one at my desk, from the phone. It doesn't come from the phone BT stack... So yes, only 3 stars for now, and I might return them if Sony doesn't improve on it soon!

column8: Good sound with amazing noise cancelling
column9: Reviews on the Sony WF-1000XM3s seem unsure about the quality of the noise suppression compared to a good set of earbuds with isolating tips. I have a pair of Master & Dynamic MW07s with Comply Foam tips to compare against. I also have a recording I made during a flight on a 737 of the background noise that one has to cope with on a flight. By playing that recording through my speaker system I can produce a consistent background noise to test the efficacy of the noise cancelling on different earphones. The MW07s offer some general reduction in the background noise, but it is still very noticeable. The WF-1000XM3s in contrast are incredible when you turn on ANC. The low frequency rumbling that is so annoying and tiring virtually disappears. There is still some noise in the higher frequencies but what a difference. This was with Comply Foam tips so I cannot say how they perform with the Sony supplied tips, but I suspect that they would still be extraordinary. On the sightly negative side, the sound quality on the Sonys isn't as good as the MW07s which are probably the best sounding totally wireless earbuds you can have. However, the difference is not huge, and if you want a pair of earphones to use on a plane then the Sonys win hands down.

column8: Best Ear Buds on the market.
column9: Had them for about two weeks and waited to write my review after trying them out for two weeks. sound quality are amazing for Ear buds, noise cancellation are no where near the sony over the ear WH1000XM3 but for ear buds the noise cancellation is very good . battery life is really good and haven't had any issue through out the day. the app is a must so be sure to download it to get the best out of your purchase. you won't go wrong with them if your looking to get wireless ear buds.

The Sony WF-100XM3 is a amazing wireless earbuds. The sound quality that comes out of these small ear piece is beyond phenomenal. The crispness and clarity of the sound quality blows my mind away. I'm never been the type of person who would spend hundreds of dollars on expensive headphones. I prefer the earbuds style over the huge beat style headphones. One of the things I love about earbuds is the fact I can wear them at work and not look like i'm a DJ. I chose the white colored earbuds and they look very sleek and modern. Setup process couldn't be any easier. Since there was still battery in the earbuds, I was able to connect it to my phone via bluetooth. At this point you can use the earbuds as is. But if you want to customized your sound experience the way you like it, you have to download the Sony Headphone app. Connecting to the app is very easy. Once connected, you can customized your earbuds to your liking. Also, the app knows it when you are walking, running, sitting, or driving and customized the quality of the sounds to fit you. It makes listening to your favorite music without any sort of hiccups. One of the settings I disable is when the earbuds is removed the sound would stop. When I'm at work, I usually have only one earbuds in so I can listen to music as well as pay attention to my environment. Doing so, I'm able to listen to music or hours without having to charge. Also since the earbuds case is able to charge the earbuds while it is in the case, makes it so you would never ever be without battery. Sony thought of everything when they design these earbuds. I'm super impress with the design and the sound quality. If I could, I would definitely give it more the 5 stars.

after hearing all this good feedback about this earbuds, though to get them for gym, to began with, they too big, they sough same as my apple earbuds the sound isolation just more don't know what is it but in both mood they still sound the same I textured then, but really apple earbuds is doing the same job. this my personal opinion.

After charging the earbuds the Bluetooth pairing was automatic (really easy), and my music sounds wonderful, with exceptional stereo separation and very clear sound. Just before the music starts, you are informed of the amount of charge on the earbuds. There are a few things to figure out, but the instructions are clear and illustrated, and Sony has provided six pairs of earbuds to assure a correct fit. The app, called "headphones" on my iPhone, is comprehensive, and also includes a description of the controls, and contains an equalizer to customize the sound you prefer. It also allows you to control ambient sound and noise cancelling. Some controls are accessed by tapping the earbud, such as tapping the right earbud twice you switch from music to conversing during a phone call by activating the microphone; tapping the left earbud once activates noise cancelling, tapping it again gives you ambient sound, and another tap turns ambient sound off. The earbuds are stored in a really nice case, which is also used to charge the earbuds. I use my my earbuds both around the house and for working out. They fit well and don't fall out of my ears, and they are very comfortable. These earbuds are working really well for me, and I use them a lot. I love not having wires to connect them, whether to connect them to a device, or behind my head like most of the bluetooth headphone. I highly recommend this product.

i have no idea why there seems to be people unable to properly place these headphones sealed into the ear to use the active noise cancelling. i can only say that every feature works well and as advertised. ive probably read or watched over a dozen different tech reviews of this product and the hype is real. they are great at what they do. many of those reviews claim these are the best wireless ear buds on the market and i have no disagreements with that as for the lack of water proofing, ive been using these headphones in the gym almost daily and have sweat on them A TON. they may not be advertised as water resistant but if they weren't, i know my unit would be dead by now

I have been in search of the perfect earbuds and own so many different pairs: wired, semi-wireless, wireless, over the ear, etc... These are freakin awesome, highly recommend them to any and you will not be disappointed. Sound quality is phenomenal and noise-canceling is pretty damn good. Best of all they don't look like the AirPod jewelry you see everyone wearing everywhere these days.

I mainly bought these for long haul flights. The ANC is top notch. I use a wired B&O E4 ANC earbuds for then Inflight Entertainment system, and the Sony for listening to music via my Android cell phone. So when the Sony ran out of battery, I switched to the B&O, and then switch back to the Sony when it was charged. Bluetooth pairing worked well, with no issues. I would get some drop outs using the earbuds at work or home, but this might be due to interference from Wi-Fi and other Bluetooth devices. On 2 recent flights, I had no dropouts. The ANC is better than the E4. I liked the Sony app for fine tuning the sound. The ANC is also dependent on getting a good seal with the ear tips, so you have to experiment. Highly recommended for airplane use.

column8: Zero noise cancelling so back they go
column9: Sony used to be in the consumer electronics business. Not sure what they are doing now, and they don't seem to know either. There is a company called Apple they would do well to study. Beautiful, innovative products that work.

I am super impressed with the ability to set the functions on the earbuds by using the app. And I like that the movie I'm watching will pause automatically when I take out one earbud to talk to the flight attendant. BUT: I have Bose *wired* in-ear headphones. The ear pieces are **so much more comfortable** and fit so much better than the Sony ones. With the Sony pair, I am terrified they will fall out because they just don't feel like they fit well. Both the noise-cancelling and sound features work way better in the Bose than they do in the Sony. The noise cancelling in the Sony earbuds is non-existent - I can hear my son's TV shows right alongside the audio playing in my Sony earbuds.

I am very impressed by these earbuds. Whenever I get something with noise cancellation or noise isolation the first thing I do (after charging them of course) is put them on, turn on a podcast and jump on the riding lawn mower. I'm happy to report that I could hear my podcast at a reasonable volume will driving the mower. The noise cancellation did a good job of blocking out the motor noise and letting me hear the podcast. The bud charge easily enough and one you get the right sized earpiece (a selection of which are included) they stay in your ear well enough for most activities. I would not however recommend them for workouts as they can work themselves out of your ear when running. But for walking or traveling, or riding these are great. Sound quality is very good, but to my ear a little bass heavy, so I am still working on using adaptive sound on the android to tune that to my liking. Overall these buds are worth it just for the noise cancellation alone, but along with that you get great sound quality.

These Earbuds require the installation of a weakly written app on your phone to work correctly. No where was this on the product marketing. You have to use the app for actually turning on the Noise cancellation and get any amount of very weak music or audio to come out. The pair I had would never remember the settings. I tried them on my last plane trip and total fail. Spent over 30min trying to get them to pair with either my iPhone XS or iPad Pro. Would only stay connected for a few moments and even then the sound was so POOR that I just put them away and then went back to my Bose QC20s which upon connection had terrific sound, bass, and noise reduction WITHOUT the need of an app. I think these things are not ready from prime time and why the default settings is just to have the best sound & noise reduction from the start and then the app to fine tune if needed is beyond me. Sorry Sony but a total fail! The app also sucks as well :( I never was able to get that "crushing sound" and "clear Bass" that I've seen in the marketing reviews. I would avoid these for now until maybe gen 2.0.

column8: Sony does it right. Did you hear that?
column9: They sound great.

column8: Excellent sound and good noise cancellation
column9: Sound quality is excellent. Noise cancellation is very effective.

I bought this for travel and listening to music. The high freq distortion was too distracting to use for music. Also, the app is buggy and compared to the airpods, the case is huge. Love the airpods because the case fits nicely in my pocket. I look forward to trying the noise canceling in an airplane.

column8: Great sounding earbuds with Noise Cancelling
column9: I am very impressed with sound quality from Sony WF-1000XM3 wireless earbuds. I have tried several different wireless earbuds with different brands, and I can comfortably say this has the best sound quality with wide margin. Does this replace my big over-the-ear headphones for sound quality? No, but it comes very close in terms of clarity and sound separation. Noise cancelling (NC) is the other area WF-1000XM3 shines as no other earbuds implement true NC. It's very convientn that I can preset NC level based on my activity. i.e., when I sit down, it maximizes NC. And as it detects more motion, it provides more ambient sound. Good thing these can be easily configured in the phone. Major down side of WF-1000XM3 is bluetooth connectivity issue with my Galaxy Note 9 phone. (I cannot speak for other phones, but my phone has no problem with other devices) I get connection drop several times a day; it is more pronounced when it doesn't play anything. Sometimes it is disconnected, and cannot be re-connected. When it happens, I have to put both buds in the charging case, and force restart (long press left, then right) Hope this can be fixed via FW update near future.

column8: Poor audio quality and inferior noise cancellation
column9: Ordered from amazon and thought that they would be great, based on the reviews. I’m not a picky listener but I found the audio quality horrible with no bass. I tried various settings on the app without success. While the noise cancellation was noticeable it wasn’t anything near my Bose (which of course are larger). I also don’t understand why the app needs to know my location. Perhaps I received a defective unit.

column8: Great sounding ear buds, easily connected with Android phone; premium product
column9: Sony wireless ear buds with Noise Canceling. My son owns an Android phone and bought ear buds made by the same company. After a few weeks, they would no longer work properly; would drop the calls, would lose connection, etc. He was very skeptical in getting a set of buds from a different manufacturer, but has always had good luck with Sony products. He was not disappointed! The sound quality and the bass it gives off is impressive and the noise cancelling is better than anything he has ever used. He likes that the case keeps them snug and charges them quickly. After a full charge, he gets almost 24 hours of use before needing to charge again. And the sound is top notch! Premium sound quality!

column8: Good concept but has many flaws
column9: I was able to use these for a 12 hour flight and I was through disappointed. The concept was great but the execution was poor mainly in battery life, comfort and usability. Battery life: 3 hours into the flight, I was getting notice that the battery was low. Had to take them off to charge. I’m so used to the wired Boses lasting 40+ hrs, I’ve never once had to hear the loud airplane engine noises. This was disappointing that I had to take breaks in between. Comfort: After 3 hrs in the ear, these felt extremely uncomfortable and my ears started to hurt. Aside from the battery recharge, I would’ve had to take them off anyway to let me ears heal from the pain. Usability: I was wearing these with a headrest pillow, when I took my pillow off, I had accidentally knock one of the earpieces out of my ear and it fell under the airplane seat. I struggled for 20 minutes trying to reach and find it without success until I asked my seat neighbors to get up so that I can crawl down to find it. I ultimately found it but it was such a pain with it’s small size and how it protrudes out of your ear to be knocked off easily. I’ll be returning back to my wired 40+ hr headphones

I didn't buy them through Amazon. I bought these at a Sony store in moscow so I could use on my flight back. The noise cancelation was outstanding on my flight home, sound of music was clear without having to raise volume very high. Connection to my galaxy s9+ was very simple. I used for talking on whatsapp, people on other end heard me clear, not better or worse than other devices I used. The only downside is that the carrying case is slightly large. Battery lasted my 4 1/2 hour flight.

I LOVED everything about these earphones but had to return them due to the simple fact that they’re just way too bulky. The app, although it had connection problems sometimes, is very detailed and perfect for anyone looking for a specific sound. Sad to have returned them but just couldn’t deal with them sticking so far out of my ear and constantly falling out no matter what tips I tried.

column8: Great noise canceling and software .good sound not great.
column9: Noise cancellations great the best I've used. Great software, one complaint is you cannot adjust the volume on the buds you have to have your phone at hand. Sound quality is good but they are no better than my samsung buds at half the price and no way as good as my senheiser momentoms. They do sound good but I was a little disappointed for the price.

column8: Highly Recommend! Great Presence, Separation and Tone! The Best Thing Yet in Wireless ANC Listening!
column9: I was a big fan of the WI-1000X’s (around the neck high end Sony earbuds.) They were extremely comfortable with great presence, separation and tone, and adequate ANC. The biggest drawback with them was battery life and most certainly, battery charging time which took dreadfully long. I had tried the industry leading Sony WH-1000XM3’s (cans), but even with the app I could never get the presence or tone out of them that the WI-1000X’s gave me. Beyond that they felt heavy, uncomfortable, almost always hot, and definitely claustrophobic. All of this contributed to their lack of presence. Granted the ANC was superior, and the battery life almost insane, but I just couldn’t make them work. So enter the WF-1000XM3’s. Out of the box the tone was just too high and bright, but fortunately, the accompanying app gave me the chance to do requisite tweaking, and after about a half hour I had them rivaling my WI-1000X’s, and after five days with them, I have to say I am extremely impressed! They are lightweight and comfortable, and have stellar presence and sound! I’m not sure the ANC is as good as the WI-1000X’s, but the real test will come on the first set of flights coming up. Beyond all of this, they boast excellent battery life, reserve power with the case, and quick charging. There is no wireless charging option, which would have been nice. The Bluetooth connects easily and has good range. And handily, when you pull a bud out of your ear, whatever you were playing pauses, and restarts as soon as you slip the bud back in. The touch controls are okay - a little finicky for my taste, but they’re not a problem. They lack a volume control, however, which was extremely nice with the WI-1000X’s. So, the drawbacks for me at this point are minor. With the WI-1000X’s you could pull the buds out of your ear and they just hung off of the neckband ready to be re-inserted. With the WF-1000XM3’s I’m at a loss about what to do with the buds when I pull them out of my ear. The case is too bulky for my pockets and just stuffing the buds into my pockets doesn’t seem like a good idea. But I guess that's the problem you get with truly wireless buds. Lastly, I ordered the silver option and I wish I had gone with black, a purely minor personal complaint. I would highly recommend these - they’re the best thing yet in wireless ANC listening! One other note, I bought these for slightly less than retail through an “open box” option with Amazon. They arrived quickly and were absolutely “like new” and I have no complaints about buying them with this option at all.

I am an audio engineer and an audiophile, and I have various headphones including Sony's wf-1000xm3 headphones (their newest large noise-cancelling over-ear ones) as well as the new Beats PowerBeats Pro, and I don't understand the negative reviews here. These things are great. ---PROS First of all, as the professional reviews have noted, the noise cancellation does absolutely work, and it works very well. These are not quite as "isolating" as the over-ear noise cancelling headphones because there is no over-ear cup to block the sound. (Obviously.) But for earbuds, and compared to PowerBeats Pro for example, they really do block much more ambient sound and what Sony has done with noise cancellation in this small form factor is really incredible. I tried it inside with loud a/c running, and walking around the streets of Manhattan, and they give me about 70-80% of the noise cancelling experience I have with the big over-ear ones, which is really amazing. Sound quality is great, with wide range and crisp definition, and personally I like the sound better than the PowerBeats Pro. If you want a boosted bass sound, you can get that with the EQ inside of the Sony Headphones Connect app -- the bass boost preset sounds really really good. (I have it on by default now.) A few other notes, especially compared to PowerBeats Pro. The battery case is much better in my opinion. The battery case for PowerBeats Pro is really big and bulky and is impossible to carry around comfortably in your pocket (looks like a hamburger). Not so with Sony -- the case is really high quality and slim and pocketable. I know these technically aren't waterproof but I tried them for a brief run in the gym mainly to test if they'd fall out, and they were just as snug in my ear as Apple's AirPods. (I needed to choose the smallest size for the earbud piece though.) The touch-sensitive buttons on the side are surprisingly responsive and useful. The right side works like a standard multi-function headphone button (touch once to play or stop, twice to skip to the next song, three times to go back a song). CONS For me these are minor. -They don't have volume controls on the earbuds themselves. Personally I don't care -- I can easily access the volume rocker on the side of my iPhone as well as the volume control on my Apple Watch, so I don't need it on the earbud itself. -Supposedly no waterproofing. I've worn other Sony headphones for sweaty gym workouts and never had a problem, so I'm guessing this will not be a big deal. -The Sony Connect app, while pretty powerful, is a little fiddly. But if you take a sec to figure out how it works, it's quite useful. These earbuds are great, my current go-to headphones for basically everything except audio engineering in the studio.

Great sound quality and noise cancellation. I picked these ahead of several others because the connected app allows me to custom adjust the frequency response, something very important to me because of my specific hearing impairment. With equalizer, these earbuds allow me to enjoy classical and popular music like I did when I was 40 years younger.

column8: Good set of headphones, failed after applying the 1st available firmware update
column9: I've had my earbuds for about a month now, using them for 1-3 hours every day. Good performance, zero connection issues, solid battery life, good sound quality.. Yesterday I was notified of a software / firmware update and applied it smoothly. Today my headphones are no longer charging in the case. I tried the Reset process and it seemed to work on the Left earbud. The Right earbud won't reset and is down to 20% power, and won't seem to take a charge. I've already spent an hour or two reading help and reset process to little effect. Looks these will be getting returned. I've been using Jaybirds for years now, and probably will again due to their rock solid build quality and reliability.

The sound was just OK for all the hype I read. The volume would not get but to a certain point and not very loud. I was disappointed with them compared to my Bose EarPods. The bluetooth connection was not very good and I was always resetting to connect.
The noise cancellation works well; finished listening audio book during a lawn mowing session.

After using these for a while (since launch day), I've found that these headphones suffer from a combination of hardware and software problems that make them far less than the sum of their parts. Despite the quoted battery life, they lose 50% of their charge in just over an hour. They almost always fail to charge in the case without a lot of wiggling and checking to make sure they're charging. The way they indicate that they're 100% charged is not distinguishable from the way they indicate they're not charging, so there's no way to tell if they're fully charged or not making contact with the charging pins. Because they only use one wear sensor (unlike AirPods, which have two, one on each side of each earbud) they frequently turn on in the case if they're not making perfect contact with the charging pins, so it's not out of the ordinary to put them in in the morning to find a dead or partially charged battery. The touch control to switch between ambient sound and noise cancelling often takes upwards of 10 consecutive touches to register once. And don't even get me started on their iOS app -- it barely works, frequently loses the ability to connect to one of its registered devices, and firmware updates are totally broken on iOS 13. They sent me a survey by email to learn my thoughts on the headphones, which I couldn't complete because it was so full of misspellings and English grammar errors that I couldn't understand half the questions being asked. Apart from NC and sound quality (which -- let me be clear -- are stellar) everything else about these headphones is half-baked at best.

easy to connect, control and optimize. The sound and the silence they create when NC is on allows me to concentrate on working in almost any environment. Well worth the money spent. Some have complained about the size of the case but I'm wearing the case ..it's in my pocket. The "tap" on left to engage the NC or go to ambient sound. Right side will pause and restart music.Firmware updates are also automatic. I know they're not waterproof but even in Portland, Oregon it has not been an issue to me. Very pleased with their performance and quality, highly recommend.

Maybe I had a defective pair, but I had connectivity issues. They buds had a lot of issues connecting to the Sony app and issues connecting to my iPhone even after all firmware updates were done. Also had small drops in sound while listening to music (like milliseconds, but def noticeable.) when they worked they had amazing sounds quality, but it was so hit or miss to get them to work, I ended up returning them after 4 frustrating days. They made me appreciate the simplicity of my AirPods.

Let me say I was excited to be gifted these. The features and quality is amazing. However, learning how to use it took a bit of time. It’s not very user friendly. I guess my left ear is weird and it kept falling out, so only the right side was a perfect fit. Luckily they fit my husband well. They are not for everyone, but if they get to working for you it is a 10/10! I’ll have to wait out and see if they have new models with a different grip in the future.
It's nice to have this one.
These are what the Greek Gods would have demanded!

column8: Noise cancelling, easy of use and sound quality ROCK!!!
column9: I finally upgraded from my apple airpods. What a difference! Seriously. I took the time to read more than enough reviews from other sites and the customer reviews on here. There is no equal, as far as I’m concerned. I workout at the gym (though I’m in the greatest shape. But hey, I try). With the noise cancelling on, it’s as if I’m all alone. Not a sound around me! Seriously. The fit is fantastic. Sweat was getting in my ears, and the left piece had a little difficulty with that. Nothing to freak me out. They are very easy to pair with my iPhone. I’ve been an Amazon Prime customer for what seems like a lifetime. I don’t write reviews. However, I had to regarding these earphones. I don’t have the silver ones, but that’s not the point. If you are looking for an amazing set of earphones, spend the money! If they aren’t you for, you can always return them. I do NOT plan on returning mine. I hope this review was helpful.

column8: Sound are really good for earbuds
column9: These headphones are more than I expected

column8: Great Sound quality, Great Noise cancellation but useless
column9: I like the brand and have two over the ear models, that are great. About this one, I loved the sound and noise cancelling features but with pain in my hart had to return them for several issues. I tried two different, when I found the problems with the first one asked for a replacement thinking that I got a lemon, but no, the new one had exactly the same issues, so if it is a lemon, we are talking about a box full of them NFC Function is great, and as already said, Great Sound quality, Great Noise cancellation, apparently this should be enough regarding headphones. But don't even think in use them to workout, they will be constantly dropping out to the floor. The charge is very unstable, at the end I found out that sometimes they don't connect to the charge even though they are inside the case. The touch functions are a joke, they work whenever they want, sometimes have to touch them carefully and repeatedly to get the desired function. Constantly dropping the Bluetooth connection, and when that happened the only solution to make them work again was to put them inside the box and get them out again, so I had to have the box(that is not too small) constantly with me to be able to use them. When connected to some devices initially they worked fine, but after a while the right one dropped connection, and the left one continues working. Just after I decided to return them I noticed that one had the led constantly on in blue, by the way, I don't think that having leds constantly blinking in your ears is a good idea. I'm very disappointed and really wanted them to work, but I'll wait for the next release to see if they improve the design. The funny thing is that when you search on internet in most of the sites that make comparisons they are the best ones. So I might be in very bad luck with this ones.

The only reason buying these is for noise cancellation. I have tried with all ear tips and there is no noise cancellation at all. They are so not as comfortable as online reviewers say. The only good thing is the sound quality. Returned it in the end.

I hate these headphones with a passion. I missed the return deadline and now I’m stuck with these. The Headphones app barely works. My headphones will be on and discoverable but the app will fail. I’d have to manually go to the iPhone Bluetooth settings to pair them each time. The device doesn’t appear in the quick audio output list in the control center. When finally connected, expect to have them disconnected soon. It randomly drops ALL the time. After speaking to someone on the phone and switching to another call. Or podcast to another podcast. Or if I’m listening to something, and a call comes in. You better bet the audio is no longer coming from where they should be, but from your iPhone’s internal earpiece. I’d have to pair them manually all over again. It takes forever to reconnect or switch between devices. You have to hold onto the touch pads for 7 seconds. (My old Beats X take 3 seconds). This wouldn’t be much of a problem if I didn’t have to do it so often. And when it is finally connected, sometimes one earbud will have no sound. Sometimes they’ll both have sound, but one is lagging a second behind. Other times, sound flickers, goes in and out due to connectivity issues. On the headphones app, it’s already set to prioritize audio connectivity rather than quality. The touch pads to control the headphones will be triggered by inanimate things, like my sleeve, pillow, or sometimes my own damn hair. The volume is cut in half when paired with a Mac despite being on the loudest setting. (Forums show other customers experiencing this with no resolution). Physically, they feel like they’re on the verge of falling out. My ears start to become sore and hurt after about an hour. I’m using the smallest buds. The noise cancellation is okay. It takes too long to switch environmental context, both by manually triggering the touch pad or by tracking your speed. Their press-to-pause is essentially useless because by the time the headphones has registered your command, you could’ve taken off your headphones by then and have had a full conversation. That’s not to say the sound isn’t great. It’s a little lacking in the bass end but I’m not an audiophile, so I can’t give an accurate assessment. But with all these downsides just from operation and execution, they’re 193884939% not worth it.

I travel a lot. 4 to 6 flights a week and these are great. Noise cancelling reduces the aircraft background noise. With music or a movie you are good to go. The software allows you customize your listening experience. No more lugging around a headphone case. The earbud case is the size of your palm and keeps the buds charged.

column8: I'm hoping mine was just a bad set. Robot Voice Issues
column9: I bought my wife a set of these to use primarily for making hands free calls. They were to replace a $40 off-brand set. We both love everything about them from sound quality to ear feel but after being on a call for a few minutes they begin to malfunction. The person on the receiving end of the call suddenly can't understand the caller. It sounds like we are talking through a robot voice filter. I have performed a factory reset, tried other phones, tried calls in different locations, verified latest software was installed and I finally called Sony. After only a couple mins on the line they were ready to send me another set. I have found a several other reviews with this same complaint so I can only assume this is a known issue for them. Regardless I like them enough to try again. My second set is on the way and I will update my review if the second set deserves it.

column8: Buy this if you wanna buy someone Ear Pods for their B-Day
column9: Bought them for an old friend who wanted some ear pods as a present. Was a bit worried since they wanted Beats version but when they Face Timed me when they got them in the mail she was really happy with the gift. Asked her if she liked how they sound and how they fit amongst other things and well . Needless to say I felt like a good friend seeing her smile as she described how happy she was with the present I’ve gotten her for her birthday.

column8: Great sound, but will not connect to Windows 10 computer
column9: I was excited about purchasing these based on the reviews but was a little concerned about some of the issues around connections. Got these out of the box tested them for about a day, and I liked them, and great sound quality. Then tried to connect to my MS surface, and Lenovo laptop to the headphones, it connected but would not play sound. Tried different fixes from Sony with no good results, and never got connected. I returned these to the store and I am now looking for the next best thing.

column8: Clearly very good hence the 5 star rating. ;
column9: Overall obviously a good product since I rated at 5 stars. I haven't read all the reviews so not sure if this information is out there or not, but something that I've figured out about VOLUME CONTROL (at least on android phones). If you set one of the ear buds to the google assistant, you merely need to hold your finger on that bud and speak the volume level you want, eg. volume 4.5. You don't need to say, "hey google" since it immediately starts listening once your finger is on the pad. In regard to the negative reviews about CALL QUALITY... I have no idea what they are talking about. My girlfriend and I tested this extensively, and she could hear me clearly. Funnily (if that's a word, at least spell correct thinks so), during our call, I put her Apple ear bud in one ear and one of these Sony buds in my other ear and I could hear myself on the call and I agree it sounded perfect. Maybe someone is having another issue or maybe there has since been an update? In regard to one of the buds LOSING CONNECTIVITY. I did have this happen twice, but in the setting of turning the buds off using the phone app, and then trying to reconnect to see if they turned on automatically, and one did while the other didn't. Though it eventually did when I turned them back off and on. This is an unusual situation as you don't typically need to turn them off. The second time it happened, I popped them in the case, took them out and they worked again. Since that time I have used tried various things to reproduce the scenario without success. For example, I had both in, took one out, left it there and left the room. Came back, put it back in and it reactivated. I put one back in the case, using just one, put it back in and it worked. I've traded taking one out, keeping the other in, so forth and I've had no problems since. So not sure on that one, except knowing it can happen but seems to be easily resolved. Regarding SOUND QUALITY. Very good. I am an audiophile and have extensive sound/music equipment including about 10 pairs of various wired and wireless headphones including standard over the ear, open back, and buds. These are as good as any high quality headphone. Something that some people might be ignoring is that although out of the box they only sound slightly better than the AirPods, with the app you can adjust the equalization (5 level EQ) along with a Clear Bass adjustment (either negative or positive bass adjustment for 10 levels total I think). Ater spending a few minutes adjusting those parameters while listening to music, they now sound about twice as good as the AirPods, well you know, as far as I can tell. For the most part I agree with other reviewers on the other aspects. Hope that helps.

column8: NOT FOR SPORTS!! Disappointing noise cancelling.
column9: Man I have been super excited about these for a couple months now and when I finally get them, wow, such a disappointment. They will not stay in your ear, and ABSOLUTELY will not maintain a good seal if you're, eating, talking, working out, or just moving around some. Yes, I read the directions, you have to twist them into place, which did help, but not enough. Also the ear pads showed wear after just a few uses, like they were getting cracks. Noise cancelling is noticeable but not impressive. I think part of this is because the seal is so inconsistent. I have several pair of ear buds, headphones, wired and wireless. I had the Sony WH-1000XM2 and XM3. Absolutely amazing, especially the XM3. I have the Bose wired ear buds that are excellent, and the Galaxy buds. I have to recommend the Galaxy Buds over these, before even considering the price. Galaxy buds sound almost as good, stay in place MUCH better, the case is more convenient(wireless charging and smaller case), and are much cheaper. the Sony WF-1000XM3 do have very good sound quality, though not at the level of their big brother from Sony. Also they will pick up your voice better than the galaxy buds and have longer battery life and NFC pairing, but none of this is any use if you can't keep them in your ear. I even tried them in bed, which works great till you turn your head. Since they stick out more than the galaxy buds they will easily hit the pillow and lose their seal or fall out. If you work out with these they WILL fall on the floor at some point so be careful. I wanted these to work so bad I keep using them for 3 weeks but I just can't make them work for me. Might buy an extra pair of Galaxy Buds to have one at work. Oh, I do have the B&O buds, which I've had for over a year, and I'd say they have just as good of sound quality as the Sony and possibly as good of noise cancelling, though just passive cancelling. Battery life is definitely weak on the B&O though it's usually not an issue for me.

I got these to listen to music and listen to audiobooks. Great sound quality. Great battery life. Comfortable and secure fit. Noise cancelling not as good as over ear headphones, but what would you expect?

Randomly stopped connecting. Cannot factory reset as the left touch sensor no longer seems to work. Cannot pair through bluetooth or NFC anymore. Red charging LED on left earpiece faintly flickers when charging.

column8: Horrible microphone call quality But great for music
column9: Update: Bluetooth connection to both earbuds got fixed by itself after few hours of using and keeping in case. I changed the earbud to bigger size and microphone sounds good now. Now the noise cancellation is great. This is worth the every penny. I am increasing my rating from 1 to 5 I have purchased sony wf 1000xm3 for the 2nd time. In the first set bought from bestbuy i had faced issues with microphone as the callers were unable to listen to my voice. I thought it to be faulty piece and returned it. As i liked the music i ordered it again in amazon. In the second pair the microphone issue still exists. I can’t make any call through headphone as the person on other side can’t hear me. In addition to that right side headset doesn’t work independently in the new pair. It used to work in my old returned pair. This ears phones should work with single earpiece but if i place the left side earpiece the headphone disconnected. And right side headphone doesn’t get connected independently. I tried resetting multiple times but no use. No doubt these earphones sound amazingly well but hardware and connectivity issues are so frustrating. I have no choice but to return these and go for some other brand. I trusted sony for their quality but this time i am disappointed.

These work fine with my Android phone, although the noise cancellation is not as good as headphones, certainly, or other wired ear pods I’ve tried. I was floored to learn these wouldn’t work with windows 10. They worked fine with my iPad Until Apple “Upgraded” me to ios13. Now they won’t connect at al. both android and iPad require use of a Sony app, which is not required by other Bluetooth devices, and the app is poorly rated. This 3 is generous in the hopes that future software update can overcome these problems. Way too expensive if unusable on mainstream devices that can connect with almost any other Bluetooth audio device

Bose who? After years of a dedicated user, I decided the Bose wireless headphones lacking a movie cancelling option was not enough. Out of the shadows came the Sony WF-1000XM3 earbuds that destroyed the competition. Amazing sound. The noise cancellation option is the best yet to come. Thank you for making truly amazing earbuds.

column8: Very good but limited in volume
column9: Bought these a few weeks back. Tried them walking around NYC for a couple of weeks. I had trouble figuring out when I had the noise cancelling on or off. Best way to tell is to open the SONY app. It does a decent job blocking the cacophony of Midtown NYC. The sound quality is more than decent, so a pair of wireless buds. I did occasionally get skipping issues with the Bluetooth connection -- I had it paired with an iPhone Xs Max -- but it wasn't too bad. It did pair quickly and without any issues. It also fit very well, especially with the foam tips. My biggest complaint with these is volume. Sometimes, I want to be awash in music, and these phones can't give me that. Not even in my apartment, which is pretty quiet. I ended up downloading an app that allowed me some volume control, though it still fell short of what I was looking for. Full disclosure, I had been using the Shure 846 wired IEMs, and while I did not expect to get that kind of sound, I had expected a bit more than what it delivered. Don't get me wrong, they are superior to the Airpods, and may in fact, be the best truly wireless IEMs out there for now. I'm giving it 4 stars, and holding back 1 star for the volume issue.
Sound

column8: Get used to the quirks and these will be your favorite headphones.
column9: Was hesitant to pick these up over the over ear variant, but I am so glad I made the choice I did. While audio quality and noise cancelation do take a small hit the performance is still better than 80% of noise canceling headphones on the market right now in a similar price range. pair that with the ability to fit these little guys in your pocket and these have quickly become my favorite peice of kit I carry everyday.

I love these earbuds. I wear them at work, at the gym, and around the house. They far exceeded my expectations as the other wireless earbuds I've tried in the past let me down. These earbuds come with several sizes of silicone buds so you can find the perfect fit. I tend to have a hard time finding earbuds that will stay in place without one of those "over the ear" loops. I didn't even need to use the other sizes; the earbuds fit me perfectly right out of the box. Like everything else these days, there's an app! The app lets you control the automatic adjustment for background noise along with other settings. You can pair them with Google Assistant if you like. I primarily use these for music, podcasts, and audio books. Every now and then I use them for phone calls while cooking or doing chores. In every situation the sound quality is great. The earbuds are comfortable and light. At my job, employees are allowed to use one earbud to listen to music, podcasts, etc, while working. One ear bud works just fine with this set -- the left one only. The right earbud doesn't work by itself. The charging case is fantastic. It looks sleek and quickly charges the earbuds. I use the earbuds for several hours per day and probably only charge the case itself once or twice a week at most. The earbuds are held in place magnetically when in the case.

column8: Won’t work with Microsoft Team conference meetings on a surface laptop
column9: Wonderful product but you cannot use them for meetings with Microsoft teams on a surface laptop. Very disappointed.

The product is good, when it works correctly. Unfortunately the connection drops out so frequently that it's difficult to watch a 5 minute video without one or both getting disconnected. I have them set to prioritize a stable connection, but no dice. Supposedly there was an update that fixed this, but the app does not report any updates.

I ordered color white and it came with a really nice rosegold/off white charging case. The actual earbuds are also off white, not true white. The set up was very easy and it came with 6 pairs of replacement eartips, ranging from small to large. I have texted them in the gym and it survived. The design and quality is really good and my favorite part is the ambience control, it gives you option to turn it on when you still want to hear the surrounding sound when you are working. My only comment for this product is the single tap function. I wish it could be double tap instead, because whenever I am adjusting my earbuds, it would accidentally turned off or turned ambience sound on, etc. Or if I am tapping too soon every 2 second, it tend to freeze. So far it has been working great with my Galaxy S9 and there were no connection issues, and I wish soon this line will have more color options.

I have a pair of $350 over the ear bluetooth headphones and I'd be hard pressed to tell the difference in sound quality. It is shockingly good. There is very little to no noticeable latency. Battery life seems as advertised and they easily pair to multiple devices across OS's. Active noise cancelation is impressive and the passthrough feature is a nice touch (especially adaptive passthrough). Passive noise isolation leaves something to be desired. The tips that come with the buds are high quality and have the option of foam fill in the empty space but I just couldn't fine one that fit right. I like the tips to flair out and then back in (like a mushroom) in order to apply a sealing force against the canal without an outward force pushing the buds out of the ear. The stock tips didn't do the trick for me but I swapped them for the ones on buds I already have and the passive isolation was a lot better. I'm sure if you invested in some high quality tip replacements like Comply, the result would be even better. Overall this is a really, really good pair of buds, probably the best I've owned.
Didn’t work well for me. Couldn’t get good volume. . Am hard of hearing so maybe my fault. Returned with no trouble.

column8: Bought these to replace a failed pair of airpods. (UPDATED)
column9: Bought to replace my wife's airpods. For about a month they just sat in the package. So, I did what any respectable husband would - I decided that they were now mine! I have several pair of BT headphones from over the ear Harmon Kardons (which sound amazing), JBL's, down to some JVC marshmallows (which have amazing sound and batterylife - especially at the price). Anyway, back to the Sony ear buds. I was stunned by how well they felt in the ear. They just don't look like they will stay in, but they do, perfectly. The sound was better than I expected it to be (typical for Sony to over-deliver). Great isolation, bass, and clarity The app made fine tuning easy. Phone quality was better than my plantroinics set that I use for work. To the point, folks I called stated that the audio was fine and that it didn't sound like I was on an earpiece. Battery life, I haven't really tested yet. But I already know that it lasts longer than my JBLs & HKs. Add to that the portability and charging case - Basically, these are an excellent pair of BT wireless headphones. (UPDATE) OK, so I've been using these for a couple of months now. I flat-out love these earbuds. Battery life is exceptional, noise cancelling is among the best. I bounce back and forth between my surface pro and my phone without any issues. While these are not cheap, they aren't exactly expensive. They over-deliver at their price point. If you are considering buying them - do! You'll be pleased.

column8: Son los mejores audífonos TWS que hay actualmente en el mercado.
column9: Estos son los mejores audifonos inalámbricos que he probado sin duda, no se porque aquí hay varios usuarios que los tienen mal valorados, a ver me pregunto yo que me muestren alguno mejor que estos, No hay otro mejor que estos. El sonido es increíble, la duración de la bateria y su comodidad, estos no se caen de ninguna manera, y su cancelacion de ruido es muy buena. El estuche si bien es dos veces mas grande que el de los airpods, pero es que estos audifonos son dos veces mejor que los airpods jaja. Pero si me hubiese gustado un poco mas pequeño el estuche, pero eso si es muy elegante su diseño, muy premium. Hasta el momento no tengo ninguna queja con ellos. Son lo mejor de lo mejor.

column8: Useless to make calls and doesn't stay in ears.
column9: I honestly wanted to love these. The noise cancelling is ok but the ergonomics and the mic suck. I wish they would have made the ear piece fit like the Bose, with the little wing tip. These just don't stay in my ears no matter which tip I put on. It's frustrating. And forget making phone calls with it. No one has been able to hear me. Wish I would have returned it but alas, it is what it is. I would recommend waiting for Bose or even Apple to come out with a noise cancelling solution. These just aren't it. Also, adjusting them every time set off an action which I had to disable. Usually love Sony products. This isn't one of them.
Great product. Nice quality. Used them on the plane, and I have to say "Awesome".

Although I’m comfortable with tech, I’m not particularly an audio expert, so this review will be from a user’s general perspective. I’ve used headphones for years, from my old iPod to my current iPhone. The Sony Wireless Noise Canceling Stereo Headset, WF-1000XM3, replaces two good wired ear buds I’d been currently using – by Sennheiser and Bose, primarily for listening to music. The Sony, hands down, has superior playback quality. In fact, the quality is shockingly better, truly superb sound. Again, I can’t comment on the HD Noise Canceling Processor QN1e or the 24 bit signal processing, but they sound terrific! I do use the headphone for walking along roads often, and without the noise canceling function, I’m able to hear “ambient sound,” i.e. traffic about as well as with the two wired ear buds. I don’t use noise cancelling on the road. Haven’t had an opportunity to fly with them yet, but the noise cancelling feature does work well to tune out a neighbor’s barking dog. Getting set up required a bit of guesswork – the instructions were basic, at best. (I guess you have to limit text when they’re in 9 different languages). I’m also more verbal, and the most helpful instructions were pictorial. A few more impressions – the Sony buds fit nicely as you spin them into your ear. Several sized silicon rubber inserts achieve a comfy fit. I’ve gone 4+ hours with music playback, so I believe Sony’s claim that a charge will get you 6 hours. I *love* that the two earbuds are marked left & right. Also – very easy to put away: just match the brass colored connections and they magnetically join. Very easy to charge too. Only complaint is that the attractive, compact charger/case has no way to store the USB *short* charging cord, which I think might be easily lost. As a leftie, I also love that I can tap the left ear bud to change settings. Really, the Sony buds are quite easy to use once you learn about them. Very easy transition to taking a call while listening to music. One minor annoyance – and this could be on Apple. When I’ve handled the ear buds, say to put them in the charging case, they tend to turn on iTunes on my phone. I’ll walk by it and hear music playing out of the native speaker. Last word – I’m a senior. If you’re in my age range, don’t hesitate to get these great ear buds out of anxiety over tech. They are really a great product that I’ve grown to love and I feel confident you’ll enjoy them too.

column8: Great headphones at first, but sound deteriorated way faster than expected.
column9: I originally bought these headphones through Best Buy, but I’m writing a review here because this is where I read product reviews. The headphones are great. The tip selection really allowed me to figure out what produced the best fit and gave the best noise cancelation. The noise cancelation blew my mind for a pair of wireless earbuds. They aren’t much more money then some of the other wireless buds on the market and if you can live without the water proofing they are definitely worth the extra couple bucks. Also, most wireless earbuds have a crippling audio lag that makes watching videos impossible. These barely have any lag at all which makes it way less annoying than anything else out there. The negatives; The app is a little finicky sometimes. You could be connected to the buds, but the app doesn’t say you are so you have to take them out of your ears put them back in the case and then reconnect them. I also wish there was a way to see the individual charging status while they are I’m the case. Granted they charge really quick so it’s not that important. As far as I’m concerned there is no way to tell how much better life your case has left and I wish the app told you that. The biggest reason I’m giving the earbuds 3 stars is because I haven’t used them enough to warrant a blown driver. The right earbud has a noticeable buzz on bass notes. I use these maybe once or twice a week and I’ve only had them for about 3 months. I don’t think earbuds are this price should be losing quality like that so soon. Normally, I would wash my headphones out with 90% rubbing alcohol and get any dust or earwax out that might be causing the issue, but I’m not about to do that with earbuds that cost a small fortune. This just happened so I’ll probably contact Sony in the near future and edit my review based on what their customer service says. I still think they are worth the buy because they truly are the best noise canceling earbuds money can buy right now.

column8: ridiculous cost to replace ear bud.
column9: These earbuds have great sound quality. Full points. However, I lost an earbud. Sony is charging 160.00 to replace one earbud. The whole kit only costs 220.00. Also, they need to be sent back to the repair center to sync the earbuds. I will never buy another sony product again.
Fantastic

column8: This gets 4 stars because Active Noise Cancellation is average. Otherwise everything else is Great.
column9: TLDR: This gets 4 stars because Active Noise Cancellation is.... average ... Otherwise everything else is Great. That said... these are $230 because of the ANC. Knowing that ANC is, not great, I would only really pay $150-175 if that feature didn't exist on these. I'm a connoisseur of the ~$300 headphones, since way back before we all were able to walk around with phones/MP3 players. I swap back and forth between Shure, Sennheiser, and Bose. This price range, I've found, is the sweet spot, where you the sweet high-end quality without stepping into "professional" level price ranges. None of the foam tips work for me. They comes with 4 silicon tips (extra small to large). Just like any other in-ears, you have to get the right fit. Luckily the largest ones fit for me. I can easily bend over, tip my head, walk, etc. without them coming loose. I'm going to buy a couple other variations of large tips to try to get a slightly better fit After tweaking the equalizer in the Sony app, I can honestly say these sounds great, for all types of music. Enough said. Well worth the money. Noise cancellation... this is the real let down. I'm used to the Bose QC35. Granted, those are $100 more expensive, I was expecting better. The ANC is there, you can tell when you turn ANC on, but it's soooo subtle. If you have a fan on in the background, it'll muffle it - where the QC35 will eliminate it. Battery life. I only need them to last 2-3 hours at any one time. They last at least that long, so good enough. They charge up quick. They are comfortable enough to wear until they run out of battery. I don't know about 8 hours a day, 5 days a week comfortable, but if you need that level of comfort, you should probably no be looking at in-ears. *update* getting a 3rd party pair of Large foam tips, these fit and sound even better.

I'm really sad that unfortunately these earbuds are just not functionally sound (pun). The sound quality, fit, charge, aesthetic, and noise cancelling is out of this world, however, these earbuds are plagued with connectivity issues (connecting to iphone XS Max). Sometimes only one earbud connects, sometimes they randomly disconnect, every-time they do connect they take just a moment too long. The worst part- the microphone. It only seems to be getting worse that people can never hear me or all they do hear is all the noise around me except my voice. Even when I'm in my home, I need to shout to get people to hear what I'm saying. A true disappointment because I really love the slick feel and design of these earbuds.

The sony earbuds are fantastic NC earphones. Sound - Excellent NC - Compared to a bose qc 35 its about 80% as effective, you’re only missing out on the effect of having headphones covering your entire ear creating a vacuum. You can really tell a difference with low rumbling sounds from motors, airconditioners, trains, treadmill if at the gym Fit - I’ve tried wearing them while running and they dont fall off. They’re fairly comfortable except that I am experiencing some minor earlobe pain on my left ear when worn for more than an hour. This probably might be because of the shape of my ear though. Sony Headphone app - A bit cumbersome at first but you will get used to it. Pairing is still not as easy as the Apple airpods but has never failed so far. The app sometimes takes a while to recognize your device before you can use it. Over all quiet happy with my purchase would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good pair with ANC.

column8: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE SMALL EARS! THEY WILL NOT STAY ON.
column9: I have never went out of my way to leave a review but I can not believe this. I have had so many issues using them that they are basically a very expensive paperweight. I have to say, in the beggining, altough the call quality was pretty bad (people kept telling me that i sounded like a robot), I was quite happy with the sound quality when playing music from my phone. But when I first got them, I was sick in bed for a couple weeks and they fell off a couple times I didn't think anything of it... so it took me a while to realize when I started getting up again and trying to go out or even do things around the house with them, that I have small ears and due to their design, they would ALWAYS fall off any time i slightly moved my head forward or to the sides, so I quickly stopped doing so after almost losing them a couple times (and I did try several foam and rubber tips to see if that fixed it. Nope. I also tried tugging my ear and pushing when I put them on, did not help either). Well, I thought, when I get my new laptop with Bluetooth I'm going to be able to use them, and since I did like the sound quality and I don't move that much when I work on my laptop, they were finally going to be useful. Wrong again. I finally got the laptop and I was angry to see that I couldn't even use them for that when any audio I tried to play came out cutting. And I highly doubt that my brand new and updated professional laptop is the problem. I saw online many people had the same issue. So now, I cannot really use these headphones mainly because of their faulty design, on top of several other problems, and I would like Sony to take responsibility for their defective design. Do not launch something on the market before it is thoroughly tested and if you plan to cater to only certain people with bigger ear canals, at least warn consumers about it. The headphones themselves work fine, and I would gladly send them back for a refund so I can spend my hard earned money in some headphones i can actually USE... People, be careful and do your research before buying!

I always enjoyed Sony's sound quality and this pair also has great noise cancellation. HOWEVER, they are heavy (8.5g per one) and very uncomfortable wearing. I even felt my ear experienced infection wearing these. They are not safe to wear for anyone who cares about ear health. I contacted Amazon for a return but they insisted charging me a restocking fee, which is outrageous! DO NOT BUY!
Great sound and noise cancellation. Had to return because they kept falling out at the gym. I tried all tip sizes over the span of a week without success. The echo buds solved this problem for me.

These are very large ear buds. The sound and noise cancellation is fine, but not any better than the must less expensive Jabras or Jaybirds. My main issue is the fit of the buds. The left bud fit into my ear just fine, but the right one never fit in my ear and I've never had any issue like this before. I tried every single cover and none were good. It stuck out of my ear quite a bit. The last day I wore them, the right bud just fell out of my ear on the street. The second time it fell out, it bounced right into a drain on the street. Totally unrecoverable. I'm sure I'm SOL on $230 wasted. Aside from that, these had connectivity issues with my iphone. I almost always had to go to Bluetooth in settings to manually connect them.

column8: Great sound great cancelling great phones
column9: These are amazing earphones. Sound quality amazing. Battery life good. Noise cancelation great. Looks good. The biggest issue is that I still get confused on exactly how to use them. Buttons either do different things different times or I regularly forget what they do. Either way I have problems sometimes dropping calls when I was trying to turn up volume. Still I love them.

When they're actually working, the sound is really good! Yet, I cannot get them to stay working for longer than a few minutes. If you pause the audio more than once, they stop playing sound. They're not disconnected, just silent.
