column8: Never ever buy these Pieces of S***
column9: These are HORRIBLE. I read reviews over and over from multiple sites to disregard the Bias sites, well last week me and my Girlfriend each wanted to purchase a pair of wireless headphones and she chose Bose and I chose these. I AM SO MAD AND SAD that I chose these ... Sound - JOKE!! Literally when I started listening to them I took them out and was thinking I had something turned down or was doing something wrong where I asked my girlfriend to listen to them .. The loudest the ear buds go is so low it’s sad for $200 ... the quality is 2/5 of the sound as well but it’s hard to say it has good/bad sound when it’s so quiet that it’s hard to be bad or good... the Base is literally NON EXISTING and songs like rap where you want at least a small bump it distorts the whole song and scrambles... Look - 5/5 - The look is great as they are sexy in my opinion. Feel- They are 5/5 comfortable ! I can’t complain about that as I wear them and forget there in my ears when the music is off. Button Functions - 4/5 - pretty amazing as well as one button functions make it easy to switch modes while in ears. HOWEVER - my left ear seems to drop in and out but it’s not enough to really complain . Set up- 1/5 - Another HORRIBLE feature is the set up.. my girlfriends nose were out of package and connected in 30 seconds and I couldn’t get mine to connect . I had to have my girlfriend set them up and it took her nearly a hour cause she had to hard stop the app a bunch of times, mess with the Bluetooth etc etc .. HORRIBLE Overall 2/5 as I WOULD NEVER EVER EVER recommended these pieces of S*** .. I am turning them in tomorrow and going with the Bose Or the Beats by Dre Pro ...
Could not keep left bud in my ear. These need a rib or brace to hold it in.

column8: They are not silver, they are Taupe. Black ones are black.
column9: I really like these, the reviews are correct, However, the color of the "silver" ones is not silver, its Taupe. I dont understand why they don't have someone on staff who didn't correct the use of the word "silver" through the entire chain process, but let me very clearly state - they are Taupe. The black ones are black. I have both colors.
Very sensitive haptic Control, gets in the way of working out. Haptic Control for the small surface area is totally unnecessary. Calls are pretty bad- AirPods 1 are still far superior in this domain.

Excellent sound. Long listen time wo fatigue. Kinda addictive being isolated in my own space and enjoying music again. Ear comfort, Ease of use and set up with app on iphone8 and mostly the amazing sound make these a favorite purchase.

I found these earbuds to be bulky. They do not fit in my ear very well and hurt after awhile. It would be more convenient for them to have volume control instead of using my phone to adjust. The noise cancellation improves the music sound, but does not actually decrease noise. On a positive note, the sound is awesome.

These Sony wireless ear buds are my favorite tech item. I absolutely love so much about them from the sound quality to the compactness to the battery life. But they are flawed enough that I do not think they deserve five stars. 9 out of 10 if it was possible. How can this be? Read on. (Programming note: I tested these headphones with a useful Spotify playlist called "Songs to Test Headphones With" -- I also listened to my regular music for months and months with these headphones because I enjoy them so much and because it was so hard for me to write this review) Sound quality: Everything begins with the sound quality. The Sony WH1000XM3 over ear headphones have this magical, immersive sound that makes you rediscover music and luxuriate in sound like nothing I've experienced before, despite having listened to some very good mid-range headphones before. The problem with the WH1000XM3 headphones is the size. They are large over the ear headphones. That is what makes the WF-1000xM3 earbuds so incredible. Sony engineers have somehow managed to get 85% of the sound quality of the WH1000xM3 headphones into small ear buds. If sound quality is important to you and you need earbuds you can stuff in a pocket, these earbuds are absolutely exceptional. If you travel everywhere with a bag and this is not an issue, consider the WH1000xM3 over ear phones. There is absolutely no comparison to lesser earbuds like the Samsung Gear Icon X--the Icon X sound like scratchy AM radio after listening to music on the Sony earbuds. Bluetooth phone calls: The quality of bluetooth calls leaves a lot to be desired. In a quiet place, sure its fine. But in any kind of noisy place it is almost impossible to have a call. The aforementioned Gear Icon X do a better job. Sony seems to struggle with bluetooth generally. Bluetooth connection: The earbuds independently connect to bluetooth, which is great, but I suspect they have some issues in terms of bandwidth/transmission, because they seem to work flawlessly in my home but out and about they frequently drop. Perhaps a more technically minded person has more insights. Battery life: Absolutely stunning. Not only have I never run out of charge on the battery case despite being tremendously lazy about charging it, but I've never run out of charge on the buds. This would doubtless change if I wore them on an international flight, but for ordinary daily use, you'll be hard pressed to have battery issues. Fit and comfort: I don't love the fit of these buds. They are a little bigger than the typical earbud and always feel a little awkward when you are walking around. It's important to find a positive fit for both noise cancelling and sound quality, so this may take you a little work. They also are not great earbuds to work out in as they don't tolerate sweat well. That said: they are without a doubt the most comfortable earbuds for long duration listening I've ever used. I even fall asleep wearing these earbuds and wake up hours later with no discomfort. Really exceptional. Noise cancelling: Actually really fantastic BUT Sony has insisted on making the default settings less than full noise cancelling, maybe because they are worried about people walking around and getting run down by cars they don't hear. To take life into your own hands, you have to go into the Sony app and set everything to max. Once you do, the outside world is very effectively blocked out. Yes, you can still hear murmurs, but it knocks everything down twenty decibels. This is amazing for plane rides and other persistently noisy environments. The only problem is that people cannot see the earbuds in your ears and sometimes will end up yelling at you, frustrated that you cannot hear them. About that app: It's a little finicky but absolutely essential to gain control over your earbuds. If I wasn't able to turn off the touch controls on the side of the earbuds, they would be a 2 star product for me. But because I am able to go into the app and control this, the earbuds are much more useful. Ditto some other quirks: if you pull one ear bud out while on a call, the other ear bud persists. If you pull one ear bud out while listening to music it pauses. You can change this in the app as well. I am not sure which way I prefer, but its nice to have the option. You can also let the app analyze your ear shape for a supposedly better quality sound. I haven't gotten around to doing this. If you drop one of your earbuds, Sony has your back by providing a blinking light. This light is only active if the earbud doesn't sense any pressure around it (ie its not in your fingers or your ear). This is pretty clever. Missed opportunities: I do not know why manufacturers insist on putting controls on ear buds. I never use them in a positive fashion and I just end up mistakenly doing things while adjusting my earbuds. Instead, why not make the battery case a remote control? I would also love to see a special edition of the case decked out like a Sony Walkman. Wouldn't that be cool? Overall, I think these earbuds are fantastic. You get truly exceptional sound quality--a balanced and immersive experience that sounds great for everything from classical music to hip hop and rock in between, truly hearing all the details of your music--in a package that fits into a jeans pocket. That's pretty amazing. Add to that very good noise cancelling and excellent battery life. True, the bluetooth calling leaves a lot to be desired and occasional bluetooth drops may frustrate you, but pound for pound, these earbuds are the champs. Recommended!
I say really good over so but I wish the external noise came through better
Prefect sound quality! Best product of the year!

column8: Not anywhere close to Airpod Pro
column9: These are large, cumbersome, and the touch controls are unreliable. I finally ordered the Airpod Pros to replace them. The Airpod Pros have superior noise cancelling and transparency modes, but most importantly, they are much smaller.

I bought these earphones because I liked the look and the noise cancelation feature that were advertised. They were larger and heavier than I thought. Whenever I bent down or had to move a little swiftly, it fell. I changed the tips to ones with the best fit but it was still falling. The connection dropped a couple times which was annoying. During a phone call it’s not noise canceling. Also if you take one earphone off to talk to someone while on the phone, the speaker will automatically be on the phone so you’d have to leave your friend talking by themselves for a while without noticing it. Not being able to control the sound remotely was a little more troubling than I thought it would be. Besides that the sound quality and the active noise canceling was amazing. But I ended up returning this product after a month.
Huge gash on the back leather
Amazing sound quality!

column8: By far the best headphones I've ever had.
column9: The only downtick I have for this product is that the microphone quality is extremely poor. I didn't buy them for the microphone though, I bought them for the exceptional sound quality. I would recommend these to people who need something to block out the noise during public commutes (I take the train / bus transit system, and these work perfectly for reducing white noise).

I made the switch to these earbuds about a month ago and I am so happy with my purchase. The price may be steep for some but, they are so worth it. If you are looking for an intense, immersive noise cancelling experience I would encourage you to look at the over ear models. If you are looking for excellent noise cancelling paired with the convenience and portability of earbuds, you need these.

Al principio como que te cuesta acomodarte al oído, pero mientras lo vas usando todos los días, te acostumbras a las gomitas!!! Pero en si, se escucha perfecto, y los modos de activación de suspensión de ruino ufff, excelente!

column8: Mixed feelings -- but DECENT in conclusion
column9: I have been using the product for about 2 months so far. I am a semi-audiophile that has owned/used various earphones & speakers, etc. PROS 1) Sound -- it has been long since I was truly excited from the sound quality of the earphones. Bose SoundSport Free came close, but that lacked proper seal & came with poor connection issues, etc. Of course Bose QC35 I and II also were decent in sounds, but we want to do apples-to-apples here. Simply the Sony WF-1000XM3 has great sound quality if you can make a few adjustments in EQ & your music player settings. Low bass is underemphasized so people who like thumps and booms will not find these enough. But for people who love to hear the clarity of female vocals & higher-pitched instruments will find these earphones great to listen to. 2) ANC -- decent. -10db in the bass (vs. -20db Airpods Pro); everything else is comparable to the Airpods Pro. Bose QC20 still rules in ANC but then again that is wired ANC earphones and also may give ear pain and/or headaches to some. So Android commuters will find these Sonys a decent option. But the Apple side should just go with Airpods Pro (unless Sound quality trumps your decision, then Sony has a marginal advantage). CONS 1) Comfort -- pretty bad. It is extremely hard to find the right fit & seal. None of the given tips and foams fit my ear canal. I had to get SpinFit 360 S/M sizes. Even then, the fit wasn't perfect - though significantly better than what Sony provided. Airpods Pro trumps in this regard. But it is not all that bad if you are just a regular commuter looking for decent ANC earphones with great sounds. Also of note is that is cheaper than Airpods Pro by about $50. 2) Connection -- is decent, but I have intermittent drops especially in areas with 2.4GHz signals (think of WiFi, radiowaves, etc.). But is not too bad, again, as they connect back pretty quickly. Also, the mobile app has an option to make the connection a priority over the sound quality -- not sure how better this option is though.
Great product, great shipping, great doing business with you.

column8: Great for music - awful for calls
column9: I've used these for 3 months now. I love listening to music and podcasts, but alas they are awful for call. Even in a quiet room I get clipping and strange electrical distortions. I might send them back, but the music part is brilliant - so it is a hard decision indeed. I also like the no blinking when you are wearing them. In a dark room or a car the blinking from my other Sony Head Set is really annoying.

Noise canceling and ambient functions not working, voice prompts not working, Sony app not working, customer support unable to resolve the problem. Nice case.

If they fit my ear, they would be 5 stars all around. I bought them for the noise cancelling and the smallest ear piece is still too big and hurts my ear after awhile. I just can't get them to comfortably fit in my ear.

I am not using the voice control, but all other features are very good. Noise cancellation works nicely. They fit comfortably, the default buds work for me, even after trying all the other ones that come with it. NFC activation is awesome, of all my BT devices, this is the one that pairs/connects the fastest to my phone, laptop and car. I wore them all day in an open office setting with little strain, the switch button between ambient sound and noise cancellation is very useful when a quick conversation arises. Battery life is amazing so far, I never had to recharge during the day even after non-stop use.

column8: The connected app is completely WORTHLES
column9: Great sounding headphones. Some of the user controls that the application allows would be useful if you weren't required to pair the headphones and your phone to a third party app. 1 application is Tidal (the failing music service) the other 2 applications have a half start rating between the two of them. Sony requiring you to pair your phone to these useless apps is the reason I recommend avoiding this purchase.

column8: If you want the best music sound possible this is the product.
column9: Unbelievable sound! I am a music fanatic and this product did not disappoint. Great for listening to music, not great for talking on the phone. 10 for music quality, 5/6 or talking on the phone.

column8: THIS IS NOT A PERFORMANCE REVIEW
column9: This is not a performance review. I was not able to actually listen to the product as it was defective out of the box. The left earbud did not take or hold a charge and would never turn on. Right out of the box the “Used Like New” device was broken. Amazon Warehouse shipped this product and it was an honest waste of my time to receive it. Super disappointed as I was looking forward to these, I have since returned them and just gotten a new pair from Sony directly. Serves me right for trusting the warehouse. Atleast I’ll get my refund.

Overall pleased with purchase Pros: Sound quality is impressive Battery life is good Case recharges earbuds on stored power Ear fit is good and comfortable for hours Cons: They are big Using for calls your voice reverberates in your head Used on an airplane the noise canceling is good but an over the ear device would be better Price point
Very much an excellent product. Noise cancellation was my main reason for purchasing which it does extremely well. Love the case and the buds. Quality product by well established company.
It doesn't include the replacement earbuds though.

PROS: +Sound quality is good +App is amazing, offering plenty of customizable features filled with sound presents and a full EQ +Build quality is great, quality hard plastics that feel very solid and well built. CONS: -ANC makes my stomach turn. I have tried a number of ANC headphones and earbuds and I have never had this problem until I tried this pair. -Due to the size of these earbuds, they're not very stable and can fall out easily -Another drawback of the size is that they have various contact points with my ear, causing discomfort over time -Touch controls aren't great. Although they were very responsive, they just don't offer enough options. Because of this, I had to omit volume controls in favor of ANC/ambient sound on the left ear and playback controls on the right ear. -The lack of volume controls presented a huge problem because the when connecting to my pc, the earbuds would automatically set their current volume as the max volume. This meant that if I was connect to my phone, listening at 50% volume and then switched over to use them with my pc, that 50% volume automatically became 100% volume on my pc. The only way to adjust volume any louder would be to turn on volume controls on the earbuds and manually turn up the volume. -Connection was poor and consistently broke up. Not great, look somewhere else.

I've had these for a month or so. I really like them. The first pair shipped would emit a high-pitched noise out the right ear. Like really ringing.. like a broken hearing aid... Exchanged them after suspecting the noise-cancelling mic on the right bud was bunk. Exchange was quick and easy. These sound really good. I have a bunch of earbuds and A LOT of headphones. These stand up to most of them. Definitely ones in the same price range. The highs can be a bit harsh if pushed and it takes some adjustment to get the bass right but these have become my new favorites. The noise cancelling is better than my best noise cancelling headphones (Beats Studio 3). I have not tried them on an airplane yet but in all environments I've tested, these are better noise-cancelling. I'm guessing it's because they literally plug your ear, rather than cup over it. Battery life is good so far. The case is a charger for the buds which is really cool. The app is a bit clunky and sometimes there's bluetooth connectivity issues. It would be great if these were easier to pair, especially with non-phone media players. Also whenever I get a phone call, my ringer is deafening... This is mainly the reason for the 4-star rating. As a standalone noise-cancelling earbud, these are great. Hopefully software can be fixed.

Yes I did know when I purchased these they were not specifically for active lifestyles but didn't know they would fall out so easily. I tried most of the buds to fit my ear the best, went throught the tutorials etc. but it didn't seem to phase the buds from falling out. Everything else the headphones advertise (sound (360), noise cancellation, phone etc., are spot on except the minimal abilitiy to maintain in the ear even during moderate I will sadly be returning these and will be in search of a more sporty with a better hold in my ear.
Thank you they work great.

Got these to wear under my earmuffs for work. My boyfriend gave me the Sony noise cancelling headphones for my birthday last year and I thought they were absolutely amazing with sound quality and their ability to cancel noise. I bought these to use in addition to those and they are absolutely incredible. Extremely easy to connect if you have the app and they have such a quick charge. Sleek look and feel. They come with a variety of different sized rubber tips to insure a perfect fit. Two dofferent materials as well. Noise cancellation seems to be equivalent to the headphones. Bluetooth connections seems strong too so you can set your ohone down and continue to move around. Very highly recommended product right here.

Airpods won't stay in my ears and I wanted an earbud alternative to my Bose Quiet Comfort over-the-ear headphones (which I love but don't always want full headphones—especially for a video conference or when wearing a hat). I had originally planned on getting the Bose SoundSport since I've been so pleased with the QC35, but the Sony WF-1000XM3 had even better reviews and a fantastic refurb price so I gave them a shot. PROS + Sound: Clear and defined range (360 Reality "surround" is UNREAL) + Noise Cancelation: best available + Fit: Secure and comfortable + Charge: Workday + case holds 3 more + Bluetooth: great range and easy connection + EQ: Customizable with app* CONS (neither bother me) - Case: At least twice as big as airpod case, so not as pocket-friendly, but fine for a bag or on desk. - IPX: NO RATING for water/sweat proof but these are professional/noise-canceling, not sport earbuds. * App: I saw a ton of bad reviews and got nervous but haven't had any trouble with the Sony app for iOS with customizable EQ etc. I've always been disappointed that the Bose app didn't include an EQ.

column8: Ended up returning these for the headphone version...
column9: The quality and features of the earbuds and headphones are the same HOWEVER, the earbuds would not sit right and would fall out after a little while. So I purchased the headphone version and I am VERY happy.

column8: Noise cancelling is great, app and charging case iffy.
column9: Noise cancelling is fantastic, definitely the selling point for these earbuds. The charging case has held up well so far, but the design seems a bit flimsy. Sound quality is average for the price range, but still very good. Biggest issue with it is the headphone companion app!

column8: They are good, just not great
column9: They really hurt my ears and I’ve tried all the inserts available.

column8: Noise cancellation didn't mean what I thought
column9: My children have AirPods, so I thought "noise cancellation" meant, like the Apple product, that the person to whom I was speaking wouldn't hear a lot of the noise in my environment. It's quite the opposite -- they hear EVERTHING. Any time I put these in and try to accomplish even a minor task like picking up items around the house while I'm talking, without fail, the person on the other end says, "WHAT are you doing?" I can't imagine what they'd hear if I tried to do something like wash dishes or cook supper, which is what I got them for -- so that I could work while I talk. If you want these so that they'll cancel out all the noise in your environment for you -- that is, you couldn't hear the doorbell if it rang or a dog if it barks, they're excellent for that. Excellent - I can't hear a thing. I don't really know why I'd want that though. The person on the other end of the line knows what's going on in my house more than I do. I'll grant that I should have researched what "noise cancelling" meant; I'm just writing this in case anyone else has the same misunderstanding as I did.

Stellar sound quality (rich sound engine). They're the best ear buds I've used so far. I think it's worth it. Had weird problems trying to connect with my android phone initially, but I think the updates fixed it. Battery life is not bad.

SO, read lots of reviews, good and bad. I recently got the Sennheiser Momentum 2's and the Galaxy + buds. Sennheiser is descent all around but needs improvements. Galaxy + were a huge disappointment for me, bad fit, lacking sound etc etc.... A few weeks ago I got the over the ear Sony WH1000XM3's and was so impressed with those, I had to try these. Got them today, fit is very good (I have larger sized ears) and the sound is awesome! I was very very surprised and impressed with the sound which is very deep and full like the over the ears one (just not as good but close). I get that seal that is needed, they remain in my ears with no issues and after 1 hr, I had no problems with comfort. I got the silver ones and love them. I did get these at 1/2 the price on an open box/unused purchase elsewhere but they are worth the full price if you get them on Amazon. I did not test the phone calls yet and have not put the battery to full test so that will come in time. If I get 6 hours out of them, I will be very satisfied. I also noted the noise cancelling to be excellent for in-ear buds. They will never be as good as over the ears but they are quite good and will get tested when I cut the lawn tomorrow. When I cut the lawn last week I wore the Galaxy Buds and all I heard was the lawnmower so that will be a good test. I am really glad I got these, especially at the price I paid and I got the 2 year square trade for peace of mind. I would highly recommend these...just don't understand the bad reviews I read on lacking sound, lacking noise cancelling, fit.....they are all great for me and my ears. I have 3 of the wired SHURE ear buds and these sound better than any of those, even the $800 pair that I wish I never got.
